choices: Lots of mega anthros, but only several humans
1.content: You are in the middle of a very strange dream. You see a giant anthro animal, but you cannot tell what kind it is. All that you know is that it was absolutely huge. It was holding something in its paw, or was it a scaly claw? Was it holding your house, a city, the whole planet?! The oddest thing, though, was that you were not scared at all. Though you were a speck, a speck of a speck, to this huge anthro, you knew that he or she would not hurt anyone, and would always be there for you. The next part of the dream is fuzzy right before you wake up, but it has something to do with how many mega-anthros and tiny humans were in your dream.
1.title: Dreaming of Titans

10.content:
You weren't the only one to be affected by this mysterious dream, and that which came after. It turned out that at least one other individual was gonna wind up in a similar boat, if not the same boat.

Swapover, All or Nothing: You swap places with your megafur counterpart in a universe where nearly everything's super-huge but everyone has super eyesight, super hearing, super touch and super volume control.

Giga Comrade: You and someone you know well enter this other reality but while you remain an ordinary human s/he becomes a megafur.

Swapover, Mind over Matter: You switch minds with your counterpart in a megafur reality who's the same size and species as you are.

Royally Blessed: You and at least one of your family enter another reality where at least one of your family members transforms into a titanic anthro monarch.
10.title: Mix-and-Match

101.content:
You don't know what happened but it seemed as though everyone you knew was being transformed into truly immense anthropomorphic animals and yet they still treated you like you remember. You begin to stir from this strange dream to find yourself in the midst of a great landscape of rolling off-white hills and valleys, wearing nought but your nightie. The ground beneath you is wonderfully soft and slightly warm in contrast to the distinct chill rolling across this landscape, which upon closer inspection appears to have a series of faint lines criss-crossing it. Just then you hear distant but powerful foot-falls, gradually getting more and more powerful, signifying the approach of something really huge. When you find that those footsteps are beginning to resonate through the ground beneath your bare feet you suddenly realise that this landscape is actually an enormous pillow!

Straining your eyes you see that everything around you is like a vastly overgrown version of your bedroom. The curtains, the wardrobe, everything was familiar but immense. You jump to the conclusion that you've somehow been shrunk and those foot-falls belong to someone in your family. Before long you hear a mighty, booming and yet proportionately quiet voice calling out.

"Are you up yet?" It was your mother. You become rather frantic over the possibility that she wouldn't be able to hear you or see you and thus you'd be thrust into an adventure in your own home to successfully alert at least one family member to your presence and condition before you get killed or, alternatively, she manages to spot you but becomes so overwhelmed that she could well faint or panic and carry out actions blindly, which would increase your risk level. At any rate you decide to give it a try when she calls out in a voice more fitting to the situation. "YOUNG LADY, ARE YOU AWAKE?"

"I AM MOM!" You shout. "BUT I SEEM TO BE IN AN UNBELIEVABLE PREDICAMENT! PLEASE, COME IN!"
101.title: Waking to a World of Titans

choices: "Oh no! What have we done?" (She knows how this happened)
"Oh dear! What could my little girl be doing?" (Contemplates your other self)
"Oh, sweetie. How could you possibly cope?" (Thinking about your new life)
1011.content:
You watch the door swing open, its sheer size bringing to mind the break-up of Pangaea in the Mesozoic, and you beheld the figure of your mother. You couldn't help but gape; not only was she incomprehensibly huge but she was an anthropomorphic rabbit. The look on her face made you quiver as she frowned.

"Whatever do you mean?" She spoke firmly, but her voice didn't roar or boom like you'd expect. "What could...?" She stopped and her frown became a similar expression of amazement to the one you were likely to be exhibiting. She took a couple of steps closer, allowing you to observe her more thoroughly. She was barefoot, but otherwise she had on a green skirt that hung about halfway down her calves and a blouse that wasn't quite light enough to be sky-blue but was heading that way. She knelt down with a mighty thud and stared right at your figure, making you fall on your rear as you found yourself staring right into her mouth. There was no doubt that, by your standards, she could inhale thousands of aircraft in one go. "W...WHAT HAPPENED?" She asked at a volume you'd expect from her size but it still wasn't dangerously loud. "Why are you so tiny?!? Are you... human?" Sitting up you took a deep breath, pushing down the sense of dread that came from seeing those massive incisors just past her lips, and answered.

"Yes. But why are you a rabbit?" The disbelieving stare she exhibited now became one more of confusion. "Have I really shrunk?" You mutter, not realising she can still hear you clearly.

"Honey," Your mother asks, "What can you remember?" You recollect all you can in this short space of time. As you finish your mother lifts her head away from the bed and brings a paw up to her muzzle in an expression of worry or something like that. What she says next knocks you a bit.
1011.title: Continue this Storyline

choices: A humongous dining room. She'd taken you downstairs.
Your mother's lagomorphic face smiling down at you.
10112.content:
You look up at your mother's face with a touch of puzzlement after she says this.

"If you're here with us," She remarks, "Then the little bunny I know could be where you came from." Your jaw drops at this. "There's been plenty of speculation about the diversity in society and how we can pick out such fine details, particularly with indications that this has developed naturally through the centuries." You try to picture how it would be if you'd woken in a land where everything's smaller than your little toe, populated by creatures you'd only ever heard about in stories, and quiver at the possibility that, while your massive rabbit mother was addressing you with such gentleness, your ordinary human mother might be cowering behind the sofa as your giant rabbit self looked at your neighbourhood clasped in between her furry digits.

You're startled as the pillow depresses, sending you tumbling towards your mother's paw. You manage to grab a single strand of fur before she lifts her hand. "No matter." She says. "You're here with us now, so we're gonna have to look after you. You're still my little girl." She had a momentary laugh at this, shaking you so that you might have fallen off if she hadn't turned her wrist, so where her finger formed a furry wall before now it was the floor. You curled up from the combination of uncertainty about your new life as a microscopic person and the early morning chill. "Oh dear. You're such a tiny thing you must be frozen in that little nightie." Before you knew it you tumbled down her curling finger into the depression of her knuckle. She was so massive that by the time you came to a stop she'd already encased you in this merest portion of her fist.

After getting your bearings you began to use your mother's fur as support for your climb to the top of her fist. Every movement she made shook you, nearly sending you falling back down, possibly all the way through her fist if you weren't careful. She hardly said anything as you climbed, making you wonder if she could feel you hauling your way up her finger. Finally you reached the top, momentarily blinded as your head poked out of her fist before you saw...
10112.title: All Aboard

104.content:
You awaken and hold your head in pain. "Ouch," you mumble. "What happened? My head feels so sore." Then in surprise, you look and see you're in a bright green carriage of some kind and you look past to see you were going through a city made up of jade. From the looks of it, you were in some kingdom that appeared to combine the medieval world with a touch of modern culture given the way some of the people were dressed. "Huh?" you ask. "Oh good," says a voice. "You're finally awake."

You turn your head and look in surprise because you see a woman dressed in jade chain mail with a strange mask and long black hair. "Who are you?" you ask. "What's going on here? Are you some kind of kidnappers." The woman waves her hand and shakes her head. "No, no," she says. "It's nothing sinister, Your Highness." You give a confused blink. "Your Highness? Is this some kind of prank." "No. It's not a prank. We are on orders from the newly crowned queen to bring her son and heir to the castle." What that woman said confused you. Your mom was no queen. Not as far as you remembered. She could act larger than life at times, but royal? That was a funny thought. "Lady," you say. "There has to be some mistake. I'd think if my mom was a queen, I would've known it long ago."

You then look out the window of the carriage and see that as you're leaving the town, there was a stretch of lush green land where there appeared to be no signs of civilization. "Where are we going?" you ask. "You said we were going to the castle." "We are," says the guard. "But the castle is a journey away from the rest of the kingdom." "Why is that?" "Because if it weren't, your mother might accidentally destroy all buildings close to the castle." You give a scoff. "I'm not sure if I believe what you're saying about my mom being the queen, but I do know that she's not a klutz." The guard looks in confusion. "How could you not notice that... uh... nothing." You scratch your head but decide to go along with... whatever it is that's going on.

Hours go by and you wonder exactly how long these people are going to continue with their joke, when you see something up ahead. It looked like a jade castle that looked like something out of a fairytale, complete with a briar fence and bright flowers. You give a whistle but then you look in surprise because the gate goes on for miles, as do the walls and as the carriage gets closer, the castle appears bigger and bigger. You and the guard exit the carriage and she walks you up to the door. Or more specifically, she walks you under the door because the door was so colossal that you'd have to climb three skyscrapers just to reach the doorknob which was too big for you to turn as it was. "Who designed this castle?" you think to yourself. "It looks like something out of Jack and the Beanstalk."

That's when you're forced to plug your ears as two trumpeters sound off and the guard brings you further into the castle. "My queen," says the guard as she bows. "Your son has been found." You roll your eyes, thinking that this was still some weird joke, but then you hear shaking and feel earthquakes in the ground. It sounded as if something large was coming. This was an accurate description because at that moment, right in front of you, hidden by a loud and frilly skirt, landed an enormous paw like that of a feline. The paw was big enough to crush several city blocks at once and the claws were painted with gold nail polish.

As you look up at the queen, you're completely dumbfounded. Her face and her golden brown hair were definitely those of your mother, but there were a few, not so minor differences. First off, she was wearing a regal Victorian-style dress with a bejeweled tiara that you'd never expect your mom to wear. Next, she was an anthropomorphic lioness with gold colored fur and bright green cat's eyes. Third, she was very obese, especially in the stomach and rear, the latter filling out her enormous skirt and then some. And as for the last part, your regal lioness mother was colossal. You peg her height as being at least as tall as 10 skyscrapers stacked upon one another. She could probably fit everyone of her subjects in her mouth at once.

The lioness queen holds up a pair of opera glasses to get a good look at you just to confirm it's you. This winds up confirming the claims that she was your mother as she then speaks in your mom's voice. "I was wondering when you were going to show up." You give a look of surprise right before your monarch mother lowers one of her mountain-sized hands to pick you up and take you to her enormous face. You find yourself face to face with lips as big as canyons as the queen smiles at you. "Mom?" you ask in surprise. "What's going on? How did you become so big. Why are you a lion? What's this I hear about you being the queen?" Your giant mother just shrugs her shoulders before plopping down in her massive throne that creaks as her big royal booty squeezes into it.

"Heck if I know, sweetie," says your mother. "I just woke up this morning like this. But why look a gift horse in the mouth. After all, we are royalty." Your mom places you right behind her tiara as you try to figure out exactly what is going on.
104.title: Hey! It's the Queen!

105.content:
Giga daemon: You and your faithful pet(s) enter another reality (with, or without megafurs) where your pet(s) transform into titanic anthro(s), while you become linked with them, sharing feelings and eventually thoughts.

Swapover, Mind over love: You switch minds with your mate's counterpart in a megafur reality who's the same size as you, but the sex and specie of your mate, while your megafur counterpart is your mate.
105.title: Other

11.content:
(Here are some starter storylines)

Mega-Sized Deity: You wake up, and oddly you are in a temple. Unaware to you, your universe is now ruled by an enormous anthro god or goddess, and you are one of his or her head priests.

Big Brother/Sister: You wake up into a universe where your family adopted a mega-sized anthro, the only one in the world, and now its your sibling.

Runaway Project: You wake up in a universe where a mega-sized anthro, created by the government, escaped. The anthro is already huge and is still growing, and in addition may have super powers. Also, you happen to be the human that befriended this huge anthro.

Righteous Ruler: You wake up in a world run by a mega-sized anthro king or queen. This monarch rules justly and fairly, but firmly as well, and nobody dares try to overthrow it nor wishes to. You are a beloved member of his or her court; may it be a knight, government official, even a jester.
11.title: Just One, But It's a Big One

111.content:
You are vigorously awakened from your dream by an odd looking bald man wearing golden robes. "Rise, chosen one, rise, the ceremony is about to begin!" You are very confused by what is happening, especially since you were sleeping in a lavishly decorated bed and also wearing golden robes. You are whisked through large passageways and into a huge hall, where an impossibly large purple gem made up the roof and the floors were covered in a fine black carpet. You are amazed by the beauty of the temple, where some sort of religion you never heard of must be practiced. You ask your escort what is going on.

"Ah, chosen one, I see that your excitement has blurred your senses and reason, but that is definitely expected. I probably wouldn't believe it myself! You have been chosen to be the Great Mother's next head priest!"

"Great Mother?" you reply.

"Yes, the Grand Parent, the Goddess of all that is Good, our beloved divine ruler and savior! I believe you prefer to refer to her by her true name, Ayla."

You notice many other priests kneeling on the black carpet in complete solitude in a circle. You are directed to the center of the group and can feel power well up in you, though you do not understand it. You start to kneel yourself, but a voice in your head tells you to remain standing. The power grows greatly, and to your surprise you start to levitate off the ground! You continue to rise up into the air towards the very high purple ceiling. You think you are going to hit it, but instead you pass through the gemstone like water. You can still breathe, and your body feels cleansed with every breath that you take. You rise for hundreds of feet until you break through the surface of the purple ceiling, causing it to ripple.

A million things hit you at once. All around you you see the curvature of the Earth, and realize that you are many miles above the surface. You look down, and notice the temple below start to look smaller. Looking down, you first realize that the temple is round with long golden corridors reaching out from opposite sides. The ground it is on is black just like the carpet, and you realize it must be the same material. You realize that the temple is wrapped around a huge pillar, one of four of different lengths, and a fifth one nearby...

You do a double take. That temple is on the ring finger of a giant black furry hand! Slowly, you rise your head, to see the humongous face of a jet black jackal, a divine goddess hundreds of miles tall. In her other paw is a massive marble sceptre, which is tilting towards you. As you are pressed against the hilt of the sceptre, a pearl the size of a small city, you hear a divine female voice echo throughout you and the rest of the world:

"Congratulations, head priest, and may your leadership be known throughout history. Now, let us all begin the celebration!"
111.title: Coronation

1111.content:
Ayla, the jet black jackal goddess of Earth, rose from her throne overlooking mankind. Your floating body rose with her, always staying level with her face. At six hundred miles, she was definitely a sight to behold, dressed only in an ethereal robe and more jewelry than you thought could be made with Earth's resources. Placing the sceptre against her throne, which was many times taller than any mountain, your goddess brought her free hand forth, summoning forth a huge flat surface out of nowhere. You gaze in amazement as Ayla performs her magic; she apparently has the ability to create objects.

Holding the surface like a silver platter, the jackal next thrust it into the air. Immediately multicolored dust rises from every corner of the planet, gathering in a coat on the platter. You see some of the dust pass by you and recognize them as people; Ayla is bringing everyone on Earth to her. You even see a little golden dust rise from the ring/temple on her massive finger.

You can only imagine what it must be like, having everyone in the world bowing down to Ayla and you. "My beloved people, let us begin the festivities!" cries the goddess to her subjects. "We shall start with a great feast, with plenty of food for all."

The surface of the silver platter changes, but at your distance you cannot tell by sight. However, as a chair pops up under you and a table appears in front of you piled high with every kind of food imaginable, you must think that everyone else is receiving the same treatment.

When you had first seen what was going on, you had assumed that Ayla was a demanding goddess, expecting loyalty and servitude from all of her human followers. Now you realize that this is clearly not the case. Ayla is turning out to be incredibly generous and caring to all of mankind, and probably wouldn't even hurt a fly, even if she could fit a small country in her paw. Humanity worships this jackal goddess and is completely devoted to her only because she truly deserves it.

As you eat your meal, you realize that no matter how much you eat, the piles of food do not grow smaller. Apparently, in this new world you have woken up in, world hunger is unheard of. You imagine that Ayla has also prevented the existence of many more of your previous life's evils, like war or disease. You start to feel very fortunate right now that this odd life switch occurred.

When everyone finished eating, all of the food disappeared. You think that the celebration is over, but it turns out that it is far from over. In fact, Ayla announces how long your celebration will last.
1111.title: Everyone's Invited

11111.content:
"And now," Ayla announces, "We shall have a dance." The scenery on the silver platter changes from that of a banquet hall to that of a ballroom; by the looks of it she has selected the best musicians for the orchestra. Everyone stands in ranks looking up at the both of you expectantly.

"Go ahead," She speaks to you by telepathy, "Choose the music, High Priest." You look down at the people waiting for the dance to begin. You don't want to keep them waiting but, since you've only just arrived in this world, you feel discomfort about having such a high position.
11111.title: The Start of a Religious Holiday

111111.content:
"We can reminise later," Ayla tells through your mind, "Please choose the music." You feel nervous about her words but also reassured; you think to the matter in hand.

"I think we could have..." You hesitate as you try to think of a good piece for all-round dancing.
111111.title: Choosing the Music

choices: Follow the Story of your Memories
1111111.content:
Almost immediately after you chose the music the orchestra began playing In the Mood while the people danced to the tune in anyway they could think of.

The dance lasted for quite a while and included a waltz, the foxtrot (in honour of Ayla's canine form), the jitterbug and even the twist amongst others.

During each dance you felt Ayla incur somethings in your mind. You begin to see your life in this universe unfold; the phenomena of post-cognition.
1111111.title: Hitting the Dance Floor

11112.content:
You're stunned. 'A whole week!' You think to yourself. 'What will everyone do in that time? What kind of celebrations could fill that much time?' You look towards the platter upon which the whole of Earth's population are attending your coronation. Now that the feast is over you wonder what Ayla, the wonderful divine goddess, has in store for the people now.

"Now that everyone has feasted well," She addresses all present, "We will now..."
11112.title: One Week!

1112.content:
"Quick! Grand Vizier!" A voice urgently addresses you. "Everyone's ready for the celebration; you don't want to be late." You look up and see a man clad in purple robes standing over your bed; you're confused by his words but it must be very important. Clearly you are not in your original home.

You rise and get dressed, after insisting on doing it yourself, in gold robes with white threads running through them to give them a more flashy and fluid appearance compared to plain gold. You follow the man out of what must be your bedroom as far as anyone here is concerned and ask him about what he's told you.

"You must've been ever so excited," He comments, "For you to forget the facts. It is the New Year; the celebration of creation, when the divine god brought forth all that exists." You're not really sure what he's referring to.

"Who is the great god to whom you refer?" You ask him, nerouvs about what could happen just for asking that.

"Why, the most powerful being ever known. Protector of life and giver of joy. His name invokes awe, respect and happiness in all who speak and hear it... Hovalla." You admit that the name of the god is a most heroic-sounding name.

Finally you enter a large hall within the temple; it is ever so vast that it's a wonder alone in how so much space can be found under one roof without it caving in. At the other end of the hall is a most impressive statue; a very realistic anthropomorphic lion statue at least 200 feet high. You figure that it must be a portrayal of Hovalla.

"It's not to scale." Your priest-guide informs you.

"I can believe that." You comment, thinking how many civilisations have built statues of gods much bigger than they believed the gods to really be.

"Don't worry," He continues, "His divine greatness is always ready to deliver information and awe to those who forget." You wonder what happens now.

The priest-guide signals for you to go up to the statue. It is a long walk across the hall over marble tiles. As you head towards the statue you hear priests entering behind you, obviously ready to perform the ceremony. Finally you come to the foot of the statue and decide to turn. You see that a major consignment of priests have congregated in the hall and are forming ranks in the vast space.
1112.title: Grand Vizier

11121.content:
Once the doorways leading into the hall seem to be empty of priests entering you decide that this must be the time and prepare to perform what you'd expect to be a ritual honouring and thanking this god. Something seems to be stopping you though; you feel that some kind of subconscious telepathy must be going on. You can't hear a voice in your head but you feel that something or someone is speaking to your whole body via your subconscious.

After standing in front of the statue for a while you then feel your body moving through some unheard commands. Your arms stick out in front of you and begin pushing downwards somewhat limply; the priests kneel. Then you turn to the statue and begin reciting something that you can neither understand nor control. After that you feel like something's just let go of you; you attempt to kneel.

"There is no need," This is real telepathy now, "Remain standing my cute little vizier." You look up at the statue, thinking that it's come to life; it is just the same as it ever was.

Suddenly something very strange occurs. The ceiling of the hall becomes transparent and a starry sky appears through it; you and all the other priests look directly through the transparent roof of the hall. An astonishing sight now forms.

There before you, right outside the hall's ceiling, a vast eye appears. A golden orb radiating pure contentment with a pupil darker than space but with a shine like that of a real eye; the cornea and eyelids are unseen as this eye seems to be bigger than the hall in which you reside.
11121.title: The Eye of (the) God

111211.content:
"This New Year is a special one." That same voice you heard in your head now comes from beyond the hall; Hovalla is really speaking to you all now. "It has been exactly ten thousand years since the planet Earth came into being. I hereby declare that all who are of Earth origin shall partake of a grand banquet on this day." You stand where you are looking into the massive orb of an eye with awe and admiration of Hovalla's divinity. You wonder how he will ensure that everyone will be able to attent the feast.

Your answer soon comes as the roof of the hall seems to vanish completely. Hovalla's eye retreats out of sight and you feel yourself levitating towards the hole where once the roof was; the other priests are following behind you. As you float out of the temple you look down at it as you float higher and higher. After a while you realise that the temple is in fact a ring on one of Hovalla's fingers. The scale of it suggests that it is multi-storey, which makes your comprehension of Hovalla's scale infathomable.

In the distance you see the Earth retaining its familiar shape. Various dots are swarming off it. Initially you think that these dots are all the people on Earth but, as you float towards wherever Hovalla is sending you, you can see that all other mammals are among them. Clearly Hovalla has the power to allow all species to live together in harmony, or at least groups of species. Finally you see where you are heading for. A vast silver platter has formed over Hovalla's right hand, while the temple has on his left hand. Upon this platter wonderfully decorated brass walls separate each species into different halls where they will feast.

You float down right at the head of the table where all humans are being seated by the great god. At the moment the table is just a huge mahogany surface, nothing is on it. It takes a while for all the mammals on Earth to arrive but once they do Hovalla speaks again.

"Let the feast begin." Immediately a vast mountain range of every food humans can eat appears on the table and people begin to tuck in. Initially you're confused as to how someone could access a sort of food that is out of their reach until you see a priest actually summoning an apple to his hand from fifty feet down the table. Understanding the nature of the banquet you...
111211.title: Hovalla addresses his Priests

11122.content:
"Your majesty." Someone addresses you bizarrely. "The Great Goddess of the Stars requests your presence." You look up to see someone who looks like a cross between an archbishop and a druid standing over you. You get a general idea of what has happened and wish to clarify a few things.

"I shall see her as soon as I'm dressed." You tell him as you get up. "I wish for it to be made clear as to the identity of the goddess." The priest, or whatever he was, seems to be a bit confused by this but answers.

"Only the one who brought all nations of the world together in peace; she who has brought the end to famine and pestilence. The one who has ensured that all life can live in harmony; she is more commonly known as Kitsune." He pronounced the 'e' as in 'Kit-su-neigh'.

Once dressed you follow him through the corridors of what appears to be your palace. Here and there are the most bizarre looking tapestries; they show astonishing feats occuring while the sky is dominated by an anthropomorphic fox. Eventually you enter a particular chamber.

It is a lavishly decorated room with a clear use of symbolism; you figure it must be a sort of royal chapel. You walk forward through a golden archway but what lies beyond is staggering. A pathway leads forward to a varanda, beyond which is a chasm which seems to drop forever and what seems to be a gap for a bridge, except that it looks as though the bridge has been demolished.

"Remember, sire," The priest calls from behind you, "'Only a leap from the path of purity will he pass'." You look ahead and first think that it's impossible to leap across the chasm without falling in but it seems that this is the only way to the goddess.
11122.title: Your Goddess is Calling

choices: I have a special task for you."
I got lonely all by myself."
111221.content:
You looked over the edge of the demolished bridge, trying to see just how deep that this little pit was; maybe it was long but shallow or something like that. That hope was quickly dashed; the chasm was impossibly deep, the bottom-assuming that there even was one-well beyond your sight, and part of you wondered if this crack split the Earth down to the core. No way! You thought, almost violently. This is impossible! No one can do this!! You look back to the preistly figure, almost as though this entire thing was somehow his fault; all you got in return was a 'go on' motion. Turning back to the gap, you scowled at the open air. Damn it all; might as well go out with my dignity. Moving your foot from solid ground, you closed your eyes, shifted your weight and just waited for the sensation of falling into a bottemless pit to take over.

It never came.

Opening your eyes once more, you almost gasped in shock. Where there had been nothing but open air had been not even seconds previously, a complete bridge now spanned the gap; how did that just happen?! Wait a minute You thought, your brain actually working once again. Kitsunes are tricksters It was a conscious effort for you to not slam your face into your palm for forgetting that; as it was, you just continued onward. The other side of the bridge slowly came into view, and you started to wonder about the image that you had seen prior to this; how accurate was that image? Was this 'goddess' really an antropomorphic fox? Was she really as big as the tapestries made her out to be? What did she want with you? All these questions and countless others swirled around your mind as you reached the end of the bridge and stepped onto solid ground once more.

The scenery suddenly vanished, replaced by nothing but blackness as far as you could see in every direction and probably beyond. You were still on some sort of black ground, but you couldn't really tell just what that ground was. After getting over the initial shock, panic started to set in; what just happened? Where were you? What the hell was going on?!!!??!?! "Thank you for coming." A voice that was so angelic and loud that very well might have been the voice of God, if God was a female, spoke out of the blackness. "For a little bit, I was afraid that my little joke had put you off." Your eyes widened at this; this voice, this beautiful, powerful, divine voice, was that of the goddess that you had been supposedly summoned by.

"It was no trouble." You say, remembering the part that you were suppose to be playing. "But, if I may be so bold to question, would you kindly reveal yourself to me."

A chuckle from that voice sounded, actually causing the ground to shake slightly. "I already have; in a way." You were about to ask what she meant, when you started to rise into the air. Another few moments of panic followed, but the goddess spoke once more. "Don't worry; I'm very gentle." There was a chuckle on the end of the sentance, but more an amused one than one that spoke to malicious intent; either way, there wasn't much you could do about it. Several moments passed without anything happening but more of the black landscape becoming visible; when you started to see large strips of orange ground surrounding the black. Longer passed, then you started to see the black and orange land for a recognizable shape; a HAND! You had been standing on a hand that probably could have held the entire solar system within it!!! "Now you're starting to get it." The Kitsune's voice spoke from a recognizable direction this time, causing you to turn toward it; and you very nearly passed out from shock and a twinge of fright. There was the snout of an impossibly large fox face, a feminine one at that, just within your feild of view. "Oops" The fox spoke, her impossibly massive jaws moving in time with the words. "Too close, sorry." You moved, much faster than before, away until you had a perfect view of her full, nude, and surprisingly attractive body. It was then that you realized that the tapestries hadn'y shown her size accurately; they had scaled her down! She gave another chuckle as you sanpped out of your stupor and blushed as you realized that you had been staring shamelessly at her for a few moments now. "Like what you see?" She questioned, flirtatiously; actually spinning to reveal her full, parsecs tall, figure to you.

You swollowed, shaking your head to clear it as you looked at her once more; noting that she seemed to be leaning on empty space before you. For a goddess, Kitsune seemed to act more like a teenager. "W-why have you summoned me?" You finally managed to spit out; causing her to frown a little bit. Apparently, she was hoping that you'd play along for a little bit.

"Okay, if you wanna get straight to the point." She said, sounding a little bit bored. "You're here cause-"
111221.title: Leap of Faith

112.content:
You wake up in your bed and stretch. It's a brand new day, the first day of summer, and school has ended. You can't wait to play with your friends all summer long.

However, getting out of bed, you notice something that you have never seen before by your bed. It is a book, a photo album of sorts, and it has your name, "Jake" on the front. Curious, you open the book and flip through the pages.

There is a picture of you when you were very little, just a wee baby. You see your mom holding you and your dad by your moms side, but there is a weird sharp cream-colored thing on the ground. And in the next photo, you are lying on the tip of that weird thing and your parents are standing around it. You don't remember anything from that long ago, but still the picture looks odd.

In another photo, you think you are taking your first steps by the way your mom is supporting you, but the background looks weird. It's a goldish yellow color, but none of your walls look like that. You and your mother are also standing on a black surface about as wide as your room, and you cannot recognize that either.

On the last page, you are the age you are now, and you and your parents are standing in front of your house. However, this picture looks very wrong, as the grass is gold colored, wider than you, and several blades are much taller than the house. The sky looks wrong too; it is black and yellow with weird ripples...

Suddenly, you are very afraid. The sky in that picture looks exactly like an eye. And the grass in that picture looks more like hair than grass. You look at some of the earlier pictures and have a double take. That baby is lying in some sort of giant claw, and you are taking your first steps on some sort of super sized black hair! What could this possibly mean?

You open your windows to let some light in, but instead of the sun, you see that same eye you saw in the picture! You jump back as the eye blinks, and an eyelash thicker than you are tall lightly sweeps the window. Suddenly, a booming voice comes from far below, from a creature that must be at least fifty miles tall:

"Good to see you awake, little bro!"
112.title: Lion Brother

1121.content:
You cannot believe that a feline that huge can exist, much less be your brother. You look down so you do not look at his huge eye, but that does not help: you see that your house is on a huge white pole that goes way down, until it disappears between the lions massive digits.

"Hey, bro, are you okay?" spoke the huge beast. Quite unexpectedly, the wall to your room swung down and you are shaken onto the huge snout of your supposed sibling. You look back, and your house looks like it is resting on the head of a pin. However, a huge cream colored claw turned your head back towards the behemoth's concerned eyes. "It's okay, you can tell me anything, I'll understand."

"Um, I guess it was just a bad dream," you lie. You definitely do not feel comfortable talking with a fifty-plus mile tall anthro lion, even if it is acting very understanding.

"Well, you don't worry about those bad dreams, because your big brother Leonard will protect you!" The lion gives you a tiny tap to the cheek with a stadium sized knuckle. "Here, I'll bring you to the cliff now, the pancakes are almost done."

You see that the 'cliff' is indeed an actual cliff, and when Leonard lies down on his belly in a wide barred valley, the cliff top comes up to his lower lip. Picking you up off of a square mile of lion nose, your brother places you quite skillfully in a chair. Your parents were waiting at the table patiently for you to wake up, and thankfully you at least recognize them. Your hunger takes over your mind, and you dig in to the delicious fluffy pancakes. Interestingly, you notice that Leonard is also eating a city sized pancake himself, and washing it down by lapping up water from a river in the valley.

When you see Leonard turn away for a bit, you quickly ask your mother, "So, Leonard is adopted, right?" Your parents look shocked and stop eating, and your father says:
1121.title: Breakfast

choices: "Yes, he's been stable at fifty miles for some time now."
"You know, I don't think Leonard will ever be done growing."
11211.content:
Your parents gesture for Leonard to lean forward, and his cavernous feline ear tilts behind them. You cannot hear what they are whispering, but Leonard amazingly can, and his nodding his head. Leonard tells your parents, "Well, we all knew that this day would come."

"Listen, Jake, I guess your old enough now to realize that Leonard is not your real brother," spoke your mother seriously. "I think it's time for us to tell you the truth about Leonard."

Even though the fact that you have a fifty mile sibling is unbelievable, Leonard's story is even more fantastic. Six years before you were born, your parents found a cradle on their doorstep with an anthropomorphic lion cub sleeping inside. Your parents had never seen an anthro before, and indeed nobody else on Earth had either. Your parents took in the cub as their own as they always wanted children.

Leonard grew at an alarming rate, both in terms of size and development. In only a week he was taller than your parents and able to walk on two legs. In one month he nearly outgrew the house and could speak in complete sentences. By three months he could lift the house and could support himself. By this time people all over the world were aware of Leonard's existence. Nobody knew where he came from or why he was growing so fast, but Leonard was so gentle and friendly that nobody feared him.

When Leonard became four years old the government forced his family to move to a large uninhabited island in the Pacific, since it was getting dangerous to keep him near so much civilization. People continued to visit the island and Leonard's family, and eventually a port town sprang up, but the rest of the island still remained uninhabited to support Leonard's continuous growth.

"And you know the rest, bro," spoke Leonard, even though you really don't know the rest. There is one question on your mind. "If Leonard's twenty years old, that means he's done growing, right?" Your father replies...
11211.title: Miracle

112112.content:
“Well, I don’t think Leonard will ever stop growing. In fact, he starts growing a little faster after each of his birthdays. It’s amazing really,” your father said. Amazing is an understatement. You wonder what will happen if Leonard grows to the size of a continent, or what would happen if he got larger than the planet.

“You don’t sound very worried about this. I mean, he won’t be able to handle us safely for much longer will he?” you asked.

To your surprise you hear Leonard laugh. “Bro, if you wanted to play you just have to ask.” You wonder what he meant by that. Then Leonard plucked you out of your seat at the table. The speed at which he did that frightened you at first. Your fear did not last for long though. For some odd reason you felt completely safe pinched in between Leonard’s fingers.

Then you were lightly tossed in the air by Leonard and that fear came right back as you found yourself gliding a few miles above the Earth. Something told you that you were going to be just fine. In fact, you started to enjoy your little flight through the air. An object that was immeasurably large rose in your path and you realized it was Leonard’s tail. You landed safely in the tuft of fur at the end of that tail and this felt perfectly natural to you.

A gentle flick of the tail launches you into the air once more. This time you are able to enjoy the entire trip. Leonard obviously plans on catching you. You start to think that it should be cold this high up in the air. Something Leonard must be doing is keeping you from freezing to death. You don’t think about that for too long though. Flying through the air like this is just plain incredible. You glide over Leonard’s mane in between his ears and come to a landing safely on his muzzle. It felt like the landing should have been much harder, but the surface of Leonard’s muzzle was just as soft as it needed to be to make your landing as pleasant as could be.

“So, how’d you like that bro?” Leonard asked.

“That, that was incredible,” you said, not even bothering to try and hide your sense of wonder and amusement. Leonard placed you back at the table while your father and mother just smiled at you.

“Now that you’ve got that out of your system you do remember that you are supposed to be getting ready for the birthday party, don’t you?” your mother asked.
112112.title: Like a Bird

choices: A letter from his real parents
1121122.content:
"It's Leonard's 21st birthday?" you gasp. You suddenly realize that since you just woke up in this new life of yours, you probably don't have a present for the huge lion that is your kind brother. What would he think, after how nice he was to you, after he apparently played a huge part of your life, not just only in the literal sense? Not only that, but what would you possibly get a fifty mile lion for a gift?

Your mom suddenly walked up to you and whispered in your ear, "Jake, would you be a dear and get Leonard's present? You told me that you hid it under your bed."

Suddenly relieved, you reply 'yes' to your mother and give her a big smooch. Now, if only you knew how to tell Leonard how to get you into your house, which was now two miles up the pole sticking in the ground in the valley near your massive brother's left ankle. You think of the first thing that comes to mind. "Hey, big bro, I need to brush my teeth; could you give me a lift to my room?"

Your mega sized brother is more that happy to help, "Sure, anything for my little bro." An enormous tan claw lowers until level to the cliff, and you step on. You whizz dozens of miles through the air as you approach the house on the giant pin. After opening up the hinged wall of your bedroom, Leonard gently deposits you on your bed. "Make sure you floss as well, little bro, so your teeth can be big and strong like your big bro's!" the mega lion shouts before showing off his pearly set of pointy white mountains. You try to shake the scary image out of your head as your wall closes up, then look under your bed. Sure enough, there is a present there, but it's so small and thin, you have to wonder what Leonard would do with such a thing. You slip the wrapped gift, which has the words, "To Leonard, From Mom, Dad, and Jake" on it, in your pocket.

You decide to brush your teeth as well before calling for your adopted brother. After another trip of dozens of miles, you return to the cliff top, where your parents have a chocolate chip birthday-pancake with twenty-one candles on it. "Wow, already?" gasps your huge lion sibling. "But it's only morning!"

"Happy Birthday, Leonard!" called out your parents. "We thought that we should do this as soon as possible so we can talk about your present." Leonard looked very happy as he effortlessly blew out the candles, then ate the pancake, candles and all, as if it was the tiniest crumb. You doubt that he could taste such a small thing, but it was the thought that counts.

Your parents signal to you, and you bring the present out of your pocket and present it to Leonard. "Happy Birthday, big bro," you say as he carefully plucks the present from your fingers. Bringing the present miles high to his face, you guess that he is opening it by the way his fingers move very slightly and delicately. You do not believe it, but your brother shouts out, "Wow, this is the best gift ever! Thank you so much, this is what I always wanted!"

The paper is daintily handed back to you as your brother roars loudly with glee. You look at the paper and see that Leonard's gift is...
1121122.title: The Perfect Gift

choices: Check any Diaries or Such-like in the House
11212.content:
You look a might confused upon hearing your dad say this. "No," You reply, "I thought it was obvious." You make sure to keep your voice down since your parents do not want Leonard to hear you.

"I understand your argument," Your father explains, "But Leonard is the only one of his kind in the world. Even though our differences in size are so great he's happy to have a family to stick by him through thick and thin. If he knew he wasn't really our family it would probably leave him traumatised and will desire to seek out his real parents, though goodness knows who, what or where they may be." You look up at your giant brother and think about the consequences of what your dad was talking about; it quickly dawns on you the importance of discretion, considering what he's capable of.

"Is everything okay?" Leonard asks as he sees you looking up at him. Pausing for a while you decide on a suitable answer.

"Quite alright, Leonard. I just need to wash, get dressed, you know what I'm talking about." Your rather patchwork-y answer does seem to settle Leonard as he carefully lowers a claw for you to climb on. You take a quick wink at your parents, who seem to understand, as you settle yourself down on your brother's massive claw.

As you're set down back in your room Leonard shows the good decency to replace the wall that had been removed. His eye leaves the window to give you whatever privacy yuor require.

While you brush your teeth you wonder how Leonard came into your family's life. Where did they find him? How big was he at the time? How much has he grown? How much older is he? Putting your shirt on after rinsing your mouth out you decide to...
11212.title: Discretion is the Better Part of Honour

1122.content:
You wake up and stretch your limbs before you get out of bed. Just then you notice that your bedroom looks slightly different; for starters it's bigger than you remember, almost like one of those from a stately home. The sort your mum used to enjoy visiting. There's a gentle light coming through your curtains, which seem to have a more relaxing pattern on them as opposed to the plain colour you were used to.

Upon drawing the curtains you are shocked by the vista, it seems that you're now living in a high class house on top of a hill overlooking a beautiful valley. You wonder why your life has suddenly changed as you step onto the balcony.

"Oh, good morning 'big brother'." Came a beautiful and sensitive but powerful and commanding voice followed by a light giggle. You suddenly look around for your supposed little sister. "Oh, come on," The voice came again, almost rooting you to the spot, "This is no time for games." Then you look right above you, a shadow had been covering the whole house since you came onto the balcony and the voice was coming from above your head. There you see an awe-inspiring but intimidating sight; your 'little sister' turns out to be a gargantuan anthropomorphic vixen. She was so large that you deduce that her height must be measured in miles.

"Come on, <insert name here>." She continued, smiling down to you with no teeth showing; the sort of considerate smile you find coming from your family. "You'd better get dressed. Mum's already getting your breakfast ready and Daddy's organising the dining field." She disappears from view while you go back in to dress and let everything sink in.

You've now got a younger sister who was an anthro the size of a mountain, if not bigger. You were now living in a classy house and it seems that you all eat breakfast together even though the house must be no bigger than a sugar cube to your not-so-little sister. You smirk as you realise why she finds calling you 'big brother' so amusing.
1122.title: 'Little' Sister

choices: Your little sister gives you a lift to school
Your little sister wants to play with you
11221.content:
After getting dressed in comfortable clothing, you get ready to go downstairs, but soon realize that there is no door in your lavish bedroom. Realizing quickly that the only place to go is back to the vista, you head there, and you are not too surprised to find your huge little sister waiting there. "I see you're ready, big brother!" sang the vixen as she lowered her huge pinky finger to the level of the vista. As you get on, you realize that you were on the fourth floor of your mansion, but you do not see your front door anywhere. As you step on the black mount of fur, you realize; the only way your sister would be able to lift you or anyone is if they are at least four stories in the air. Any lower, and you're sister's little finger would be out of reach. You don't even think now that the first three floors are used for anything, though your family must still have become rich somehow to afford the mansion and all of this property.

The finger lifts up, and carries you slowly to a gently sloping hilltop, the top of which is covered with an enormous checkered cloth. Your mansion could probably fit on one of those squares. Seeing some scattered dots on one of the red squares, you realize that your family must be there. As the finger lowers down near them, the cloth gives, letting you just walk off towards the places set on the floor.

"Good to see you up, sweetie," says your mom as she serves you some fried eggs and toast. Your father seems absorbed in the paper, and you are glad that your family hasn't changed much.

"So, Mom, what's for breakfast?" asked the loud voice above you. You flinch a bit; you will have to get more used to this situation.

"Eggs and toast, Vicky," your mother shouts up to the huge fox. Amazingly, she holds up an identical sized paper plate for the vixen, who grabs it between two huge claws. You realize why your family is using disposable dishware for your sister, as she tosses the whole breakfast into her huge maw all at once. "Wow, that was great, Mom, I'm stuffed!" she replies from above, before covering her mouth with from a very noticable belch.

You can't figure out how such a huge anthro can live on what must be relatively less that one crumb of food a day, but you decide not to worry about it to much as you dig in to your own food.

After the tasty meal, you wonder what is in store for you on your first day in this new world.
11221.title: Breakfast Picnic

112212.content:
"Hey big brother!" your sister's voice booms "Wanna play a game?"

"Uh..OK."you reply. Your regular little sister loved to play with you, particularily catch.
"What's the game?"you ask

"Oh,"she said with a giant grin,"I thought we could play...
112212.title: Playtime

choices: give up and let her catch you
1122122.content:
''How about monster?' she asks. You think about it for a minute and go along with it. ''What's the worst that can happen.'' you ask yourself. ''Great..ok i'll be the monster and your trying to get away from me.'' Vicky says. ''Sounds easy enough.'' you reply with confidence. A few minutes later...you end up in a forest surronded by trees. 'Lets se how good Vicky really is.'' you say to yourself. You start to walk through the forest and look at your surondings. As you look up you see the trees coveing the sky a little.''Guess i did the right thing by hding here...hehe.'' Suddenly the ground shakes a little beneath your feet.

''That didnt take long.'' you say to yorself. You listen as the sound gets louder and louder until you hear the sound comes to a stop. ''Huh?'' you say a little unsure of what just happened. Then a hge shadow forms over you. You look up to see your little sister looking at you with a huge grin. ''Big brother...found you.'' she says showing her teeth a little.
1122122.title: "Monster!"

11222.content:
You wake up, pondering over your strange dream. As you get out of bed you see nothing a miss until your eyes fall upon what appears to be a photo album. You decide to look through it.

The first picture is unusual; you're certain that the baby in the picture is you and you recognise your parents younger faces in the picture, but what strikes you as disturbingly odd is the yellow background. It just didn't look right for wallpaper. The next photo shows you taking your first steps from your mother to your father, except that it was upon some black surface that looked too smooth and neat to be a carpet; the same yellow background seemed a bit far off.

Every photograph carried some importance to the various stages in your childhood and adolesence, and yet there was always that same yellow background occasionally accompanied by a large smooth black floor and sometimes large black patches on that yellow background. The final picture clinched it. It showed you almost as you are now, standing with your parents on what was recognisable as grass, but the background was a strange combination of black, green and white surrounded by that same distinguishable background; it almost looked like an eye.

You do a double-take. That background was fur, the black surface was either a pad or a nose and that really was an eye in that final picture. Confused you open the curtains in the hopes that the daylight will clear your head. Instead of sunlight you find yourself staring straight into that same giant pupil of that very same eye. It blnks, giving you an astonishing view of eyelashes that are bigger than you on all counts. A strange shockwave goes through the house, like you're standing on a bus that's setting off, and now you see an enormous anthro-cheetah face filling the view of your window. It greets you with a feminine voice that was grand but not booming; it was gentle and soft but had a hint of echo that came from being produced by lips bigger than your house.

"Good morning, my little brother."
11222.title: Whole Lot of Cat

choices: To meet with your parents for breakfast
To the lake to wash you off for the day
112221.content:
You're in shock and have to run outside to see what was going on and you look at amazing sight. This anthro cheetah was a girl and she had to be at least a dozen miles high. She had quite an hourglass figure with green eyes and long wild blonde hair. All she was wearing was a green shirt and olive shorts as she got up to look down at you with a smile. "About time you woke up bro. I was getting worried."

Then as hard as it is to believe, you recognize this cheetah girl. You were talking up to Maggie, your older sister. You remember that she was adopted but you didn't remember her being a giant cheetah. As you continue to look at your sister, she gets on her knee and holds out her paw, placing a claw in front of you. It would appear that your sister wanted you to climb into her hand. You hesitate at first and then you climb Maggie's finger as she lifted you up in front of her face.

"What's the matter bro?" she asks you. "You act like you don't remember your own sister. Then again, I wasn't the one who got hit by that baseball at school yesterday." Well that would explain it. But even for mild amnesia from a head injury this seemed unreal as Maggie feels your head with one of her large fingers. "Oh, I remember my sister alright. I just don't remember her being so big."

Maggie suddenly gives a shocked look of worry before turning her head and looking at her own backside. "Oh no," she said. "So it is noticeable. I knew I was putting on weight lately." "Uh, that wasn't what I... don't worry about it Sis. You're beautiful. I didn't..." "Oh it's alright bro," says Maggie. "I know you'd never say anything that would hurt my feelings. Now I hope you remember to hold on tight.

You give a look of confusion before Maggie shoves you into her cleavage tight. You wiggle in your sister's breasts but you can't move. "Maggie! What are you..." Before you can finish your sentence, Maggie runs off like a meteor and you can see the outside world becoming little more than a blur. Duh, your sister was a cheetah and a cheetah that sized would move as fast as a meteor. You're impressed at how she can move so supersonic without stepping on anybody or destroying property. Everyone Maggie passes, at least those who can see her, act surprisingly casual to a cheetah giant. They must've been used to your sister, which meant, you were the only one who found this experience strange.

Where is your cheetah sister taking you?
112221.title: My Sister the Cat

1122211.content:
After a few more seconds, Maggie stops running so you guess that you both have arrived at wherever you two were going. Maggie sticks her hand in her cleavage and pulls you out and puts you on the ground. "Mom! Dad! We're back. Breakfast time right," Maggie said.

You sweatdrop when the ground shakes and you hear a grumble followed by Maggie blushing and putting a hand over her stomach. You look over and see your mom and dad walk out. "Well, at least they're normal," you mumbled. You sit down and get a plate of food to eat. While you're eating you see your sister continuously ask for more food. 'Well she's huge, of course she would need a lot of food,' you thought.

After everyone finished eating, Maggie smiled at you guys' parents. "So Mom, Dad, back to what we were talking about yesterday. I want to marry Shin (you). I don't care about the height difference or that he's 3 years younger (she's 19, you're 16) or that we are different species, I love him and he loves me!" she yelled at the end. You blush in shock and embarrassment.

'What's this feeling? Did I love her before losing my memory? I-I think I did,' you think before nodding your head in determination. You walk over to Maggie and kiss her huge finger making her smile and pick you up to rub against her cheek.

After she stopped, you looked down at your parents. "Please mom and dad, I love Maggie and even though we're different as well as siblings, I want to be with her!" you bow on Maggie large hand while she does the same, but keeping you stable. Both you and Maggie look up and see mom and dad smiling at them. "Of course. We knew the second we saw Maggie all those years ago and adopted her that you two would fall in love with each other. We aren't expecting grandkids soon, but we would like some," mom said. Both you and Maggie blushed, but stopped and looked at each other.

You and Maggie leaned closer and kissed. After a second, you both leaned back and Maggie hugged you close to her while you hugged her back.
1122211.title: To meet with your parents for breakfast

112222.content:
You let out a mutter as you get up. You look out the window to see something weird. There were trees as far as the eye could see and the ground looked like it was made of mud, but what really struck you was that there seemed to be a lake outside. You walk out to see it was still night and take out a lantern. You walk forward and then yell. You fall into a hole, a large hole. "Ouch." You mutter.

Then you look to see this hole had to be at least a mile deep, you survived only due to the mud, but then you see something weird. The hole appeared to have reptilian like toes. "What the?" You ask. Suddenly you hear stomping and then you look up to see a giant shadow. It looked feminine but at the same time lizard like with a long snout and a big tail along with long brown curly hair with a white highlight. The creature bends down to reveal a pair of giant breasts and a giant clawed hand reaches down and grabs you by the shirt as you let out a grunt.

Soon, you look and see that a giant alligator woman, slightly chubby in body shape was looking down on you. "Howdy little bro," she says in a slight southern accent. "What are you doing out so late at night? You come to help me fish? You better be careful where you step. That's the fifth time in three days I've had to pull you out of a foot hole." Then your eyes popped. This dozen mile high alligator giantess was your sister.
112222.title: Alligator Girl

1122222.content:
Delia stirred from a most peculiar dream. Stretching her arms out and wriggling her toes as she tried to recover her spatial awareness it soon dawned on her that this wasn't quite her bedroom. The furnishings were all in the same positions but there was a lot more space and it all seemed to be in an uncanny state of repair, almost as though it was built only yesterday. She got up and looked round but, in the gloom, there was little in the way of clues she could find. She decided to open the curtains.

As soon as she did so she was struck by a sight that left her filled with awe, fear and intrigue. Staring right back at her through that same window was an immense eye so vast that she couldn't even see anything beyond the cornea. Suddenly the whole house shook to a might, booming but tolerable and friendly voice.

"Morning, sis." It boomed. "Did ya have a good night?" Delia gasped in shock as she recognised this.

"B...Banta?" She squeaked. "Is it really you?!?" She watched as he blinked, a massive eyelid covered in red fur raced by.

"Dilly, are you okay?" He asked, the power of his voice almost toppling her. "Is something wrong?"

"W...What happened to you?" She gasped. "You must be... TITANIC!"

"Oh, come now." He thundered. "You moved in with me when you were just twelve, and I was only two miles tall back then." Delia's hand shot to her mouth as she gawped at this; he was treating such a size as being no big deal (no pun intended).

"I don't remember anything about that." She chanced. "My memories are of you being just another guy where most people'd be concerned." She felt a great quaking as Banta's eye zoomed away, revealing more of his mountainous face, covered in red and cream-coloured fur with a long muzzle curled up in a look of concerned. Not only was he colossal, he was a red panda!

"Dilly," He boomed, "Do you feel all right? I can't really remember being human-size, mum and dad said I was just a cub back then. The earliest thing I remember was when I was four, and about three-hundred feet tall." Delia knew Banta was four years older than her, so she figured he must be alluding to when she was born.

"Aside from the shock of seeing how vast and furry you are I feel fine." She answered. "But, if you were two miles tall when you were sixteen, how big are you now?" She rested her arms on the windowsill, wishing to get a better perspective on her current situation, she caught sight of a single black furry column pressed against the outside wall, which she guessed was one of Banta's fingers.

"Last time I checked I was 32 miles, 3,748 feet and nine and a half inches." He replied. Delia promptly fainted back onto her bed.
1122222.title: Wowie Wah

11222222.content:
You wake up in your room, but It was bigger then you remember. You feel the bed shake it was your sis a giant horse. You where scared at first but then memories flooded your mind and you layed back down but why where there no memories of your parents, Your sis was about 33 miles tall the last time anyone checked not that any but you lived one the island the government gave her she took you and none else as far you can remember. Your sis name was Missy and she had a beautiful black mane you should know you find you self lost in there more time then you can count, her fur is brown with white spots here and there.

Your sis wakes up and sees that your awake and then you hear." brother do you want breakfast."

You say yes of course so she take you to the table where there is a tiny table just for you.

You start to think that all your going to get is grass and carrots for your breakfast. But no your sis cooks you pancakes that are bigger then you" she know that you won't eat all of it but it the best she can do for you"
11222222.title: Nah of Nonsense

choices: You’re too shocked to say anything.
113.content:
Like most mornings you are having a hard time waking up. This morning feels unusually bad though. Your bed just feels so comfortable that you don’t want to be roused from your slumber. Eventually you do recognize the fact that you do have to get up eventually. There is something wrong, but your sleep addled mind cannot determine just what it is. Then it hits you, you are not in your bed.

You are resting on something soft, yet firm. Whatever the ground beneath you is made out of is extremely comfortable to the touch. The ground also feels like it is radiating a little bit of heat. It is just warm enough that you can understand why you did not want to wake up. When you look around you find nothing but a surreal landscape. You look like you are in a dense forest of snow white smooth limbless trees that soar into the air. There are also a few black ones off in the distance, but the white ones dominate the landscape.

Your hose is gone, but you do have a few little supplies lying around. For one thing your blanket is still here as well as some clothes, shoes, and other items for your personal hygiene. That appears to be all though. There is no one else around and you wonder just how you managed to get here. It does not seem like you could have walked here on your own even if you were sleep walking. “Hello, is anyone there?” you call out.

“Oh, you’re awake. Sorry I didn’t notice little buddy,” a voice said out of nowhere. The voice sounded like it was coming from above the trees. That did not seem possible though. Those trees looked like they were thousands of feet tall and you did not think you would be able to hear anyone shouting at you from above those trees.

Then something else added to the weirdness. Something incredibly huge started to descend through the trees. It was headed straight at you and you tried to run away from it. The black pointed object started to move in the direction you were running and you realized it was coming after you. Despite sprinting as fast as you could the object easily caught up to you and swept you off the ground.

The object started to lift you upward and you clung to it for dear life as you were elevated miles into the air at a mind boggling rate of speed. You were lifted beyond the trees and as you got further and further away from them you could start to make out patterns in the trees. It was mostly white like you had expected, but the black trees you had seen earlier formed what appeared to be ring like spots in the forest. After a few more seconds you could make out that the forest was not a forest of trees, but of fur. You were now able to make out that you had been resting on the back of paw that had to be a few miles long.

That was when you realized that you were riding on a claw that had to be well over a mile long. You were being raised toward the face of a massive feline. Due to the type of fur it had you guessed the feline was a snow leopard. Despite its size you could tell there was something else different about it. There was an opposable thumb on the paw that you could see. It also had one more surprise for you when you were so close to its mammoth face that you could not even see all of it. It could talk. “Good morning. Did you sleep well?,” it asked as its warm breath washed over you.
113.title: Snow White World

1132.content:
You were so shocked by everything that you couldn't speak, or even move a muscle. The mega-sized snow leopard, speaking in a deep, manly voice, sounded concerned. "Are you okay, buddy? Is it too cold out? Here, let me help with that."

Suddenly, the huge claw started to move, carrying you farther and farther away from the enourmous feline face until you enter what looks like a mammoth, fur-lined cave. You can't believe it, but you are actually inside the snow leopard's paw, where the claw retracts. An enormous slit-pupiled eye zoomed towards the entrance, locked on to your immobile speck of a frame. "Come on, buddy, please say something! Wait, I think I know the problem. Your shocked that I grew three miles last night, right?"

If it was possible, you were even more speechless than before. This monstrous feline is still growing, miles at a time? Even though three miles probably would look like two inches to this snow leopard anthro, that does not make the figure less intimidating. The snow leopard's huge eyelids lower, giving it a very concerned look. "Listen, buddy, I know that your afraid that I will never stop growing and end up hurting someone, and I actually am very afraid of that too. It's been haunting me the whole week I've existed. But we have to face our fear together if we want to overcome it, right?"

Somehow, through the frightening miles of visage and rumbling loud voice that rocks your soul, the fact that this huge beast is afraid of its ever-increasing height as much as you, if not more, speaks to you. You finally find your voice and speak with complete empathy, "Listen, I'm very sorry, I didn't mean to scare you."

The snow leopard speaks to you softly, "Please, don't be sorry, I'm sure it was only a natural reaction. I'm very relieved that you still see me as a being with feelings, though. Nothing like everyone else, who think I'm a monster." The leopard decides to lower you back to your campsite located on the back of his palm. As you descent, you notice several large mountains covered with snow surrounding the behemoth paw, and the two actually blend with each other very well. This snow leopard must be hiding from all of the other humans by disguising himself as a mountain range. Though you are not very afraid of the snow leopard now, you still don't have a clue what is going on. You slide down a soft white pole of a fur strand to your campsite and look for anything that can give you a hint. You look through your pile of clothes and come across one piece of evidence; a scientific-looking slip of paper. Reading it, you are surprised to find out that this snow leopard was born in a top secret laboratory in an experiment to create...
1132.title: Frozen

choices: You nursed the snow leopard back to health after his escape.
You are a very persuasive speaker.
11322.content:
As you started flipping through the papers you could tell that your snow leopard friend had been meant to be the ultimate life form. The scientist in charge of the operation sounded a little insane from what you were reading. It looked like the military was involved in this too. They did not seem like they expected this to work, but were only involved in this to make sure they could look like they were using all of their money in a responsible way and thus maintain their budget. When this project started showing some actual results they had been just as surprised as anyone else would have been.

The military did not get that involved in the project even after the project had yielded results. They did not see what was then just a four foot tall snow leopard man could do for them. The lead scientist did not seem sane either and that probably influenced their opinion of the project. As you read you really came to dislike the lead scientist in charge of this project. Despite claiming to want to create the “ultimate life form” he only seemed interested in his work. The snow leopard was treated more like an object than a life form. Some of the things done to the snow leopard sounded pretty brutal to you.

Eventually the snow leopard, referred to as specimen 3245, had started to grow. It bothered you that they had not even bothered to give him a real name. The snow leopard’s growth had been slow at first. After six months he had begun to grow much more rapidly. He had managed to escape after his rate of growth caught them by surprise. Since these files stopped recording information about the snow leopard when he was about 100 feet tall you assumed that was when he had escaped.

The place he was created in was must have been somewhere in Alaska because that was where you live. It was a good thing for the snow leopard if it was because even a 100 foot tall feline would not have been noticed in the isolated area you lived in. Still, he had been growing about ten feet per hour by the time he escaped and his rate of growth had been increasing. You wondered how tall he had been by the time he met you and why he had chosen to befriend you. His only experience with humans had not been positive when he first encountered you. It is surprising he did not crush you like a bug upon spotting you.

There was only one way to find out about your questions and that was to ask the snow leopard. He did not seem to have any trouble hearing you so you asked, “Hey, why did you decide to befriend me when we first met?” It did not seem like that strange a question to ask a friend. Besides, you might find out if he had a real name if he told you the story about how you became friends.
11322.title: The Papers

choices: The leopard is having a growth spurt
113221.content:
The enormous face of the snow leopard anthro lowered its head to the back of his hand, where you were standing. "Well, I guess you helped show me the good side of humanity when you helped me so much last week." The anthro starts to tell his side of the story, and doesn't seem to think your question was stupid at all. In fact, he seems happy just for having someone to talk to.

His escape had been far from discrete. He was being held in maximum security, with armed soldiers surrounding his reinforced cage at all times and shackles holding him in place. Apparently, as he grew, all of his other vital statistics such as his strength, stamina, and even his senses and intelligence also grew. He had wanted to escape for a long time, but it was only when he reach one hundred feet that he was able to break out of maximum security.

This is where the leopard's story starts to scare you, since the soldiers started to attack him as soon as he was free. Riddled with machine gun fire and badly burned by grenades, he furiously smashed dozens of the guards to pieces as he made his escape. He ran far, far away from that laboratory, only keeping the records on him that were attached to the tag on his ear.

The anthro ran for a long time until his wounds got to him and he fainted. When he woke up, however, he felt something warm trickle down his throat. The first thing he saw when he opened his large eyes was you pouring a bowl of soup into his mouth. He noticed that his wounds were covered with snow to stop the swelling and he knew that with his superior rate of healing that he would survive. It was then that the anthro realized that not all humans were evil; only that the ones at the laboratory were some of the bad ones. This human was obviously good, so the snow leopard vowed then that he would definitely befriend this human, and since this human had done everything that it could do, he would do everything he could as the ultimate life form to somehow return the favor.

Ever since then, you two have been in hiding in the northern Rocky Mountains, although you don't know why; surely there is nothing that a hundred mile snow leopard would fear. However, you are wrong, "Those bad humans said that if I get out of hand that they would resort to nuclear force," explains the anthro. "I can feel how powerful I have become so far, and I still cannot survive a nuclear bomb attack. I am hoping that I come that far before I grow too big, because I really would like to meet other good humans." You feel very bad for this huge anthro who has lead the most difficult life you have ever heard, and still wants to turn his life around for the better. However, it is then that you hear a loud noise.
113221.title: Hospitality

1132211.content:
"No, no, it's happening again," moaned the great voice from above. "I fear that this one is going to be big; we must go farther north before anyone notices."

Suddenly, you feel as if you are on a humongous elevator and think that the leopard is standing up. However, you realize that he is only lifting his huge hand a little bit to crawl northward. As he moves, you notice the spots on his face high above start to move around. Apparently, he is a master of disguise who can blend in with the scenery even as he moves. You notice the forest of white start to grow thicker and taller, and you actually start to feel warmer as the leopard heads for colder grounds. You also notice that he can move almost silently and diligently, even though his movements should have at least started several major avalanches. Soon, you see all of the dots disappear from the leopards face, now blending with the cloudy sky more than the snowy ground. Judging from the thickness of the fur now, the leopard must have nearly doubled in height. You can't help but ask the leopard if he can perhaps withstand a nuclear bomb strike now.

"I don't think so, buddy. Maybe one now, but only if it didn't hit my head. Two bombs, though, are definitely still lethal. I know how much you want to see me right all of my wrongs, but now is not the time."

You look back up at the disappointed huge face in the sky. You are definitely starting to feel some sort of friendly bond with this monstrous feline.
