He almost feels familiar somehow, almost as if you have been with him for the whole week, rather than just a few hours. You do wish that you could do something to cheer him up. Looking back up at the leopard, you call out, "Hey, buddy, how about we do something fun together?"

The huge leopard's face seemed to light up. "Wow, really? I mean, you actually trust me enough to do something fun with you now?" You are confused, but realize that in this world, you were still supposed to be frightened of the leopard handling you at this point. However, the leopard replies, "That's wonderful, buddy, and it will also be great practice for when I can return to civilization!" Soon, you learn that the ultimate life-form's idea of a good time is...
1132211.title: Even Larger

choices: that he was never given a name beyond specimen 3245.
11322112.content:
You felt a slight tingling sensation all over your body and then you started to lift into the air without anything doing the lifting. In a few seconds you were gliding gently through the air. “It took a while, but I’ve finally mastered my telekinetic abilities buddy,” said the leopard. The snow leopard had you flying above him which left you a frightening height above the ground. Your fear soon dissipated though as you started to get used to what felt like flying to you. For some reason you seemed to fly where you wanted to fly as well and that was when you realized the snow leopard was at least a little telepathic as well. He had to be to know where and how you wanted to fly. It was an amazing experience that made you feel incredibly free even though you knew that you were under the snow leopards power and that the both of you were being hunted.

“I can see that you like that, but let me show you what else I have been working on,” the leopard said as he flew you in front of that miles long head of his. You see his hand paws on either side of you and you wonder what he is doing. Then the hand paws rush at you and you scream in fear as you think he is about to swat you like a fly. You think you might have been wrong to trust the feline until the pads on his paws actually hit you. Not only were you not dead, you were not even in any pain. The paws parted and you saw the leopard just smiling at you. “That is one I have really been working hard on. I think I might actually be able to walk among humans with crushing them if I step on them now. Now all I have to worry about is handling an attack on me without getting me or anyone else killed.”

That was amazing. You knew he swatted you with full force. Countless tons of flesh and bone had come together all around you and not a single head on your head had been harmed. It was also a relief to learn that the leopard really was trying to learn how to live among humans without harming them. The leopard was not through playing either.

He laid on his back and flew you directly above his mouth. Then he opened it to reveal a truly frightening sight. His maw was huge and his fangs looked like they were larger than mountains. When he sucked in a breath of air you could feel the air pulling at your body and if it were not for the leopard’s powers you could easily imagine yourself getting sucked into the dark abyss that was his mouth. Then you felt the snow leopard’s power let you go and you found yourself falling into his mouth. This time you figured that if he wanted you dead he could have done it earlier, so you trusted him keep you safe.

The leopard pursed his lips and then blew gently. At least it was gently to him. To you his warm breath rushed up with enough force to keep you afloat in the air. The amount of control it took not to blow you away was simply stunning. You found that you could even move around safely while the leopard was blowing and you wondered how long he could keep this up. Then you thought about how large he must be and how much air must be in his lungs. It would take a long time to empty those things. He might also be assisted by one of his other powers as far as you know. You really were having fun and you wanted to thank the leopard for the amazing experience but you did not even know his name. “Hey buddy, I want to thank you, but your name seems to have slipped my memory,” you said.

Then the leopard tells you…
11322112.title: Truly Amazing

113221121.content:
"Don't you remember? You called me Joshua."

You remember and face palm yourself.

"Oh yeah, sorry about that."

"No problem."

All of a sudden Joshua jerks slightly

"What's going on?"

"I'm...
113221121.title: his name.

choices: "Uhmm...It's nice but I want to be called something else..."
113221122.content:
"I didn't forget to tell you did I? I don't have a real name,all they gave me was a number in their series of experiments." he let you gently fall back onto the center pad of his expansive paw so you had a clear view of his impossibly large form as he rose up.

"That's right 3245, from the paper...what's wrong?" you noticed the leopard had a solemn look on his face as he stared down past you.

"...sorry, I was just thinking about having a number for a name."

"It is very awkward to call someone like that. Maybe I should give you a different name because I don't feel right calling you...GAHH!!!" You didn't notice but the leopard's demeanor had brightened beyond any happiness you thought you could give him. He lifted you up to his face and attempted to nuzzle you. Although you felt the intended warmth you couldn't feel the softness of his fur, only the tree like tendrils that gently rushed over you.

He sensed your thoughts of not being affected as he intended and pulled you back enough to see his smiling but remorseful face. "Sorry, I didn't hurt you did I?"

"No, but careful big guy. You shocked me suddenly lifting me like that."

"I was really thankful. You really meant what you said didn't you?"

"Giving you a name? Of course I did! I can't keep calling you 'you' or even trying to call you '3245' knowing how you feel about it." He looked down smiling then quickly looked up with glimmering eyes like you lit a warm fire in his multi-mile large heart. "Let me think of something that fits you...well, you're incredibly big...to the point that people will have to measure your size in miles...wait that sounds nice!"

"Wh-What!!" his face closed in on you in his palm.

"What do you think of Miles?"
113221122.title: Can I give you a name?

choices: Living side by side with everyone and stopping evil people those scientists.
Creating a happy world, using the kindness that you taught me.
1132211221.content:
"Then it's settled, from now on your name is Miles." You saw him pull you to his face, but this time you were prepared. You reached out as he placed you on his nose and climbed up. You pet his nose as you laid down on it, it was warm and damp instead of completely wet. You heard him purr and repeat, "my name is Miles," with his eyes closed until he slowly opened them. Something was wrong with his eyes when he opened them, you saw a glint of a green glow for the few moments they opened until they were open completely. You thought it must have just been the shine from the sun.

After he showed you his affection for his new name Miles leaned back against a mountain with a completely content look on his face as you both stared at the sun which was almost at the horizon, night was coming. You sat up on the tip of his nose. "So Miles," his giant maw gave a short toothy grin when he heard you and you laughed, "heh, I don't remember if I asked you or not, but what do you want to do when your big enough not to be hurt by anyone and ready to be out in the world."

He gave a soft sigh that released a large cloud of steam into the cold atmosphere, "mmm...I've been giving it a lot of thought and I know I want to help people. I think you did ask me before, but I couldn't give you a straight answer. I want to show everyone that I'm not a monster. Those scientists made me to be the Ultimate Being, well thanks to you I'm choosing to be the Ultimate Giver. I'll use my power to..."
1132211221.title: What do you want to do?

choices: You wake up suddenly, Mile's was growing again.
You wake up a few hours before dawn.
11322112212.content:
"I would tell someone that it would be a hard thing to do to make everyone happy. But I know you can do it. If you could look at your self like I'm looking at you, you'll see the definition of 'Gentle Giant'."

"You really think I can?!" his voice was filled with his wish.

"There are six billion people in this world. If we took all six billion of them, including me, and tried to match your size and weight and you're bigger, then I know you'll definitely be able to do it. If you haven't already."

"Buddy...what your saying makes me feel really warm inside. Like you were bigger than even me right now and you just gave me a hug I thought I'd never get."

"That means a lot to me Miles." You both talked for another hour as the sun slowly went down. There wasn't a town for several hundred miles. You were both in the middle of nowhere with nothing but each other. You could have worried about what may come tomorrow, but today was more important even though it would end soon.

After the sun had gone down and the temperature dropped you both could see the moon. It was a blue crescent. You were in the short line of hair between Mile's eyes, even though it was nowhere near short to you as you still couldn't see either pupil. You yawned, not because you were tired but it was a long day. "Mile's can you set me down on your hand. I'm hungry."

"Sure bud," he slid you off his muzzle onto the back of his hand, directly into your small camp. You pulled out your bag and found a case with sandwiches you must have made for the trip. You ate the sandwich as you watched Mile's face through the furry jungle. He seemed calmer then this morning, like a weight was lifted off his shoulders and replaced with helping hands. 'How could a little guy like me feel so big' you thought. There was something there, you could feel it, something you forgot but it's not lost. You wanted to remember it badly, but you couldn't

He looked down to you smiling, "It's pretty late and I don't sense any danger out there. Do you want to turn in?"

"Your right, I should get some sleep. We need to get farther North before we do though, just in case."

"Right bud, hold on." He carefully shifted and crawled across the ground without disturbing a single spot of land. He reached a few miles North before stopping and laying back against another mountain range. Again the journey seemed like a large scale exodus, but it must have been like a short baby crawl to him. "Good night little buddy," he said before placing his arms behind his head and closing his eyes.

"Good Night, Miles," you saw him smirk again. You walked over to a sleeping bag you laid out and tucked yourself inside. But before you could fall asleep completely you noticed something strange. Miles's fur flickered oddly. You could tell he was already asleep by his silent breaths and his lowered eyes.

As his fur flicked and morphed it seemed to lose its color. As it lost its color you remember he did this before when he crawled a distance away from where you first were. His camouflage was turning on. His fur started to blend in with his surroundings to the point that you could no longer see his face. Instead you saw the moon behind him and a faint outline of his body that you only saw if you squinted. It made you feel like you were sleeping in the sky. All you did was smile and drift to sleep.
11322112212.title: Night Talk

choices: "You are the best friend I could ever ask for."
"I love you...from the bottom of my heart."
113221122122.content:
You wake up slowly, still very drowsy but entirely aware your on the hand of a multiple mile tall leopard. You scratch your head and yawn as you pick up an alarm clock from your bag. It was about three hour before dawn. You put it back in and wanted to go back to sleep until you noticed something, an odd sort of mumbled song. It was soft and soothing, "la lalala la...la laah." It was familiar and coming from high above you.

As you looked for the source you noticed that Miles's hair wasn't transparent anymore. And the song was coming from him. He was wide awake and lightly tapping against the mountain side with his other hand. The hand you were on was on his chest. He closed his eyes while singing and then looked down to you and stopped suddenly, "oh...sorry little buddy. Did I wake you. I'll stop singing if I did."

"No it's alright. It's a really nice song, it sounds so familiar too."

"Hm, it was the song you hummed to me while you were helping me the first time we met. You told me it was from a song you heard on the radio that you couldn't remember the words to. Before you hummed it to me I didn't even know what a song was. But, it was beautiful."

"That's right, I did sing that now that I think about it...wait a minute I thought you were asleep that night. That's embarrassing that you remember that. It's not a bad thing, but still I feel awkward thinking about it."

"Haha! That's the same thing you said the day I told you I remembered the song. You said 'I can't believe you remembered that'..." he suddenly went quiet.

"What's wrong?"

"...you know...that might have been the first time I ever laughed...maybe even the first time I ever smiled. Buddy, thank you for showing me how to smile."

You felt his joy wake you up from your drowsy state. You stretched and pulled yourself halfway out of your sleeping bag, wide awake. "You know, I feel like we've known each other longer then the past week we've been together. Like we met a long time ago and this is our chance to catch up, except a lot's changed. Like you suddenly had a growth spurt while I'm still the midget friend you protected in elementary school."

"Hahaha...I feel the sam way...like we've been friends all my life, even though we just met last week. And before then I wasn't born that long ago. That's why...uhm what I'm..."

"What is it Miles?"

"I always wanted someone to reach out to in the lab. I was stabbed and prodded and had horrid things done to me. I was forced to hurt other experiments just to prove that I was the better model, against my will. I just wanted to scream to someone 'I don't want to do it anymore'. But no one cared so I ran...I know I said this all before...but, I just want you to know that...
113221122122.title: I always wanted to...

1132211221222.content:
You were shocked to hear it but strangely enough you felt the same way towards him.
"Miles." you say.
"What is it?" Miles asks.
"I have a confession to make, I too love you from the bottom of my heart."
"So this may sound weird but will you be my lover?"
"Yes, Yes, Yes I would love to have that." he said beaming.
Soon you give Miles a hug.
"I want you to be only mine forever." Miles said.
"Alright then."
What happens next.
1132211221222.title: "I love you...from the bottom of my heart.&...

1133.content:
As you're walking down the street, you look at the distance and see a large explosion. "What's going on!" you then run forward and see what looked like a laboratory in total wreckage. The man in charge of the lab was a man with one eye and red hair that was graying. His hair already looked like it was turning gray.

He got up and let out a grunt as he held up his cane. "Oh my gosh" you say. "Are you alright?" The man gets up and gives a look of surprise to see you that quickly turns into a look you don't trust. "Excuse me, he said. "Have you seen anything unusual." You look to see the lab was filled with all sorts of beakers and chemicals that stunk to high heaven. "You mean other than a lab explosion Mr...." "Curry," said the man. "Dr. Curry. What I'm talking about is a creature like no other." "Creature?" you ask.

Dr. Curry shows you a photograph of a strange creature resembling a white lioness with what appears to be a pair of wings growing out of her back that gave a glint like pure gold. "What on Earth is that?" you ask. Dr. Curry lets out a sigh. "Leonida. A dangerous beast that would destroy the very world if left to her own devices. My staff and I were charged with containing her." "Oh my." Curry nods his head. "But she can't have gotten far. She's exactly fifty miles tall." "Fifty miles!" Suddenly Curry stops you. You both hear vibrations. Curry and you both take the last surviving vehicle, a jeep and drive up the side of a mountain and you see Leonida and can't believe your eyes.

Leonida was a hourglass shaped giantess in a tight green unitard that showed off her curves nicely and had long silvery mane like hair. You let out a gasp and Curry tries to silence you with his hand. "Don't alert the beast," he says. "She'll look for any excuse to devour you." But at this point, Leonida's ear twitched and she turned to see you both, but didn't react until she saw Curry. She gave a look of despair and roared loudly.

"Stay back!" Leonida yells. "Don't come another step closer!" You crouch and expect Leonida to attack but instead she folds her wings in a vain attempt to hide. To your surprise she was quaking. This lioness big enough to smash an entire city beneath her foot was stepping away backwards. Something was wrong. Leonida didn't act like a creature of mass destruction. In fact, she was acting as if she was scared. What was going on? "Don't fall for her tricks boy," says Dr. Curry. "Leonida is very tricky. You lower your guard and she'll squash you like the insect you are to her."

Suddenly something blows into your face, it appeared to be paper work, a file, a file on Leonida. "What's this?" you ask. You read the file to see a photograph of a young woman in her twenties, resembling Leonida. She looked afraid and was wearing a suit just like Leonida. Not only that there appeared to be a blueprint that stated "Operation Wild One. You then saw a photograph of Leonida but she was smaller than she is now, being the size of a small house and then see photographs of her getting bigger and her wings growing in. Then you realize something. Dr. Curry wasn't trying to contain Leonida, he was the one who mutated her into what she was. He turned an innocent woman into a giant mutate. "You bastard!" you yell.

You run up to Curry but then he pushes you down. "Infidel!" he yelled. "Leonida is the first of a race of neo-sapiens that will make armies obsolete." "If anyone found out what you were doing, they'd take you apart" you say. "On second thought, I'll save them the trouble." Curry then clicks a gun and points it at you and makes you step back. "I could just as easily turn you into a second mutate. Stay out of my way." At this point Leonida has gotten on all fours and was running off as Curry pointed his gun at her. "You can flee if you want to lioness," he said with an evil look. "But this tranquilizer can take out even take out someone as big as you. Say goodnight beast."

As the doctor was about to shoot the lioness, you see two weapons on the ground, one a taser and the other a tranquilizer gun. Either one will give that jerk what was coming to him, but which do you choose.
1133.title: Leonida

11332.content: You garb the tranquilizer and shoot him and almost intentionally he his knocked out. You had to get Leonidas out of here, but frist you should ask if she ok. "Yes I'm ok thanks for saving me" she says. Now let's get out of here,"let's, but frist she garbs the doctor this guy going to get what is coming to him". don't tell me your going to eat him. "No I mentioned jail time"
11332.title: The dart gun

choices: Another story with you serving a different role for Levice
A completely new story with this topic
114.content:
You awaken groggily from your odd dream, not really awake yet. However, you hear some sort of voice calling for you, and you recognize it as your father's.

"Rise, my son, today is your special day!' You flop out of bed and get dressed in the clothes by your bed, but you are confused. "Dad, my birthday was three months ago!"

"No, son, I'm talking about your knighthood!" Suddenly snapping back to reality after hearing this odd statement coming from your father, you rub your bleary eyes and look around the room. You look like you're in some sort of room in a large, stony castle, yet you must be home if your dad is here. Perhaps he called for some redecorating, since he obviously changed your wardrobe. You realize that you are putting on a highly decorative vest and odd fluffy pants. You feel like you are in the Middle Ages, and wonder if you are going to a Renaissance fair.

Without even time to eat, your father, dressed in fancy clothes as well, ushers you through a long system of hallways and stairwells. "So, Dad, about this knighthood thing..."

"I know, you must be thrilled!" exclaimed Dad as you both climbed a tall spiral staircase. King Levice told me himself how proud he was of your accomplishments as a paige!"

"King ... Levice?" you ask.

"You know, King Levice, the Great. He's been our king for 9,000 years, you know. You learned all about his accomplishments in school, like how he unified most of the nations of Earth in one day, how he won the Battle of the West in a record seventeen seconds, and how he is still greatly respectful of his people."

You don't know what is going on, but this Levice guy sounds too good to be true. You decide that you should ask this guy what is going on as soon as you meet him in person.

Eventually, your father opens a door to the courtyard, where several armored men are kneeling in respect. Your father gestures you to walk through the row of knights, and you do, though you do not see anyone that looks like royalty. When you get to the end, you start to kneel, too, but something suddenly stops you. A great and powerful voice from above ushers a command, "No, new knight, I wish for you to rise and face me."

You are confused as to who said that, but there is no doubt in your mind that it must be Levice. You turn your head all over, but do not see anyone that could be him. You hear a deep, rumbling laughter followed by the words, "I enjoy your humor very much, but now is a special time. Look upward, new knight."

You look upward towards a tall tower, strikingly black against the pure white sky. "Look higher, knight!" says the voice once more.

You finally look straight upward, and suddenly soil your fluffy pants, as you see a huge iris and pupil in the sky. As it blinks once, you see two huge brown leathery lids temporarily darken the sky. You consider running, but you stay still as the eye grows smaller and a head becomes visible, that of a truly enormous brown dragon. You see tall spires rise many miles over the castle before realizing that they are fingers. You are completely in shock when you realize that this means that this dragon must be carrying the whole castle, or even a whole country, in the small of his palm. You see an enormous, shiny artifact, a sword, gripped in the dragon's other hand, the tip of which is descending at an alarming rate towards the castle! You crouch in defense, but amazingly only feel the cold tip of the blade lightly touch each of your shoulders. You look up to see what has happened, and only see the face of the dragon smiling from ear to ear. "Congratulations, new knight, and may you have many years of success serving I, your king. Now, everyone, let us off to breakfast. New knight, you may have the seat of honor next to your king." You try to soak your knighthood in as two massive brown fingers tipped with tan-colored claws start to close in on you...
114.title: Levice the Great

1141.content:
You try to calm down and assess the situation as you rise through the air. Looking down, you see the castle get smaller and smaller, and realize that indeed, Levice is carrying a very large section of land in his left hand. Pretty soon, you can see the Earth's surface itself, and it is strangely desolate, with many small dots of green and blue separated by vast expanses of bare rock. Obviously, this is so Levice can traverse his kingdom without crushing any of his subjects, but it still seems depressing to you.

Suddenly you are placed on a soft brown surface, and based on the gargantuan eyes that are staring at you, the spot that Levice decided to take you to was the bridge of his muzzle. Levice then dipped his mighty fingers into another landmark, and procured a variety of fruits, which he laid in front of you. "Eat well, new knight, you have deserved it," spoke the king, the sounds rumbling beneath you.

You do as you are told, more because you are afraid to disobey this continent-sized dragon that you are hungry. As you eat, you watch in amazement as Levice slowly places the land he was holding back on the ground. "So, new knight, while you are here, is there anything you'd like to ask your king?"

You have a ton of questions about Levice, but you think it might be more important to know exactly what you're getting into with this knight business. "Well, King Levice, I can't help but wonder why a powerful huge dragon like you needs knights."

"While it may be true that my size has definitely proved useful in the past, I'm afraid that there's not much I can do now against our enemies," replies the king. "They are becoming smarter; they blend in with my loyal subjects and take control from within my territories. Though they surely will not challenge me, I also cannot slay them without harming millions of my own people."

"I get it, you need human knights because they can defeat enemies individually, while you are more suited to defeating entire armies."

"Exactly. But enough about war strategy, now should be a time of celebration for you! You're a knight now, and that is a great achievement! After breakfast, I was thinking that you could show me some of your excellent skills I have heard so much about!"

You freeze, not realizing that you had any skills suitable for a knight. Especially when Levice tells you that he is especially interested in...
1141.title: Seat of Honor

choices: You really are good with a sword.
You can’t even lift your sword right.
11411.content:
“I would be extremely interested in seeing your mastery of the sword. It has been said that you are the finest swordsman of your generation,” said Levice. You could barely keep your jaw from dropping in surprise. One of the only things you knew about swords was that the pointy end goes in the other guy. And you could not just be good with a sword here; you had to be “the finest swordsman of your generation.”

You hated to think about what would happen to you if you disappointed this dragon king. He had destroyed much of the surrounding countryside just by walking around and pretty much isolated the various human communities. You hated to think about what he could do to a person on purpose when he was angry. If you showed that you were not any good with a sword he might think that you are a fake that had done something to his real knight and he seemed like he really cared about his people.

You had to think of a way to get good with a sword extremely quickly. Then you thought about how ridiculous that notion was. There was no way you were going to get good with a sword between now and the end of breakfast. Maybe you could say that you were felling a little sick after eating breakfast. That might not work out too well either after you think about how societies in the Middle Ages worked. The cook might get blamed for poisoning you and then things would not work out too well for that cook. As much as you want out of this situation you do not want to get anyone else in trouble either. You were just going to have to hope for the best when you performed inadequately.

Despite the jovial feel in the air that went along with breakfast you were too nervous to eat much. Pretty much all you could do was observe the day’s activities. Your father was busy congratulating you most of the time and you received quite a bit of attention from the opposite gender. Even King Levice joined in on the celebration as best he could. He was probably the reason the celebration was being held outside. It was surprising that he was able to converse with his subjects so easily at his size. You would think that something as large as that dragon would not be able to see or hear a human. You thought he might be a magical or something like that. Levice would occasionally dip his massive head down so close to the ground that people would hand feed him treats like fruits and meats which he would kindly thank people for doing and he once again left you surprised that he could even taste those foods. That also made you wonder how much it took to feed a dragon that was of god like proportions.

The celebration stretched breakfast out, but it still came to and end too soon for you. Everyone, including Levice, was urging you to demonstrate your skill and you were forced to comply. You walked out to the demonstration grounds that had been set up during breakfast hesitantly. “There is no need to be humble knight, show me what you are capable of,” Levice called down from above. At least he had mistaken your fear for humility. Maybe he would accept that as an excuse for your poor swordsmanship.
11411.title: What to Do

choices: You wake up shortly after to confront Levice with your questions.
Skip to tommorow, when you're in the courtyard with the other knights.
114111.content:
There you were, standing in the middle of the grounds, sword in hand, hundreds of eyes on you, one pair incredibly large and excited. You sigh as you raise your sword and grip it with both hands. You feel very nervous about what may happen after you fail to impress everyone, but the time for that isn't now. You look at the crowd, then at Levice.

"Well, here goes nothing." you whisper.

You begin with simple strokes, swinging your sword around in the air. For some reason, it's as if your mind already knows the basic technique of swinging a sword around at a subconscious level. As you continue through the list in your head, you are a bit stunned at what you were doing. You began doing more complex strokes in the air, even spinning the sword around in your hands a few times. You can hear the cheers of the crowd, calling out your name.

"Wonderful, new knight. You are quite talented, as some of the others have told me. But perhaps you need a partner to fully show your skills. Ashe, one of my most trusted knights shall assist you."

One person walked up to you, wearing armor with a sword sheathed at the side. You look in surprise to see Ashe a woman! In fact, she seems to be a couple years older than you. She seemed a couple inches taller, and had shoulder-length reddish-pink hair.

"It is a pleasure to meet you, new knight. I am Ashe, captain of King Levice's personal guard knights."

"A-a pleasure to meet you too. My name is Joshua." you say. You honestly didn't expect her to be the captain of Levice's personal guards.

"Now, let us not keep our liege waiting. Show me your skill, new knight."

She brandishes her sword, holding it up in front of her. You almost immediately know what to do next. You lightly tap the side of her sword with yours, a swordsman's greeting. Then, she takes a step back, and you do the same. The two of you circle around each other, sizing each other up. You're sure that she must be an experienced fighter to be one of the dragon's most trusted knights. Ashe, staring at you in the eyes, takes her chance and attacks. You parry her attack with your own, and you launch your counterattack. She blocks it and strikes again. The two of you go at it for a while, the crowd cheering for you both as Levice watches the show with delight. If you were surprised with how good you turned out to be, then you're stunned with how well Ashe can maneuver between your techniques, dodging, blocking, and counterattacking with every chance she gets.

"You are as good as they say you are." she said.

"Thank you."

"But you do still need training."

Ashe swings her sword in an upwards motion, and you bring your sword down to block it. But the force of her attack actually knocks the sword out of your hands, and it lands a few feet away from you. You look to your sword, then back at Ashe, who by now it pointing the tip of her sword right at your face. You gulp, unsure of what will happen to you now.

"That will be enough Ashe." Levice said.

Ashe sheathes her sword and bows to you. You return the bow as Ashe returns to the crowd. You move to the sword, picking it up from the ground. You look at Levice, who smiles warmly at you.

"You have shown remarkable skill, knight. Truly, you are the best of your generation. In fact, I remember clearly that most of the newly knighted could only last but a few minutes when Ashe is to spar with them. I hope that you will become as strong and as loyal as my other knights. You have quite a bit of potential, quite a bit indeed. I now dub thee, Joshua, knight 1st class!"

The crowd cheers once more as you raise your sword. You were feeling pretty happy right now, getting complemented by the brown-scaled king. When everything has been said and done, you walk down the halls of the castle, heading to your room. You'll be receiving your own personal sword and armor tomorrow when training starts. But for now, you just wanna head back to your room to rest from that match with Ashe. Speaking of Ashe, when you make the turn around the corner that leads to the hall with your room, you see Ashe standing there, waiting outside your door. She notices you and approaches.

"Congratulations Joshua. Not many paiges are immediately given the title of 1st class."

"Ah, thank you Ashe. I'm actually a bit, eh, surprised myself."

"Hmm, understandable. The lowest class a knight is given is 3rd, and they make up the majority of King Levice's army. 2nd class knights are elite, and they watch over the 3rds to make sure they haven't made any mistakes during the tasks they are given. They are also the ones who give out the tasks to be done by the 3rds and paiges. 1st class is the highest, and only the greatest knights, or those with potential thereof, attain this. They can answer to Levice himself, and they are more commonly known as his personal guards. This is usually because any tasks given to us come from the king himself."

You nod your head, taking in all the information as best you can. Yet, you can't help but ask one question. "I see, but why do you tell me all of this?"

"Because it seemed to me that you didn't fully understand the position given to you. So, I brought it upon myself to inform you. Unless, of course, you already knew all of this?"

"I, ah, didn't mean it like that. Thank you for telling me."

"You're welcome. Oh, and a squire will be assigned to you tomorrow, as well as your equipment. Don't be late for training."

She walks away, with you thinking about what she just said. You get to have your own squire? You actually feel a bit excited about this. You head into your room, resting your body on top of your bed. You just stare at the ceiling, thinking about how you life somehow changed overnight. You still have tons of questions, but for now, maybe a little nap will be best.
114111.title: Surprisingly Talented

choices: Show the proper respect--he's still a king, after all.
To heck with it. Let him know exactly how you feel!
1141111.content:
As it turned out, your nap had indeed done wonders for you. The initial shock and confusion of the day weren't quite gone, but the brief rest had fashioned them into a new determination: a drive that, incidentally, befit your new status as a knight of the realm:

You were going to find out just what the HECK was going on. And you were going straight to the top...to Levice himself.

Smoothing out some wrinkles in your clothes, you make your way down the castle's hall; your footfalls echo as they come down on the stone. You mumble thanks to a few passing staff and guards as they congratulate you, then stop as you come to a set of wooden double-doors. You take a deep breath, steeling yourself. Your idea on confronting Levice was brazen and probably a little stupid, but you couldn't bring yourself to just go along with this world turned upside-down. You had to know what was behind this; there were so many things that didn't add up: having no memory of Levice or his rule, the inexplicable skill with a sword, why everyone else acted like nothing was strange...

Determined, you push the heavy doors open and walk out onto the courtyard. Groundskeepers clear away seating and patch up any damage to the grass as crowds of people of every age and class mill about, chattering. Most of the talk seemed to be about you and your new knighthood.

And, high above it all, there was Levice. Or rather, his head, partially hidden by clouds as he thundered on. Squinting, you see his lips moving and his eyes focused inward toward his muzzle--he must have been talking with someone, then. Well, as rude as it was to interrupt royalty...you weren't going to just give up now. Readying your nerve one last time, you cup your hands over your mouth and call up to the dragon king.

"Your Highness! I have to speak with you, it's...important! Very important!!" A few people stop and watch you. From their expressions, shouting up at Levice and all but demanding his attention isn't something knights do often. You catch a few whispers that sound like "no respect", but otherwise you're left alone.

Levice's eyes flick to you and you flinch. Even with your determination and the colossal dragon's kind attitude, the difference in power is immense. Your father had said Levice had united---or perhaps conquered--much of the world in a single day; that he had ruled for nine thousand years. You were dealing with something that bordered on godlike...

"Joshua! Are you well?" Levice's voice snaps you out of your reverie. Now attentive, you see that he turned his head fully to speak with you, and a look of concern across his scaly, mountain-sized face. "You called out to me, but just stood there silent afterwards. Is something wrong, young knight?"

You shake your head, idly wondering how he even heard you. "I-I'm well...King Levice. I have to ask you some....important questions, about...well, everything." An edge came into your voice, "I need to speak with you as soon as possible." You ignored the brief whispers from passerby. Nobody stopped this time, but it didn't matter to you. To heck with knightly tradition, you wanted answers.

For a wonder, Levice actually chuckles; the sound makes the ground shake. "I'd prefer a touch more deference, but I'm always pleased when my subjects can be direct with me. I'll oblige, Joshua." Once again, Levice reaches down with his massive, sky-filling free hand and gently plucks you off the ground. Smiling at you, he gently sets you down on his snout...and you notice Ashe already there, rolling up what looks like a map along with other sheets of paper and slipping them into a messenger bag. She looks rather surprised at your arrival, glancing between you and Levice for a moment. "Ashe, your proposal is interesting, and I'll give it consideration. We'll discuss this later, but for now you must return to your normal duties."

Ashe salutes, clenched fist over her heart. "Thank you, My King. It is all I could ask for."

Levice gives a quick nod--the tilting "ground" making you lose your balance--before he pinches Ashe off his nose and sets her back down in the tiny kingdom in his hand. Then he turns his gaze to you. "Now then, you said you had 'urgent questions' for me, Joshua? What's troubling you?"

No turning back now...it was time to get some answers about all this. Why you didn't remember any of this world, where Levice had come from; everything. The only question was how to make your case....
1141111.title: Confronting the Dragon

choices: Ask Levice what he and Ashe were discussing.
Get some more history from Levice--how'd he become king, where he came from, etc
11411111.content:
Before you speak, you take a deep breath and mentally count to ten. Some part of you wants to all-out rant at Levice and demand answers, but you know that would just make things worse. Badmouthing the king was a dumb thing to do as a knight, more so when he was a dragon the size of a continent who could carry an entire country in his palm. Levice didn't seem to be a dragon of the "eats people who make him angry" sort, but you didn't want to test his patience.

Looking Levice straight in his eyes...that easily dwarf your entire body...you salute as Ashe did, clenched fist over your heart. "My King, what's troubling me is...everything, since I woke up this morning. I'll be honest with you: before today, I have no memory of you or your rule--in fact, I'd regarded dragons as fictional creatures."

Levice quirks an eyebrow at that, but stays quiet.

Emboldened, you continue "I'd never wielded a sword before, either. Barely even touched anything bigger or more deadly than a steak knife. When I was even halfway competent with a blade, I could hardly believe it! And...even that I would use a sword was a shock. Everything here is practically medieval; knights, swordsmanship, the clothes...I remember it as something out of a museum, not what I'd see every day!" You clasp your hands behind your back and begin pacing up and down his snout.

Levice's manner remains impassive as you pace, the words still spilling forth. "I'm honored to be your knight, King Levice. I truly am...but all this; something isn't right here! Perhaps it's with me; maybe this is just memory loss and I'm rambling, but--"

"Joshua. Be still, young knight!" Levice rumbles. His tone carries power and authority, and you instantly clamp your mouth closed and stop your pacing. But his words are also free of anger, or even annoyance. The titanic drake almost sounds...concerned. "You were right to bring this to my attention, young knight. I noticed your distress and confusion this morning--you went pale when asked to demonstrate your swordsmanship; when you showed your own skill, you looked absurdly surprised. I spoke with your father during the festivities, and he told me that you barely remembered anything. He chalked it up to a lack of sleep, but when you finally saw me, you looked utterly terrified. Though you seemed well otherwise...I knew something was distressing you."

Hope and relief swell up within you. "So...you suspected something?"

"I've ruled for thousands of years, dear boy. Even at my size, you don't stay king that long without learning to spot trouble." You can't see much of Levice's face, but the smirk is clear on his voice. It only lasts a moment, though, and he's serious once more. "But to the real matter: you say you may have simply lost your memory somehow?"

You nod and slowly start pacing again, though not as frantic as before. "Yes, King Levice...but even if that's all there is, it doesn't explain my skills with a sword,or why nothing triggered my supposedly 'lost' memories in the first place. Or why I remember the world being so different than this." You grunt in frustration, "It's almost like the entire world just changed overnight; like history was re-written...!"

Levice's snout shakes beneath you as the dragon king grumbles deep in his throat. He looks puzzled, almost confused. "Hmmmm....this is most odd, my young knight. Troubling, even....I do not think this is merely your mind being addled. I have memories of you, as an eager recruit to my knights, always wanting to speak with me when I came by." He snorts, shooting brief gouts of smoke from his nostrils. "Rest assured, I will look into this. Both myself, and through my scholars and advisors. We will find answers for you eventually, Joshua. You have your King's word."

Your heart soars. Levice understood! You were worried your concerns would be blown off or even land you in trouble, but he was just as worried about this as you were! You had an ally in all this, and he was--literally--the biggest help around! "Thank you, King Levice! You don't know how much this relieves me!" You stand at attention and clap a fist over your heart in salute.

Levice chuckles. "You are welcome, young knight. Now, is there anything else you wanted to discuss?"
11411111.title: Calm Questions with the King

114111111.content:
Nothing that was really on the mind, but when a seismic dragon literally holding your world in his hand was in the question, how could you say no?

Levice cracks an eyebrow upwards as you stall, trying to find one single question to piece together all the thousands of existential crises you'd waded through in the past few hours, but they're all far too complex, too difficult to all sum up in less than a decade. Instead, of all the things you could've started off with, your mind only links back to Ashe, and whatever it was the two of them were talking about. "What were you and, uh... Ashe doing before?"

Levice smiles, but looks more excited then his default kind and noble face. "A thread to sew back many of the divided nations of this world, young knight. A path to finally bring the earth back to its green and blue beauty!"

"Nations?" You say, immediately interested. You look back out at the endless plains of stone and gray that Levice walks upon, the land devoid of any trees of life for there to even be a state made out of, let alone a whole empire. "You mean there's still people out there?"

Levice's mouth lowers back down in a frown, his eyes turning somber as they turn back to the ground. "None left for the world below to let live, my boy. What little remains could only exist in the skies of the other gods, as well."

Woah...what? "Did you say...other gods? There's more dragons?!"

His face grows confused, then concerned, stepping back into the case of your supposed amnesia, then he tries to force up a smile. "A few, as far as I'd seen, but I'd seen many gryphon, pegasus, and a few manticores, just too name a few." He explains. "But yes, if it interests you, I'd been discussing with her to be the main ambassador of this project to commune with another god-bound city!"

"...wow." Is all you can say. You're body'd been numbed long ago to shock, so the impact just bounces right off you.

"In fact, as your first duty as a knight, would you be interested in joining her?" He asks. "It might do you wonders for your new title?"

Your mouth opens up, but then you get a hold of yourself, letting your brain turn his words over a few times. "Well...I'll think about it, but what would exactly would I be doing?"

"Nothing you don't already know about." He chuckles, but his face freezes as he realizes what he'd just said, and he clears his throat. "...As in you'd be accompanying to meet another dragon. You'd help Ashe discuss trade agreements and the like, the usual written work, but you'd also just be making friends and leaving a nice impression to let the rest of their subjects want to know of us more. Sound interesting?"

"Well, who exactly would I be dealing with?"
114111111.title: Ask Levice what he and Ashe were discussing.

choices: Choose a Different Position in this Setting
1143.content:
"Quick, wake up darling!" You hear a familiar voice call out. As you come to you see your wife standing over you with a nervous look in her eyes. "Come on," She says, "It's your big day and you don't want to keep her majesty waiting."

You start up and begin to panic yourself. Clearly you're in a parallel universe and the Queen herself is expecting you for something. Then things start to become noticeable. There are some very high standard rennaisence clothing against a chair; the room looks very castle-like and you have a view over a magnificent city that looks as though it belongs in the 15th Century.

Some servants come in and dress you, ensuring that you look the part, and then your wife escorts you downstairs. The whole building seems to be something of a castle design.

"You just have time for some breakfast." Your wife tells you as she leads you into a dining hall where a hearty spread has been laid out.

As you have breakfast you ask your wife.

"Tell me again, my dear, what is it that her majesty has requested my services for?" Your wife looks up at you and seems to let the question sink in.

"It isn't unusual for people to forget in the excitement." She comments. "She's been so impressed by your loyalty and diligence that she has decided to make you a Knight of the Tiara!" This sounds impressive; in your old universe the Knight of the Garter was a most esteemed position so you wouldn't be surprised if the Knight of the Tiara was at least an equal position in this universe.

After breakfast there is a heralding of trumpets and a figure dressed in what could only be full regalia enters.

"My lord," He addressed you, "The Queen awaits your presence." You nod, excuse your wife and follow the man out to a truly splendid coach.

You're suprised by the journey; the horses were taking their time when you consider how urgent everyone had sounded and there was nothing to see but castles, manors and other high class buildings as far as the eye could see. You'd expect the royal palace to be grander than all of this.
1143.title: Mega's Tropolis

11431.content:
"Excuse me," You address your escort, he acknowledges you, "But I thought we'd be going faster than this; after all no one likes to keep royalty waiting." He smiles in both understanding and also in a sense of knowing something.

"Your concern for her royal majesty is second to none." He comments. "It is no surprise to me why she has chosen you to be a Knight of the Tiara but surely you must understand that we don't want to tire the horses. Her extremely-highness has shown such consideration to her subjects that she made clear instructions for a no-build zone around her palace lest she accidentally destroy any buildings." You let this sink in; you're beginning to understand that her highness must either be very strong or very big, though at this stage you can't know how big.

The carriage passes through an impressive gateway and out into open country. It travels through fields and forests, up and down hills and across rivers and streams. You're stunned by just how far you have to go to reach the Royal Palace.

As you round a steep hill you suddenly see an amazing sight. There before you is the Royal Palace. It is absolutely grand! From the distance it looks like a city all in itself where the royal family, their servants and the most privalaged peerages could live. It'd probably take all day to get from one side to the other.

As you close in you realise it's even bigger than you first assumed. The windows must be over one-hundred feet tall and the whole structure seems to have been built into the mountain range itself.

"It never seizes to amaze me either." Your escort comments. "And I must've worked at her majesty's palace for at least four years." You know that the awe of the sight can't be hidden from your face so you accept your escort's comment and continue to watch the palace loom higher and higher as the carriage gets nearer and nearer.

Finally you feel the carriage slow as you see some quite impressive gates come into view. They seem to be quite small compared to the wall they're in; thirty foot high gates in a four hundred foot high wall. When the horses drawing your carriage stop a palace guard approaches; he does not have such regalia as your escort but his uniform is still a smart piece of tailory.

"Good evening, sir!" He greets you followed by a nod at your escort. "You are expected." With that he signals the other guards and the gates open.

Upon passing through the gates another awe-inspiring sight comes to you. The palace grounds not only stretch for squares of hectares but some of the plants seem to be significantly bigger than expected, though they are still small compared to the wall.

It's a long ride through the vast palace grounds before the palace itself comes into view. You can hardly comprehend its scale; the steps leading to the entrance are each the height of the wall! The horses do not slow at all.

As you head for the stairs you are surprised to see a set of double doors just under the height of the gate set into the stone of the lowest stair. They open to let the carriage through.

Now you take in the corridor that the carriage is travelling through; it is a most impressive piece illuminated by what seem to be gas lamps and has an architecture more closely associated with the Georgians. The horses begin to slow.
11431.title: Arriving at the Palace

114311.content:
When the horses stop you see a grand stone staircase at one side of the carriage, obviously leading into the palace proper. A couple of palace guards approach your coach and open the door; you and your escort step out.

A figure wearing colourful robes descends the staircase and greets you.

"Everyone is getting ready for the ceremony." He informs you with a posh accent; either it's expected of him or he's from a posh family. He leads both you and your escort up the stairs towards a classical set of double doors, blazened with what must either be gold or brass and the woodwork painted bright red.

The room on the other side of these doors is impressive in itself; a grand hall that's second to none, furnished plentifully with portraits and tapestries hung on the walls and what looks like a persian carpet on the floor.

"Please remove your shoes." The doorman instructs you; while your escort does so like it's nothing too special you remove yours reverently, not wanting to soil the stately setting. The doorman produces a pair of decorated slippers that are not only comfortable but also your exact size. "Please wait and make yourselves comfortable." The doorman continues as he shuts the double doors and then goes up the grand staircase leading up and out of the grand hall.

Once your escort and yourself are the only ones in the hall you begin to look around, being curteous enough to take your time and not to touch the extravagent items in the room.

"Oh, do sit down." Your escort comments. "Her majesty doesn't order such exquisite furniture for no reason." You smile nervously and take a seat on the sofa where you can look straight at your escort.

"Are you a knight of the Tiara yourself?" You ask him; he looks at you with a surprised expression before replying sheepishly.

"Good lord, no. A knight of the Tiara never escorts a member-to-be. I am the Queen's page first class member seven. You know it's customary for a person who's to be a member of such a high order to be escorted by a first class royal page; on top of that a first class page must also read the induction speech." You seem more than surprised. This man is one of the Queen's highest ranking pages and he also has to make a speech during the ceremony. Looking up from your seat you suddenly notice something that should have been obvious.

The bay window opposite the double doors has green curtains closed over it; it's not too surprising to find the curtains closed, there could be any number of reasons for that. It's no surprise that a soft light is passing through them; you figure they must overlook something of the palace grounds. What is surprising is that these curtains are on the outside!

"Excuse me, sirs." A voice suddenly addresses you, you turn your head to see a maid had arrived. "Can I get you anything?" She offers.

"Thanks," The page replies, "I'll have a port. And for you?" You think about this; you're not entirely sure what drinks are available in this world aside from alcoholic drinks. You decide that it might be honourable to show some humility.

"I'll just have a glass of water, thank you." You answer; the maid curtsies and walks down the hall.

After what seems to be just over an hour, eight glasses of water and one trip to the bathroom, two footmen come down the grand staircase and ask you to follow them. As you follow them back up the staircase the page follows you.
114311.title: Going to See the Queen

1143111.content:
After a long trek through the winding well-decorated corridors of the palace you arrive in an inconspicuous room where a couple of men wearing the sort of clothes you'd expect to find on someone in the Tour de France; an alcove houses something that explains why. There's a large rickshaw-like object in it, set on rails with two bicycle seats at the front with a more comfortable seat behind them.

"Please be seated." One of the footmen invites you into this unusual contraption; you hesitantly get in first while the page enters next before the two men take their positions on the 'cycle seats. The other footman mutters something to them and, before you could say Eddy Merckx, they started pedalling.

The device moves forward slowly at first but soon picks up speed; the journey in this thing is surprisingly smooth and fast when you consider that only two cyclists are being used to propel it along. Windows on either side of the long tunnel it travels down let in light but pass by too quickly to see out of.

Eventually the cyclists slow to a stop at what looks like a platform. Two more footmen come down to greet you as you and the page exit the vehicle.

"Will they be alright?" You ask the page.

"Don't worry," He answers, "They usually swap with another pair after transporting somebody." This gives you satisfaction as the footmen guide you to the door.

You travel through more laviously decorated corridors before the footmen lead you into what looks like a cloakroom. The page nudges you and says.

"Change into some shoes." You get the idea and seek out your size from amongst the wide selection available; in fact there's such a selection that you even get to choose a design you like. These shoes are clearly not for typical outdoor walking as they are too soft-soled and delicately patterned. A footman takes the slippers you were wearing and carries them off, most likely to store them somewhere.

The room after this is yet another hall; it's darker and smaller than the first with a flat window filling most of one wall, again with the curtains closed on the outside. You theorise that it must be deeper inside the palace. After a while waiting in this simpler room another footman enters and says.

"We're ready for you now." Just as you stand up the page whispers into your ear.

"Just to remind you, you follow the footman while I go up the stairs." You thank him for his helpful words and commence to do so. You watch as the footman walks straight ahead as you leave the doorway and up a winding staircase while you turn down the tiled corridor following the footman until you both come to another pair of double doors.

"I can go no further." The footman tells you. "But I will open the doors. I am told it is usual to remind sir that you are to walk to the end of the platform and kneel. Her majesty will guide you from there." You are surprised by this. Her majesty sounds like a very generous and considerate lady but you think that unless she made each instruction formal that it would sound very odd to anyone else present.

The footman opens the doors and you step through. The sight is mind-blowing. On one side is what looks like an extra large theatre box with well-dressed people in it, on the other side you see the page on a balcony; the theatre box is lower than the platform you're standing on while the balcony is higher. You walk slowly and reverently forward along the tiled plateau until you find yourself standing just behind a white circle that's practically on the edge; you kneel with one knee on this circle while you keep your other knee suspended above the floor and keep your eyes on the ledge, remembering the basic rule not to make eye-contact with the monarch on first encounter.

Suddenly a series of rhythmic earthquakes runs through the area; you resist the urge to look up as best you can but your eyes can't help but be drawn upwards where you see an astonishing sight. A massive silhouette is approaching you; every step it takes coincides with an earthquake. This figure has an unusual look to it; it's got a human figure but also has an animal figure. You bring your eyes back to the ledge for fear of what you'll see.

Eventually a shadow descends on you; an area of colour has turned up where you're looking, confusing you further. Then you hear a grand yet angelic voice address you.

"Look to me, honourable one." That must be the Queen's voice; you raise your head and take in what is clearly a massive anthro and as you look higher you notice that the Queen is, in fact, a colossal mountainous anthro...
1143111.title: Meet the Queen

choices: The Queen wishes to Speak to you in Private
The Queen lets you join your fellow Knights
11431111.content:
You're agog; the queen is an anthro-wolf standing over two miles in height. You think back and understand everything you've seen. Why the palace is so far from the nearest town, why the palace is so huge, why the steps to the palace are four-hundred feet high.

"Lord Nathan of Harbingdon," The Queen announces, "By virtue of the power avested in me by the powers-that-be and my own birth, I hereby dub you knight of the Tiara. Arise Nathan, Knight of the Tiara." As she named you 'knight of the tiara' you felt something large and smooth on your back. A regular monarch would knight you with a sword, because of her size this queen knighted you with one of her claws. You stand upon her instruction and your eyes follow her mountainous form from her waist all the way up into her enormous eyes. "Will the page read the induction speech?" She requests, the page who escorted you produces a parchment and unrolls it. You are unsure as whether to look at her majesty or the page; fortunately she uses her claw to turn you towards the page.

"Your majesty, Queen Mikayla, members of the Order of the Tiara," The page addresses all present, "Lord Nathan was born on the 19th April 1549, an only child of a humble couple. His father was a member of her majesty's revenue services, employed to find reasons why people hadn't paid tribute to her majesty. His mother was employed in her majesty's employment and trade management services as a secretary to the pensions office. As a boy Nathan expressed great interest in the exploits of her royal majesty, his teachers regularly remarked on his great performance in subjects like history and social studies. When he reached manhood he discovered that his feelings of admiration and loyalty to her majesty were embedded at a very deep level and received high acclaim for his patriotic speeches at school. Once he reached the end of his scholarship he joined her majesty's security forces as a humble archer; he quickly rose through the ranks and became an esteemed swordsman who quelled many rebellions in the far reaches of the Kingdom of Rylio. By the age of 20 her majesty granted him lordship of the town of Harbingdon and awarded him the Royal Ring Medal." You look at the medals on your chest and identify the first medal from the middle as being this. "In the following year Lord Nathan met Samantha, daughter of Lord John of Ebbingdale; they got on well and formed a friendship. This companionship allowed the opening of a new road between the town of Harbingdon and the village of Ebbingdale. At the age of twenty-two Samantha of Ebbingdale asked for Lord Nathan's hand in marriage; both families were in full support but Lord Nathan, being a dedicated officer of her majesty's security forces, could not accept the offer without seeking her majesty's approval..."

"I was most surprised by your request." Queen Mikayla comments, you turn to her. "Most officers in my security forces only approach their CO or the Field Marshall." You start to feel guilty and embarrassed. "It was clear to all of us that you felt that patriotism and loyalty to the queen mattered more than the loyalty of marriage, but your feelings could not be changed. I granted you permission to marry and remain in my service."

"After the marriage," The page continues, "Lord Nathan was awarded the Loyalty Medal of the Cup." That must have been the second one from the centre of your chest. "Six months after the marriage a major uprising occured closer to the Royal Palace than had ever occured before his his lifetime. When Lord Nathan led a regiment to quell this rebellion the sheer weight of rebels was overwhelming; her majesty was just coming out to deal with the rebels when Lord Nathan drove his regiment into them against the odds. Many rebels were downed but the regiment started to suffer casualties. Seeing two loyal soldiers being cut down and observing the struggle of the rest of his regiment, Lord Nathan ordered them to fall back but did not go with them. He stood his ground and downed several rebels but the odds were againsts him. If her majesty had not intervened when she did there would have been a good chance that he would have fallen in battle."

"That was such a sight as to take me aback." The queen tells you. "Such loyalty as to sacrifice yourself for the skae of your regiment, your country and yours truly. I personally brought you to the Royal Ward and asked the doctors and nurses to treat you for your wounds. Upon the day you recovered I decided that your actions were worth another medal."

"The Letter Opener Medal." The page identifies, obviously the medal closest to your shoulder. "For one whole year afterwards Lord Nathan maintained a prosperous economy in Harbingdon and led several regiments to clear victories in the far reaches of Rylio and even brought a neighbouring province into the grand kingdom."

"It was your loyalty, diligence and consideration," Queen Mikayla explains, "That made you a most worthy candidate for a knight of the Tiara. Your final steps to your new position came from such high level patriotism and humility."

You are amazed by the page recounting your life story, supported by the Queen herself. What will happen next?
11431111.title: Queen Mikayla

choices: "You seemed to be surprised by your life story."
114311111.content:
"Lord Nathan," Queen Mikayla addresses you, "I wish to speak to you in private before the ceremony can continue." Having said this she lowers one of her paws down until it is level with the platform upon which you stand. Bowing before her you reverently step onto her proferred paw, which must have an area equivalent to that of the second hall you were escorted to.

Queen Mikayla lifts you into the air and strolls off with you in tow. The whole palace whizzes by as you're carried by her majesty to parts unknown. You see whole regiments of servants keeping the giant palace in a condition worthy of royalty. After a few minutes you decide to keep your eyes upon her majesty as you consider what must be and what might be regarding her royal lifestyle in relation to her titanic stature; your mind is flooded by questions that you wish to ask her, though some you do not wish to ask on fear of reprimands even if permitted to.

Eventually the Queen enters what must be a dressing room and sets you down upon the dressing table, right between a fur brush the size of a cruise ship and a powder compact the size of a Shakespearean theatre. You look up at Queen Mikayla as she takes a seat in front of you, putting her waist at your eye-level instead of her groin.

"Now then, Lord Nathan," She addresses you again, "I don't usually do this with the newest Knights of the Tiara but you're a curious case." This causes you to look up into her house-sized eyes with an expression of bewilderment. "It was amazing to see that you kept your head down as I approached, every other member kept raising his head slightly as I approached."

"I'm not too surprised by that, your majesty," You tell her, "I don't think anyone can get over your grandeur." The Queen smiles sweetly upon hearing this and says.

"That is true, my size is the source of much awe, respect and, alas, fear. Though I didn't see you move at all until I instructed you to I'm guessing that your eyes couldn't keep from trailing towards me." You blush but, inspite of your great size difference, she notices this and smiles again, only more teasingly than previous. She goes on to say.
114311111.title: A Private Royal Word

choices: She takes you back to the Ceremony
She wants to Talk to you some more
1143111111.content:
You look straight up at Queen Mikayla once she says this, partly out of surprise and partly out of faux defiance.

"Majesty," You exclaim, "Whatever gave you that impression?" She seems to smile at this and bends down even further, meaning that you can see nothing but her face.

"You looked agog as the induction speech was read, and it seems that you were trying to put two-and-two together. I did so afterward and came to one conclusion," Her head lowered right down until her chin was level with the edge of the table, "You can't remember your life." You swallow nervously, there was no hiding the truth and if anything was to happen to you you'd rather get it over and done with and not hold it off with lies and diseet.

"I confess!" You exclaim as you throw yourself onto the tabletop. "I don't remember any of it happening. I don't deserve to be a Knight, I might as well be a slave." You feel Mikayla's giant claw rubbing against your back, you chance a look up at her. She's no longer got her face right down the table-level but she's still bending over you.

"Now, now, Lord Nathan." She says soothingly. "Don't belittle yourself," There's a slight giggle as she realises the pun, "Nobody's punished for having amnesia otherwise there'll be severe terror in Rylio and I can see no moral reason for doing so either." You sit up on the table as her claw curls round you compassionately. "You do deserve your title and your actions here make you all the more worthy. Humility and attention to duty are among the most highly valued principles around here." What happens next?
1143111111.title: Confession

11432.content:
You wake up in an unusual setting; you seem to be in a stone-walled bedroom that had a slightly Spartan look about it, although there were some extras. Someone sticks their head round the door.

"I'm glad to see that you're awake, my lord." He says. "You must hurry as the tournament starts soon." You start up. Clearly you're in a different world were you hold a significant social position and you're required to do things like jousting.

After you get up the man moves to disrobe you; holding up your hand you commence to do it yourself and put your own clothes on. He seems to be surprised by your insistance on dressing yourself. However you find you have trouble with the armour and such-like, so the man, obviously a squire, does this bit for you.

Exiting the room you follow the squire down a spiral stair case and through various corridors, each one more decorative than the last. Finally you exit whatever building you are in and find yourself going along a long track leading to what must be the tournament field.

You are amazed by the mass of people here to watch, not to mention the vast stalls to seat them all. Most tournaments would only have people in high positions in seats in stalls, most would be standing on grass.

As you enter the tournament field you're amazed by the vast expanse; football pitches would be smaller than this. All around are stalls occupied by various persons of various social rankings, except one.

In one special seat is an anthro-wolf, a giant female wolf, she had to be at least five miles tall!

"Good knight," She addresses you, "Will you be able to take on any challenge made by any one willing to fight against you?" You hesitate as you think about your answer; you don't want to upset her as she is clearly the queen of this land but you don't want to show yourself up. The cheering crowds help motivate your decision.

"I will, your majesty." You reply.
11432.title: A Queen's Knight

11433.content:
As you wake up, you grunt slightly as if you're in intense pain. You get up and feel your head and realize that you have a large bandage on your head and you feel around to sense some scars. "Huh?" you ask. You then look and gasp to see you're missing part of your shoulder. "What is going on?!" you yell. You then see a man with dark skin in Egyptian garbs carrying a cobra shaped staff. "Ah, General Atomos, you're finally awake."

You look down to see your chest is not only well muscled, but covered in all sorts of scars and you're wearing an Egyptian style garb you'd expect on someone really important. "General?" You ask. "Me? What happened." The doctor just gives a smile. "We won the war." "War?! What war? Did something happen that I didn't know about. Ouch!" You feel your head is throbbing like crazy. You must've sustained a heavy injury. The doctor runs up to you and helps you off the bed you were on and you look around to see you'e in an Egyptian temple. You run out and see nothing but desert sands for miles and the room is decorated with multiple animal totems the size of skyscrapers.

"Rest now General," said the doctor. "You took the greatest injuries against the Remulans. "Remulans?" you ask. "Who are the Remulans." "Doctor," says a female voice. "Has the general awakened." You turn your head to see a dark skinned girl around your age, with bright blue eyes and markings on her face and shoulders. She was wearing gold scarab shaped earrings and a blue Egyptian dress with the Eye of Horus around her neck. "Ah," said the doctor. "Princess Nefira. I'm glad to report General Atomos has made a full recovery. Almost." "Princess?" you ask in confusion. Nefira looks at you in pure concern. "Oh no," she says as she walks up to you and feels your head. "Amnesia. Mother will need to see him immediately." "Mother?" you ask in shock. "You mean the queen." "Of course," says Nefira. "Follow me. Mother wants to congratulate you personally for the victory against the Remulans."

Nefira walks down a long hallway, prompting you to follow behind her. You look to see the hallway is quite high and must go on for miles. "Uh," you say. "Princess was it? What exactly happened?" Nefira turns her head and continues to look in concern. "You really don't remember? It was a terrible battle. Even my mother the queen had to join the war." "Wow? That bad." Nefira gives a really frightend look. "You haven't heard the worst. The Remulans had a weapon that could even take Mother out." You're wondering why they would need a specific weapon to take out the queen. She must've been quite powerful. "Fortunately you stopped them and killed their general before they could use it. For that I thank you. Okay. We're here. The throne room.

You and Princess Nefira walk up to the door and you see that the door appeared to be attached to the center of a much larger door that looked several times the size of a skyscraper. Nefira opens the door and calls out to her mother. "Mother!" she yells. "General Atomos is awake!" "Excellent." Says another female voice. "I was beginning to worry about my bravest soldier's well being." You look forward and are in total surprise and awe. Queen Terweg wasn't even human. She was a gray skinned hippopotamus anthro with long black hair in a bob cut with a gold tiara with a hawk's head in the center, bearing sapphire eyes. She was wearing an ankh necklace and earrings much like her daughters along with a white regal dress. This hippo queen had red markings around her bright blue eyes and gold and silver bracelets around her arms. But what struck you most about your hippo queen was that she was huge. She was big enough to carry you and her human daughter among others on just one of her finger nails. This hippo had to be at least ten miles tall.
11433.title: The Nile Queen

choices: Terweg and Nefira take you to the Nile
114331.content:
You're in utter shock as you look up at this Nile queen, but Nefira isn't afraid of this giantess hippopotamus that is her mother and walks forward as the queen lowers a finger and allows her daughter to walk onto her fingernail, Nefira gestures to you and you gulp and walk up to the queen's nail. Queen Terweg lifts you up to her face big enough to build an entire landscape on. The two of you are soon in front of the queen's monumental snout.

"You have done well General," says the queen. "I owe you my life. If it weren't for you, the Remulans would've no doubt ended my life." "Uh," you say as you bow. "Thank you, your highness." You smiled as the queen smiled back at you, but those enormous hippo fangs of hers scared you deeply. Nefira gives a look of concern because she sees that her mother's neck is bandaged as well as her legs. That must've been a terrible battle if someone as big as this hippopotamus was injured as well. "Mother, with all due respect," says Nefira. "I don't think you should've ran in as hastily as that. You're much too big a target." The queen just lets out a snort and forces her daughter to hold down her skirt before she strokes her on the head and gives a smile. "I appreciate your concern Nefira. But I'm pretty sure that I can take on any threat to my kingdom."

You let out a grunt and think to yourself. "Why are you worrying about her? She's as big as a kingdom." Then you decide to ask the question you've been thinking about since you woke up. "Uh, your majesty. Not to seem rude but.." Queen Terweg looks up to you and brings both you and your daughter to the top of her nose to put you down in front of her moon sized eyes. "What is it General?" You gulp and then blurt it out. "Why are you a giant hippo?" The queen gives a shocked look and drops her jaw. "Oh no," she says. "I knew that head injury was worse than anyone thought." Nefira even bites her nails and then turns to you before walking across her mother's snout. "You really don't remember?" she asks. You shake your head and the princess lets out a sigh and slaps her face. "In our kingdom, whenever a new queen comes to power, the gods strip her of her humanity." "Strip her of her humanity."

Queen Terweg rubs her large stomach and picks up where her daughter left off. "The queen becomes a bestial titan to protect the kingdom. It is a different beast every time. As you noted, I was transformed into a hippopotamus much like the goddess Taweret." You then look to Nefira and see that she's very beautiful for a woman who's mother is a hippopotamus and then give a look of shock. "So that means." The queen nods her head causing you and Nefira to slide down and land in her cleavage. Nefira manages to land on solid ground while you fall into the cleavage canyon forcing her to dive in after you and pull you out as you both rest on the queen's left breast. "When Nefira comes to power," says Queen Terweg. "She too will become an anthro titan." Nefira then walks up to you and whispers into your ear. "Between you and me," she says. "I really hope I don't become a hippo like my mother." Terweg then picks up her daughter and places her in front of her eye as she gives a look of fear.

"And what is wrong with being a hippopotamus?" "Oh, oh, nothing mother. Not that you... I mean." The queen lets out a laugh and you laugh with her. She was just having a little fun with her tiny daughter. But then she gives a look of concern. "I'm afraid there is much that the general has to relearn about the kingdom he defends." The hippo monarch says.
114331.title: Queen Terweg

115.content:
So, the single mega-anthro shall be:

1: Boy/Girl Friend: The giant is a celebrity and, by a stroke of luck, cares about you the most.

2: Family Member: We've already had brother/sister but how about another family member.

3: Other: Your own choice/Miscellaneous.
115.title: Further Options

1151.content:
