"As if I would have tiny humans for dinner. I never hurt a soul in my life!" He looks back at you and seeing the wide eyed expression on your face, he quickly added: "That is... I never intentionally harmed anyone. Always have to be careful when dealing with such fragile, sentient people like yourself." He quickly looks away as if embarrassed. That is when another question came to your mind: "Do you have many guests round here?" You ask polity, so as not to make your Father feel any more embarrassed than he is. He shrugs casually. "From time to time. They mostly come round to inspect the place and see how I'm getting on. I greet them as equals and they do the same with me. Honestly it just helps to give them peace of mind that I'm the kind of giant creature that's likely to go on a blood thirsty rampage." He then gives you a kind, but also weak smile as if resigning to some sad truth. "It's not easy being big. And it can be pretty lonely out here when either people are not interested or too scared to come visit. That's why I'm always happy to know that you're here. That I still have family to spend time with."
You couldn't help but feel a little sad yourself, for this big wolf with his gigantic size and overwhelming power has to deal with a world that barely accepts him, that sees him more of a monster than a person, despite the fact he the most caring and kind hearted individual you've ever known. You cannot begin to express how fortunate you are to have such a relative.

After several long minutes, your Father's expression lightens up again as he spots the cooking meal. "Ah! Breakfast's ready!" He exclaimed excitedly. He dishes out the the eggs, toast and bacon and places them all on his plate, the waft of the food enticing your nostrils as they appear before you. Your Father sits down at the table just beside you and begins tearing off several small pieces of buttered toast, egg and bacon and handed ithem over to your own plate. It was all rather large compared to you, around the same size of boulders from a crumbling mountain, though judging by the fact your stomach is rumbling from sheer hunger persuaded you that you were perfectly capable of finishing the lot. "Thanks Dad!" You call back up to him, giving you a smile back.
"Don't mention it, my dear! Now help yourself." As you begin to tuck in, you watch as your Father did the same, only that he is positively 'wolfing' his down in such hungry chomps that you almost feel it's happening in fast forward. His knife and fork cuts, pokes and slices at the meal and sends the pieces of food flying into his open maw which continues to chomp, mash and swallow in gusto. Even his eyes seem to have changed, which were once calm and soft looking were now hungry and savaging like an actual predator ripping into his prey. You only hope you don't have to look into those eyes anytime soon, or end up in that fanged riddled maw by accident. After what seems like seconds to you, the big Wolf gives one last gulp of his meal and sighs in satisfaction. He even gives out a mighty belch which was enough to set off a hundred car alarms. You can only cover your ears and grin back up at him in amusement. "Nice one Dad!" You say to him. He grins back at you, reminding you of a naughty school boy who had just committed a mischievous prank. "Sorry about that." He replies in mock apology. "Old habits die hard as you people like to say. I'm still living by my old wolfish ways." He notices that you've hardly managed to eat halfway through your meal yet and folds his arms over his head and leans back on the chair. "You take your time child." He says, closing eyes and relaxing his now normal eyes. "I'm just going to lay back and let my meal digest."

You continue to finish your meal until you're down to the last crumb and feeling quite content yourself. Before you begin to finish up however, another question comes to mind. It arouse just when you remembered what your Father said about people being too scarred about meeting him and how he managed to sustain a life for himself in a world full of tiny people. You also remember the photos of your mother and how happy she looked with you in her arms and your Father barely seen in the background. How he said that you being here was the happiest he'd ever been knowing he still had a family. You look back up at your Father and wonder if he's ready to answer any of your seemingly endless questions. After all, he is the only key to unraveling your lost past. "Dad? Can I ask you something?" The wolf opened an eye to look back down at you. "Of course." He said kindly. "What is it?"
You decide what it is you like to know about and ask...
115221121121.title: How do you like your Titan in the mourning?

1152211211211.content:
Almost immediately after you pop the question, you Father opens both of his eyes to look down at you. He then brings himself back forward and brings his hands back down on the table, a look of mild surprise on his face. "Oh. Well..." He replied, scratching the side of muzzle as he tries to think of the best answer to your question. "I didn't think you would ask that. I always assumed your Mother would have told you beforehand or that you simply didn't care why." You only stare back back up at him, the need for answers too strong to hold back on. "I know it seems kind of out of the blue." You reply, simply keeping things as kindhearted as possible. "It's just that I wanted to understand how you two became close despite your species and sizes." You lower your head in hesitation, not quite sure how you can put being born from the colossal entity into words. "And... how you two had me." You're not sure how your Father would react to this, if fact you're quite sure he feels just as uncertain as you do about the relationship between the two of them. But suddenly, you feel a massive paw finger gently stroke you head, and then look up to see the Big Wolf smiling back down at you, a true Fatherly expression spread across his muzzle. "Of course, my child." He replies in his deep, affectionate voice. "You have the right to know how it all started between your Mother and I as well as how you came to be."
He then lowers his paw and motions for you to clamber on. You obediently climb up to the centre of his paw and lie yourself down so as to get a better view of your looming Father. Propping his elbow upon the table, he scratches the under side of his muzzle trying to think of the best way to begin the story. "Let's see." He says pondering to himself. "Where to start..."

"Just a year before you were born, I was traveling a fair distance away from where I used to live to explore the outside world, since I was more of a 'lone wolf' compared to most others of my kind. Anyway, I had just made it to the outer ridges of the mountain range that divided the two lands when I came across a rather peculiar group of people traveling along one the old forgotten roads leading through the forrest. I heard about tiny people like before when I was a cub, so I was curious to see what they were like up close. Through stealth and the cover of night, I learned that they were a research group trying to find evidence of large sentient life living just beyond the range. Since I overhead one of them talking about discovering intelligent life, I thought I might introduce myself to help verify their theory. So I made myself known by greeting them in the most welcoming, friendly manner I could think of: A Howling of welcome. The people however, being the tiny defenceless beings that they were, took the message to that of "I'm going to eat you!" rather than "Greetings friends!" Naturally, nearly all of them ran away from the sight of me. One of which, much to my distaste, left one of their partners behind in favour of saving himself. That left only one of them brave enough to meet me face to face: a woman in fact. Perhaps the most beautiful creature I had ever laid eyes upon.She never screamed, never cried or tried to fight me off. She simply approached me, as if hypnotised by my mass and size, but also my actions since I did not attack nor ran after the others. I too felt compelled to see this woman for who she was rather than judging by her species. As such, I offered a hand of friendship and she accepted, clambered onto my paw and I brought her up to see her. At that moment, I suddenly felt a strong emotion the minute I gazed upon her. An emotion that made my heart race and developed a strong desire to keep this woman close. To keep her safe. It was that moment onward that I realised something I haven't felt since leaving my lands and supposed family behind: I had fallen in love. It was then she spoke to me, telling me that she never met a creature such as I, and asked ever me so kindly to take her in and learn so much more about me. Judging by the way she asked, she must have felt the same way about me too, so I gladly took her and the remainder of her gear to the safety of a nearby cave where we settled down for the best part of the week. From there, we talked away for hours on end, learning about her culture and way of life, whilst I told her about me leaving my people to explore the world on my own. We became really close as time went on, so much so that I became all the more evident for my true feelings toward her. She obviously took notice of this and so, one night, she asked me how I really felt about her and that she won't hold it against me if I was honest. So... after much effort on my part, I told her she was unlike any other person I've met. That she made me the happiest I have ever been in my life. And, with every fibre of my being, I would look after her no matter what happens to me.
And that is when I said... that I was in love with her.
I felt foolish immediately afterwards, knowing that such a relationship was simply impossible to conceive. That it simply could not happen. But then she told me something that would never forget, something that made my spirits soar. She told me me that, as strange as it sounded to her, she felt the very same way about me, and she would gladly spend the rest of her life with me if she had to. I simply could not be fortunate enough to have someone like that accepting me for who I was, for being treated as an equal rather than a horrible beast. That is when we realised, that we could be more than just friends from there on. I wanted her so badly, and she me. Shortly after confessing to one another, we had our first kiss, we cuddled, showed our affections and... aha. Let's say that one thing led to another and... we truly bonded. We became one, in a matter of speaking. It was truly a wonderful night...
The next morning, we agreed that I would take her back to her people to prove that she was alive and well and to prove I was no threat. It proved much easier than anticipated, as a rescue team was dispatched just before we arrived her home area. They was just about ready to call the military despite my best efforts to calm them, but then they spotted the woman in my paw and rushed to her "rescue." As a matter of fact, the one who abandoned her beforehand, 'Harold' was his name, came immediately towards her and told her how he was so sorry that he had ever left her in the first place, and he certainly didn't hesitate to through a few insulting words my way as well. She of course didn't buy it and slapped him across the face, telling him it was over between the two of them. He certainly wasn't happy I can tell you that. She then explained to the team that I meant no harm and that they were all perfectly safe when around me. A few were reluctant, but after I finally convinced them I came in peace, they started to warm up to me, even so much as to ask if they could examine me for testing. When my existence became known to your government however, they felt it best that I should find a home further away from the populace, though still providing services to the community in exchange. With that, they provided the necessary equipment to build my new home and I set about living and working for the good people of this world. As for the woman. We did see each other for a while, talking about how we can live out her lives together and what we could do to improve the lives of others. But alas, fate got in the way of things. The company in which your mother worked for stated that it was the best of intensions to not let our lives intermingle as to not hinder their progress with their research upon me. Obviously, they simply disliked the idea that we should be seen together, as they probably saw it as "unnatural" to see a human woman and a miles tall wolf being with each other. She would have disagreed, but she would also lose her job if she objected. So we decided it was best that we should stay separately until we would be permitted to see each other again. So we parted ways, and I was left alone in my home, waiting for the day she would return."

You stare up in astonishment at the wolf after he finished his tale. It was quite the story, but certainly something that needed to be seen to be believed. You Father is looking back at you with his golden eyes, which seem to glimmer in a kind of sad adornment. "As you may know by now," Your Father continued. "That woman was your mother. She went through a lot when it came to public media attention, claiming that she was "The woman who tamed The Colossal Wolf." True in a sense, but not the way they imagined it." Your Father leans back on his chair, suddenly looking more saddened than he was before. "I tried to see her many times, but she was always working, as was I still striving to be a valued member of the community. Helping with construction projects, era search and development and so on. Eventually I started to lose hope that I would never see her again." The wolf suddenly looks serious, as if something important had just appeared in his mind. "Until something happened. Something that would change both our lives forever." You sit back up from your resting spot on the pad and stare wide eyed at your Father. "What? What happened to Mom?" You ask urgently. Your Father simply looks down on you, his eyes filled with a kind of determined fire and simply says...
1152211211211.title: How I meet your Tiny Mother

11522112112111.content:
You blink a little at your Father's statement. You certainly didn't expect him to look so severe about the fact that your Mother had just been expecting you. Then again she certainly didn't expect that she would become pregnant even after having sex with a miles tall wolf either. The big wolf smiles upon the expression on your face.

"Let me explain: One month later when I was working out in the woods, I just so happened to come across a little jeep that parked just beside me. I was curious to see who it was to had come to visit me. To my great surprise and pleasure, it was your Mother who had just managed to find time off work and drove all the way out to see me. I was over the moon when she came, as she was just as happy to see me too. But one thing I realised about her was that she appeared troubled by something, and asked if we should talk about it privately. I of course agreed and so took her in my palm and brought her close. I was tempted to show my affections towards her, but I contained myself long enough for her to tell me what it was that troubled her. She told me about currently going through several tests after she didn't quite feel herself lately. So after many examinations, she didn't find anything wrong or life threatening, but she did discover something much more shocking and life changing. It was then she looked me straight in the eye and told me... she was with child. Dispute the slight pang in my chest, I congratulated her on the coming child and that she would make a great mother. But that wasn't all. To my absolute shock, she had never been with another man since our encounter, and that the only possible relation to the child had to be... ME.
I was stunned. I didn't think it was possible. It couldn't be. I told her myself that it cold not possibly true. But she confirmed it. The DNA tests taken when the scientists took samples of my blood matched to that of the child. Inside, I was delighted! I was going to become a Father!
Your Mother was delighted too, but also worried. Not just for me or herself, but also the fact that this child would be a birth of miracles: A child born of a human and a Gigantic Wolf. It would be the news of the world if the truth got out, and all the organisations around the world would most likely treat her and the baby like Guinea Pigs and to be experimented on for the rest of their lives. I certainly never wanted that for your Mother nor for the child. After much talking and persuasions, we figured it was best that we kept the origin of the baby a secret and to state that the child was simply the result of a one night stand between her and another anonymous man. Quite frankly I would have objected to that, but I agreed to go along with it anyway. Your Mother said it was best to keep our distance, but promised that she would come visit and especially let me see the baby for myself when it came. I was more than happy to oblige, and the prospect of me having my own child kept me going throughout the year.
So for the next 6 months, we had our regular visits, the home coming along nicely, me working the funds towards child care and your Mother becoming more and more excited as tummy grew larger and larger with each month. For a while, I was surprised that her tummy didn't seem as large as I thought would be, that I had expected it to grow the size of a mansion by the time it was Summer. I then anticipated whether or not the Baby would have a great big pair of Wolfish ears and a big bushy tail, with a fresh set of fangs to boot. However, your Mother simply looked every other human expectant woman and happily went about her business prepraring the new arrival. I tell you now, dear Child, your Mother was the happiest I've seen her in a long while. Being away from work had taken a huge weight off her shoulders, more so the fact that she didn't have deal with the media as much. We even went on holiday: Down to a completely deserted coast were we swam, I posed for the camera and enjoyed some quality time with her as well... Hhmhhm!
Anyhow, it was then I made my pledge to become a true Father, that I would do everything in my power to help raise our Child and make us a real family. Your Mother couldn't be any happier, and told me didn't care what the rest of the world says. She would happily give her old life away just so she would become a Mother, and to live with me if she wanted. I could never agree more.
Then came the moment of truth. Just a day after we returned to the house, her water just broke and began to have contractions. The baby was coming! Immediately, I took your mother in hand and ran to the nearest doctor's clinic since the hospital was miles away from were we lived and I hadn't yet acquired a phone. Several medical staff and civilians practically sprinted for their lives when they saw me approaching, but after I explained what was happening, a very courteous man by the name of Dr Heinrich volunteered to help with the procedure. The problem was, that all of the emergency facilities were full up at the moment, so we had to conduct the delivery right there on my palm. So after letting the good Doctor up in my hand, he set to work delivering the baby. I stood stock still, all the while reassuring her that she was going to make it, that I loved her so much.
And then, finally, the baby was born. Your Mother had you right there on my palm. The both of us were the happiest we've ever been. What was also a great surprise was that you were perfectly human: No big tail, no big ears and certainly no fangs. You were exactly like your Mother, in every way. I couldn't complain about that."

Your Father looks dreamily at you, as if you were a priceless gem. You couldn't help but glance around the palm you're sitting on. This had just been the place you were given birth on, and this Wolf which it belonged to had been there from the very moment you came into excistance. As wierd as it sounds, you feel the deep bond you thought you've forgotten strengthen between the two of you. Then a more serious expression came on his face. "The only thing is however." He says, his voice soft but concerned. "Despite being born human, your Mother took a secret test of your blood that proved you inherited something from me. That thing turned out to be my blood. Blood that in facts strengthens your natural immunity and healing abilities. You have more control over your body, inside and out and even have a longer life expectancy than normal people. In other words..." And he lowers his head and speaks to in a way that makes him look more of a God than ever before. "..that makes you the first living proof of super human life."

There is a silence, broken only the gentle rustling of the trees from the world beyond, which seems much further away now. You just sit there dumbfounded, unable to take in the fact that you were above average human level, more so when finding out you have a Giant Wolf for a Father. He sits back up, still giving you that serious expression. "That's a very big secret between the three of us." He continued, his golden eyed expression not leaving yours. "We never told that to anyone. Not even to your Mother's closest friends. I'm only telling you this now because you ought be old enough to know the truth. The world isn't ready for such a revelation. And you must promise me that you will never speak of this to anyone else. Not even to your friends. It's for your own safety. Understood?"
You take a moment to take in what your Father said. Why would it be bad to tell anyone about this? Surely it would be better to use your blood to help those in need and develop cures and vaccines against deadly deseases. But then, what if it falls into the wrong hands? What if someone wanted to use the blood for destructive purposes, to cause wars and untold misery throughout the world? You look up to your Father, who is still waiting for an answer. After a moment of consideration, you nod in agreement. "I promise Dad." You say obediently. "I swear I will never tell anyone." Your Father's muzzle brakes into warm grin and his tail begins to wag. He brings you up to his lips and kisses you straight on top of your head. "There's a good pup." He says softly.
Just before he brings you back down however, you like to ask one last question. "Hey Dad. One other thing." He looks at you with his grin still fresh on his face. "Yes, my dear?" You ask the question with a little more confidence in your voice. "Where's Mom right now?" The wolf gives you a surprised expression, as if this should have been something you should have known this all along. In hesitation, he says with a hint of difficulty in his voice...:
11522112112111.title: Birth of a Miracle

choices: Stay in and play some games
115221121121111.content:
Your Father is still looking at you with a puzzled expression on his face. "Surely you didn't know Child? Your Mother had to go away during the Holiday week and left you with me. I thought she told you before leaving." You feel a little embarrassed at not being able to remember what you've been told just a day or so before, but you still have the predicament of not being able to remember anything else beyond that. You want to make sure that you don't worry your Father into thinking you have a serious head problem, so instead of simply blurting it out, you just scratch the back of your head it that kind of 'Ops-a-daisy!' manner of speaking. "Sorry Dad!" You exclaim apologetically, not entirely sure you believe in your own words. "I forgot."

For a moment, your Father looks like he is about to ask something else but simply shrugs it off and returns to his familiar form. "Never mind." He says in his fatherly voice. "She'll be back soon before the holiday is over. In the meantime," He says this as you can hear his tail beginning to wag happily underneath the table. "We have the rest of the holidays to spend some quality time with each other!"
The prospect of having the rest of your holidays spent with your colossal Father sent a kind of electrifying jolt through. One that held the unexplainable urge for adventure and for living an unforgettable experience. After all, it's not like everyone has a Gigantic Wolf for a loving and fun Father. You look up excitedly at your Father who was giving you a similar expression, like a schoolboy awaiting to be taken to the theme park. You'd like to know more about what it is that you two will be doing this week, and begin to ask enthusiastically: "Ok Dad! What would you like to do today?" He ponders for a moment, deciding what activities the both of you can enjoy. "Well," He says thoughtfully. "I,was thinking we could go out for a walk towards the big mountain ridge where it borders your land and mine. Or we could simply stay here and play some games." You looks back down at you with a kind of excited expectancy in his golden eyes. "It's still up to you though. You're on holiday and can do whatever you want here."

You take a moment to decide. Going for a walk does sound tempting. Seeing the sights of the world beyond and taking in the fresh air is sure to help clear your mind and get things in order. On the other hand, you are curious as to what kind of activities your Father has in store for you. After weighing you choices, you decided to...
115221121121111.title: Extended Break

choices: "Do you remember anything about me when I was little?"
1152211211211111.content:
You both agree that you will both take a walk towards the great mountain ridge, although because of it's great distance, it'll really be your Father who will be doing most of the walking for you. As your Father prepares a picnic for the both of you, you take the opportunity to gaze out through the gigantic glass window looking out into the great forrest.

It is all so astonishing. The pine trees towars higher than anything you've seen before in your life, reaching so far into the sky that they almost blot out the entirety of the sun, and the earth on the ground look like they could stretch out for almost an eternity. It appears that everything within you Father's land is larger in comparison to all the plants you're accustomed to back home. No wonder the world organisations wanted to explore and examine this place so badly, and now you're curiosity is starting to grow as well.

Just then, you hear your Father returning with a large, shoulder held sack which would have seemed normal to the Wolf's size, but to you would have been enough to hold several sea tankers at once. He motions you to walk onto his open right hand and you oblige almost immediately. He then brings you up to his right shoulder and asks you polity to clamber on. Again you do as he says and climb onto his muscly shoulder, holding on to his thick strands of fur for support. "It's going to quite the trek up the mountain, so I'm going to have to use both my arms and legs for the ascent." He tells you. "So just be sure you hang on tightly while I do so." He then notices that you have a look of concern on your face, initially because you're not quite sure if you can keep your grasp while being continuously raised up a colossal mountain. He smiles down at you, stroking you on the head gently with one of his massive fingers. "Don't worry my dear." He says reassuringly. "I'll make sure you won't fall." With that said, you do feel reassured that your Father is still there to look out for you and with a smile and a nod, you tell your Father that your ready. Smiling back, he walks towards the door and opens it to venture out into the great giant wilderness.

As your Father begins to trek down the forrest path, you glance around the great mass of trees, admiring their lush green leaves and fine bark. On top you can see an eagle souring around, though it looks more like a buzzing insect compared to the size and mass of the trees. You Father also notices and chuckles. "Honestly, you should see some of the animals from where I come from. They'll make me look small in comparison!" You laugh nervously back, hoping that you will never have to face a fully grown grizzly bear that is several times larger than your already titanic Father.

Finally, your Father brings you to clearing through the woods and you have a miraculous view of the scene ahead. From a distance, you can see the great mountain looming on the horizon. It's many peaks and snow covered tops scrap the sky as they barely break the top most clouds that drift above them. Judging by the distance between the mountain and where you are now, it will take quite some time for you to reach the very foot of the ridge. Your Father notices this too as he scratches the underside of his greying muzzle. "It appears we have quite the task ahead of us." He says ponderingly. "Which means that it will take a while for us to begin our trek up. In the meantime..." He looks over to you, a smile broadening on his lips. "How about we discuss something interesting whilst we walk?"

You take a moment to think about what you would like to talk about. At first, you want to talk about your missing memories and if you'll be able to remember them if you tried. Although you are also curious as to where your Father may have come from, and if that he still remembers anything about his own family. After a while of thinking, you decide to ask...
1152211211211111.title: Journey to Titan's Ridge

11522112112111111.content:
Your Father glances back down at you when you asked your question, his eye brows raised slightly as if surprised at such a strange question. Noticing this, you quickly add; "Um... I mean. It was a long time ago, and was just wondering if you remember what I was like back then." You gaze back back up to see your Father scratching the top his head, a look of deep thought etched across his great face. "Hm." He mused. Then he gives a slight chuckle, as if the memories just came back to him. "Well now that asked, you certainly weren't raised like most children." He continues to walk towards the mountain as he talks.

"After you were born, we were a little concerned about how we were going to raise you. That is, being brought up by your Mother and a big lug of a wolf like me. We knew that we had to keep your leianege a secret and still be able to provide the very best for your development. I of course would've accepted if your Mother decided to raise you with your kind, but she insisted that I had as much right to be with you growing up and to act as any good father should. And so, we decided that your Mother will move in for the time being, giving the wider community the excuse that she needed time away to carry on with her research and to care for her child.

As for what you were like... A-ha. Well safe to say it was both strange and heartwarming for me. When I first laid eyes you, I knew immediately you took after your Mother in many ways. You practically had the same eyes, the same hair, skin and, dare I say it, good looks too. I still remember when you just turned a year old when it was just you on my palm. At first, I thought you'd be afraid to see a gigantic wolf bearing down at you. But to my great surprise, you only giggled and had actually wanted to reach out and pat on my nose. I of course couldn't resist the temptation of play either. We played many games from there on, like playing hide a seek in my fur, where your Mother was afraid that you might get lost in there but I could always feel you rustling around my head, chest and legs. Then there was the time where we went to the beach when you were Six, and we built that great sandcastle together. You then acted as the valiant knight of the castle who had to fight the big scary beast, threatening to crush the castle and have you for dinner. I obviously played the monster, and I think I performed quite well. So with me acting all big and terrifying and you being all heroic and brave, you jumped straight from the castle and onto my foot after trying 'in vain' to stomp you. You started to climb my leg but I still caught you on the way up. I then tried to intimidate you but you simply jumped on my arm and ran all the way up, dodging my grabs at you and jabbed me in chest where my heart would be. You beat me fair and square, and I admitted defeat saying that I was just lowly beast not worthy of your mercy. At that, you just simply laughed and hugged me, saying that you'll never think like that of your Dad, that you still love this big old beast for who he was rather that what he was. I... almost welled up at that point. It was one of the sweetest things you ever said to me, and I loved you all the more for it."

The great wolf sighs happily as he draws closer to the mountain, leaving you to ponder in your own thoughts trying to find the lost remnants of your memories. You certainly seemed to recall a big castle made of sand, with you perched on top of the highest tower and brandishing a spade like a sword. You could then recall a gigantic, muscle bound Titan rising from the sand and looming menacingly down at you with hungry yet playful eyes. How the giant had teasingly plucked you in between his fore finger and thumb, joking about having you as a nice snack unless you gave up but refused to give in. The next thing you knew, you were triumphantly standing upon the great beast's chest, with the wolf smiling broadly back and giving you the literal father of all hugs. It was a shame you could only picture it all as a distant dream and not a fond memory, but at least you remembered it...

"I think it is fair to say that I was your whole world growing up." Your Father continued brightly as he brings you closer to the foot of the mountain. "Though by the time you hit your teens, you had to go back to civilisation in order to attend High School. Your Mother is even considering letting you go to the same university once you finished. After that you..." He pauses for a moment, as if he was trying to say something that wasn't in protest of you leaving the house that you grew up in. "...Do whatever you want to do I suppose." He seems rather downtrodden at the prospect of you leaving his care. Even you have to admit, you're going to miss having the awesome wolf for company. Partly because he is the only one who remembers your past life and, for one, he also seems to be the closest thing to a friend as far as you know. Somebody you can trust without a doubt in your mind. Like you can tell him just about anything...

At this however, your Father perks up again as he proceeds towards a large rock face which, as you observe, if just as high as your father, if not larger. "Anyway!" You father exclaims happily. "Let's not worry about that for now. Better find a way to the top of here to get to the ridge." With that, he approaches the wall and places his right paw hand paw on a divit in the rock and his left foot paw in the other. He then proceeds hoist himself up towards other climbing points on the rock face. He notices you looking back down towards the ground which, despite already being a good mile off the ground, is looking all the more distant the higher you ascend. At this, your Father simply smiles at you. "Don't worry." He says reassuringly. "I had plenty of practise before. Just you make sure you cling on tightly whilst I climb. Even if you slip, I'll be sure to catch you. Alright?"

And so the great wolf begins his climb, slowly but surely making his way to the top. You watch in amazement as he propels, shimmy shimmy and even leap towards usable ledges, which looks large enough to support a small town. You have to admire the amount of sheer bodywork your Father has put in, as every muscle in his arms a legs are hard at work to get himself supported onto the mountain side. You reckon he could go a lot faster, but you knew he is most likely trying to make sure you don't fall of from all the movement he's making. Even you have a hard time trying to grasp onto the many strands of fur surrounding you for support. As you take another glance behind you, you begin to see far more of the world around you. Seeing the tops of the great trees and other great mountains in the distance. Despite seeing all this for the first time, you still can't help but feel a great sense of familiarity towards this place, as if you knew this place your whole life.

You're really beginning to enjoy the view when...
11522112112111111.title: Fond Memories

1152211211211112.content:
“Let’s play some games” you said excited which made your fathers tail wag happily. You were about to make a suggestion but then you realised you don’t know what games you could possibly play with your godlike father. “Um hey dad what games could we play?” You said rubbing the back of your head in embarrassment. Your father just smiled at you “well there are quite a few games we uses to play when you were younger.” “Like what?”

“Well like you used to like playing monster slayer which involved setting up a fake city end me stomping around eating or crushing the pedestrians and you trying to stop me.” That sounded pretty fun but you wanted to hear of the rest “ok but are there any others?”

“Of cause son there was our own version of hide and seek which means you’d be hiding something on me and I’d have to find you, then there was don’t wake the giant wolf which involved you trying to get to a specific area of my body without me noticing while I pretend to be asleep.” Your father chuckled a little when he mentioned this game. “What’s so funny” you said. Your looked away in embarrassment “well there was an embarrassment situation were you ended up getting tangled in my fur.”

You didn’t really see what was so bad about that and was about to ask why but your dad beat you too it. “The place you got stuck was around my crotch area.” Your father said red as a tamato from embarrassment.

“Ok are there any more?” Your father hummed in thought “I can’t seem to recall anything else.” Your father shrugged.

You thought for awhile be choosing.

11523.title: Child?

115231.content:
You get up and let out a yawn. Then you grunt and feel your head. Then you notice that you're holding an axe and then see logs all over you. You must've been chopping logs and dozed off. Then you hear tremors. "What the!" you yell. "Ah!" You run forward to see your wife at the patio table sipping coffee. "Hey, what's got you so stressed out?' she asks.

You then pant heavily. "Are you crazy Tress?" you ask. "There's an earthquake. We've got to get to shelter." Tress just shakes her head. "Trust me, we're used to those kinds of tremors. Besides, you've got better things to worry about than just earthquakes. Remember, Charlene is coming home from college to visit." Then you remember something. Charlene was your daughter. You smile at the thought of her coming home. She was always away at college and couldn't visit that often. This was a miracle. You missed her, she was the perfect child. Never had a discipline problem and was very helpful.

You couldn't wait to hold her in your arms again. However, it would appear you didn't remember Charlene as well as you thought because as the tremors came closer and closer and you fall down on the ground. Then you see a pair of furry legs bigger than skyscrapers. You look up to see a dozen mile high German Shepherd Girl with long brownish blonde hair and a pair of blue eyes covered by large circular glasses. She looked only nineteen and was pear shaped. She had bright red lips and bent down and gave a smile as she waved her tail.

"Hi Mom," says the Charlene. "Hi Daddy." You couldn't believe this. Your daughter was a gigantic dog. As you're trying to wrap your head around this, Tress, your wife walks into your daughter's hand and Charlene brings her up to her face to lick her as Tress smiles and laughs.
115231.title: Doggy Daughter

1152311.content:
Charlene, your giantess dog daughter puts Tress, your wife, down and the holds out her paw for you to walk on and you give a nervous look which prompts a look of concern from Charlene. "What's wrong Dad?" she asks. You hesitate and then Tress smacks herself in the head. "You hit yourself in the head chopping logs again didn't you?" You realize that had to be what happen for you not to remember all of this. But what did she mean by again. Did you get amnesia before?

"It happens every time," Charlene says with a sigh as she pushes you into your paw. "You always forget I'm... not like all the other girls." "I'm sorry sweetie," you say to your daughter. "I'm... I'm a total idiot." Charlene lets out a giggle and rubs you on the head with one of her skyscraper sized digits, unintentionally causing your head even more pain than before. "Don't worry Daddy," she says. "These things happen." You let out a laugh. "Yeah, when I heard I was coming I imagined holding you in my arms but you can hold me in one hand. Ah!" Charlene lowered her head and then licked you, covering you in dog drool. Did Charlene have to do this because she was a dog. Then again, getting into a fight with your daughter, your dozen mile daughter with sharp teeth and a long tongue, would be a terrible idea.

"So sweetie," says Tress. "How's college going." Charlene lets out a sigh. "I'm having trouble deciding what to take next semester. The advisor recommended classes the school doesn't even offer." You let out a scoff. "Incompetent academic advisors, what else is new. I had tons of those when I was a student." You and Charlene share a laugh as Tress goes inside. You assume she's going in to get drunks, but you wonder what she'd use to hold Charlene's drink.

Then you feel confident and ask Charlene a sensitive question. You remember her having a boyfriend in college and wanted to know how things were going. "So Charlene, how are things going with you and Luke was it? Your boyfriend?"

Suddenly, your daughter's happy face turns into a scowl and she growls loudly. Charlene shows her teeth and you step back in his hand. "Don't you ever say that jerk's name in front of me again!" Tress walks out with a cup of ice water for you and a barrel of ice water for Charlene. "Uh-oh," she says. "Sounds like a lover's quarrel. What happened."

Charlene places you down next to your wife before she growls again. "That son of a seahorse betrayed me big time!" "Son of a seahorse?" you ask. "Right, she wouldn't use the b-word given what she is." Charlene is so mad that you have to step back as she begins to salivate and the drool nearly touches you. "I caught him seeing another woman." Tress gives a look of pure shock. "He did what?" You're in complete confusion and anger as you put both your hands into fists. You're angry because this Luke dared to cheat on your precious, albeit gigantic, doggy daughter. You're confused as to what kind of idiot would cheat on a multi-mile dog girl with razor sharp teeth?

"That jerk!" you yell. "Where is he Charlene? Let me at him! You didn't crush him did you?" Tress looks at you in surprise. "Rob!" she yells. "You know Charlene wouldn't hurt a fly." "That Luke is less than a fly to my little girl, even if she wasn't as big as a city. I've got a few words to say to him. Nobody toys with my daughter's heart and gets away with it." Charlene puts her paw in your way and then shakes her head. "Daddy," she says. "I may be furious beyond belief with Luke, but I'm going to be the better ex. Please, Daddy, don't aggravate the situation even more."

What do you do?

115232.content:
You get up and are in pure pain in the head. "Oh," you groan. "I should never have gone out with the guys." You hear the phone ringing and get out of bed as you hold your head in pain from the hangover you've put yourself in. You answer the phone and let out a groan. "Hello?" you ask. "Hi cuz!" yells a female voice on the phone. You feel your head in pain at that yell before you realize who it was who was on the phone. "Hello Lorelei." You say. Lorelei was your cousin, younger than you and always energetic. But why was her voice so loud?

"So cousin," you say. "What's up?" "I'm stopping by to visit you out in the country. Mom says I've been hanging around the big city too long. I just hope everyone's prepared for me." You let out a scoff. "No one is that prepared. Okay Lorelei. Just give me time to clean up. See you later." You let out a groan as you hang up the phone. "Crap," you say. "I didn't think anyone was coming today." Thinking quickly you run away picking up all the debirs on the ground and shine the windows, not wanting your cousin to think you live in a pig sty.

Suddenly you're knocked off the ground by a tremor. "Ah!" you yell. "Quake! Big quake!" You run out to investigate the Earthquake and fall to the ground again. Then you slip into a large hole. As you climb out, you look to see that at the side of the hole there are smaller holes, like giant toes. "Huh?" you ask. Then you hear loud purring noises. "Hi cuz." says Lorelei's voice. You look up and your eyes pop out of your head because your cousin was much different than you remembered.

In fact, Lorelei was a dozen mile high saber toothed tiger girl with bright red fur and long strawberry blonde hair. She had fangs the size of skyscrapers and was wearing a yellow spandex jumpsuit with black highlights at the arms and legs. Your sabertooth cousin waves down at you and you nervously wave back.
115232.title: Cousin Sabertooth

1152322.content:
"Hey." A voice whispered. "Hey. It's time you were getting up." You stir as you recognised the voice of your Uncle Edmund, however as you look up you find a massive rabbit face looking down at you.

"WAH!" You cry as you jump up, stumble and land on a soft white surface. You find yourself being effortlessly lifted into the air as the behemoth picks you up.

"Easy there." He says. "You did want to go to the beach, didn't you?" You stare up into those gigantic eyes as you come to terms with what's happening.

"U...Uncle Ed?" You gasp. "Are you really...?" He chuckles light-heartedly.

"Of course." He answers. "I'm always ready to entertain my nephews and nieces, especially since I can carry all of you in one hand." You look around, confused as to why he'd say 'hand' if he's a rabbit, before you realise that he's wearing kid gloves. You're sitting in the palm of his hand on a giant kid glove!

"Err... I meant... you're really a..." You stumble as you try to settle the matter without offending him.

"Are you okay?" He was now deeply concerned about you. "You remember who I am?"

"I recognise your voice." You reply. "And your mannerisms, but I don't remember anything about you being a... well, if you're not too offended... a rabbit the size of a city." With that he now laughed after the fashion of Father Christmas.

"Not really something people tend to forget in a hurry. Care to guess my height, then?" He stood up and held you about half one of his arm's length from his face. Gazing up at him and looking round your surroundings comprising of his hand you guess.

"Two miles high?" You look up in wonder.

"Not even close." He chuckles. "I'm 35 miles tall!"
1152322.title: Ultra Uncle

11523222.content:
You wake up and let out a grunt before you realize you're still on the bus. "Crap!" you yell as you look at your watch. You then sigh in relief. "Good," you say. "It's still early." You then think. Your folks were sending you away from the big city into Galaxy Shores, a beachside town on the West of the U.S. They said you were going to spend the Summer with your Aunt Molly. You don't know much about Aunt Molly since you never met her. All you knew was that she was your mother's younger sister.

Heck, you didn't even know what your aunt looked like since you didn't have any photographs of her. Soon your bus arrives. "Here we are," says the bus driver. "Galaxy Shores. All ashore that's going ashore." You're dropped out of the bus and you wipe your brow due to the heat before you stalk to walk out. You look down to see the street is somewhat ramp shaped and there was a beach on the horizon.

You make your way to the beach and as you do, you see a souvenir shop that has a t-shirt that had the image of some strange teal colored cow and read "I SAW THE GREEN COW OF GALAXY SHORES". "Huh," you say. "They must have some kind of cryptid tourist trap around here." You smile and then make your way to the beach. You see a local with a metal detector and thought you might ask him if he'd seen your aunt. "Excuse me," you call out. "Excuse me!"

The man takes off his earmuffs and stares slightly at you. "A shoobie," he says. "Ho hum." "I just want to ask you a question," you say. "Do you know where I can find Molly Montana? She's my aunt and I'm supposed to be staying with her for the Summer." The man lets out a laugh. "I didn't know the big girl had a nephew. Kinda small to be related to her aren't you."

You wonder what the man's talking about before you hear a rumbling sound. "What's that?!" you yell. "An earthquake?!" As you stumble to the ground. You see everybody leaving the beach calmly and that confused you. Why would they leave so quietly if there was an earthquake. Does this happen a lot. That's when a shadow casts over you and you gasp.

You look up and see a giant teal furred anthropomorphic cow. She was 80 miles high and very obese with a large stomach, thunderous thighs and E-cup breasts. She appeared to be naked from the waist down, mainly because she had a huge udder as big as her head. She bends her knees and you look up to see this cow woman is wearing a pink bikini top with a pair of star shaped sunglasses and had long orange-blonde hair and two long bright white horns. This was the same cow creature from the t-shirts.

You step back and the giant cow woman smiles down at you. You try to run but she reaches down and grabs you by the shirt before lifting you up and bringing you in front of her lips big enough to land planes on. "I've been expecting you," the cow giantess says. "I'm Molly."

You look up in shock. This 80 mile cow was your aunt.
11523222.title: Aunt Moo

115232221.content:
You still can't get over the fact that your aunt is a titanic cow and can't help but stare at her large lips. "Wait," you say. "You're my aunt? But you're a giant cow." Molly lifts you up and places you on her snout and giggles. "How very observant of you nephew." The cow woman says with a giggle before she grabs her huge obese belly. You look down and see her breasts and udder both shaking. She must be packing enough milk for a large body of water. Still, the fact you had to stay the entire Summer with this weird relative of yours.

Molly begins to walk away and you hold on tight to one of her enormous nostrils. "Aunt Molly," you say. "My mom said you were her little sister. Looking at you, I don't see how that's possible." Molly lets out another laugh and you tumble and fall onto her tongue before you look at her cavernous mouth big enough to hold an entire street. You step back and Molly extends her tongue for you to climb back into her nostril. "Well," says your bovine aunt. "There's a funny story behind that. Your grandfather was into.... funny stuff." You have no idea what Molly's talking about but you decide it's best not to ask questions as she's stepping out into the water.

"I never thought I could be related to such a little cutie," says Molly as you continue to ride in your cow aunt's nose. "Where's that sister of mine been hiding you all these years? Molly licks the inside of her nose to kiss you as you groan. She seemed friendly enough. "So Aunt Molly," you say. "The whole Green Cow of Galaxy Shores?" Molly giggles and nearly sends you into her sinuses. "Oh, well, I've been living here for so long everyone's gotten used to me. I'm kind of like their..." "Cash cow?" Molly actually laughs at that joke. Maybe a whole summer under the eye of this behemoth wouldn't be so bad.

The only question, where is she going?
115232221.title: Mega Aunt Molly

115232222.content:
You wake up panting and holding your head. You look around and then let out a sigh. "Good," you say. "Everything seems normal. I can recognize my room at least." You had recently been sick with a strange illness that had the symptoms of a flu but also caused temporary memory loss and your head was still sore. You walked up and looked in your mirror right before you heard a voice calling you.

"You up yet, kiddo?" asked the voice. You recognized that voice and remembered who it was. "I'm perfectly fine, Aunt Claire." You remembered that your parents were killed in an accident years ago and you were raised by your father's younger sister. Claire was for the most part easy to get along with, but there was something about her that you could swear was important to know, yet for now you couldn't remember it. "Are you absolutely sure you're okay?" asked Claire. "The doctor did say that it would take a while before your memory completely returns and I would hate for you to get an unpleasant surprise if you can't remember what I look like."

You let out a sigh. "Aunt Claire, please. I'm not a baby." "Do you actually remember what I look like?" "Well, I remember that you're a redhead." Claire lets out a laugh. "Oh. You are just asking for trouble. Come on. Breakfast is ready." You smile and you remembered that Claire always woke up hours before you did. You presume that it was for work reasons but you couldn't remember at the moment what she did for a living. Or did she get up early to make sure you were prepared for school? You shrug your shoulders and walk into the next room for breakfast. There was a plate with toast, bacon and eggs on it and you walk up and take a bite out of the toast. "Thanks, Aunt Claire."

Suddenly, you realize something. There was only one plate at the table and Aunt Claire's breakfast was nowhere to be seen. "Say, Claire. Aren't you going to be sitting at the table?" Claire gives a scoff from offscreen. "Are you kidding me? They don't make seats big enough for me to sit at the table. They don't even make tables big enough for me." You were confused with what your aunt said but then you remembered that Claire was somewhat fat. Not that it bothered her. As you're eating breakfast, you heard loud vibrations and the apartment begins to shake. You have to grab your glass of milk to keep it from spilling.

"What is that?" you ask. "An Earthquake." "No," said Claire. "Just my footsteps." You're confused. "Claire," you say. "There's no way that you're that heavy." "Kiddo, I'm probably the heaviest woman on the planet. Just turn around. But I'll warn you, if your memory hasn't returned, you'll be surprised." You turn around and gasp as you see an enormous eye looking in the window. The pupil alone is as big as the wall." You walk closer to the blue eye and you hear your aunt laughing again. "Is it coming back to you now?"

That's when you recalled something very important about Aunt Claire. She was a 40 mile high hippopotamus. If she were human size, she'd weigh a few thousand pounds. She had cream-colored-skin and long red hair with huge H-cup breasts, a large belly and an even bigger butt. Right now she was bending over to look into the apartment where she kept you and had her huge butt casting a shadow over an entire landscape as she smiled at you. "Remember me?" she asks tauntingly.

You let out a nervous laugh. "Okay, Aunt Claire. I may not remember everything." Claire lets out a laugh and shows off her large and sharp building sized teeth. You remember that everyone in town knew that Aunt Claire was a giant hippopotamus but don't know how it could be possible that she'd be related to you, yet didn't question it. For the most part, she was really nice. Though you did remember that one time a bully was causing you trouble and she trapped him in her mouth for a week to get him to leave you alone.

At that moment, Claire let out a sigh. "Well," she said. "It will all come back to you." Claire held her finger out to your veranda, obviously gesturing you to climb upon her huge and pink fingernail. You shrug your shoulder and climb the nail. From your vantage point, you remember that the city your apartment was in was kept in a bauble that was part of your aunt's necklace and your aunt was up to her knees in the ocean. "One of these days," you think to yourself. "I'm going to ask her how she got so big. Or why she's a hippo in the first place."
115232222.title: It's All Coming Back

115321.content:
As you sit on your bed, lost in the nostalgia of the photo book, you turn your head to look at the wall clock.

"10:30 already? Huh..."

You gently close the book and put it back next to your bed as you head down the stairs for breakfast. Today was a Saturday after all. No rush. Downstairs, you pour yourself a bowl of cereal and begin eating. You can't help it, but you just can't seem to stop thinking about your imaginary friend. After breakfast, you decide to plop down on the living room couch to watch some TV. As you flip the channels, you soon stop at an old movie you once saw before when you were younger.

"Oh hey, I remember that movie! Do you?"

You were utterly surprised when that booming voice just came out of nowhere. You looked around, but there wasn't anyone in the same room.

"So, do you remember it?" the voice asked again.

"Uh...Y-yeah...Who are you, anyway?" you ask.

"It's me, your old buddy! Pumpy Clumpy!"

You just look around you again. You seriously can't believe what the voice just said. There was a disembodied voice that appears out of nowhere, and claims to be your childhood imaginary friend? That's just too weird.

"Alright, who are you, and how do you know Pumpy Clumpy? I've never mentioned him to anyone ever since I grew out of childhood!" you ask.

"I told you, I'm Pumpy Clumpy! I'm outside, since I can't fit inside. Come on out, and I'll explain everything."

You just shrug as you turn the set off and head to your front door. Whoever is playing this prank on you had better have a decent explanation. As you open the door and look around, you see no one at all.

"I'm behind you!" the voice said.

You turn back to the house, but see no one.

"N-no, I meant I'm behind the house. Just look up!"

You do as you're told...And you mouth suddenly hangs open at what you see. It was a humungous blue-skinned face, with large green eyes looking at you. The creature must've been as huge as a skyscraper! The head alone was as big as your house! Then, you see a large blue hand descend down towards you, picking you up by the shirt collar with two fingers the same size as your whole body. You're then placed onto a palm as you were brought close to the creature's head. You instinctively curl up with your eyes closed, waiting for this thing to eat you, or something.

"Hey hey, I'm not gonna hurt you or anything. Don't you remember me?" the creature said.

You slowly open one eye and look into his green eyes, almost feeling a sense of nostalgia from them. You were slowly brought farther away so you could see the creature's concerned face. He looked so familiar to you. Could it really be?

"Wait...You're...You're really my old friend, Pumpy Clumpy?" you ask.

"Yes! That's what I've been trying to tell you!" he said.

"B-but...How? You were my imaginary friend! You're no even supposed to exist! How is this happening?"

"Oh, well about that...You see, as you grew older, you began to play with me less and less. I knew that you were growing up, and I had to let you forget about me sooner or later, so...I decided it was time for me to leave. But, even after growing up, you still saw me as your best friend. I was touched, and I wanted to see you again, and...Well, this is the part that gets complicated. You see, there was this thingy, and it made me real, but it also made me bigger too. I don't really get it myself, but now I'm just as real as you, and I'm really big now."

You kind of understood his explanation, but also understood that he doesn't fully know how be became real as well. But, does it really matter now? Your childhood friend has returned, in the flesh! You smile as you pat the hand you're on.

"Well, I guess we both have no idea how this happened. But, I'm glad that you've come back! I really missed you Pumpy!" you happily said.

"I missed you two! Now give me a hug!"

You cough a bit, reminding him about the size situation. So, he just brings you next to his head so he can nuzzle you instead. You hug as much of his snout as you can. After the 'hug', there was a loud growling coming from underneath you. The two of you look down at his huge stomach as he blushes.

"U-um, can I get some breakfast? Promise I'll eat just as much as a regular person." he said.
115321.title: Pumpy Clumpy

11533.content: Post apocolyptia: a rather dark scenario in which civilisation has collapsed, resources are scarce, and you are protected by a titanic anthropomorphic animal. Inspired by fallout.
11533.title: Other

115331.content:
"Ugh..."

Your head hurt more than it had ever done so in your life before today. You can feel something cold underneath you - you must have fallen out of bed during your sleep. You can also feel something wet underneath your nose, the small pool of something running from the bottom of your nose to the very top of your lip. You could also feel something rather heavy on your back and front. What that could be, you had no idea.

Your eyes slowly open, revealing a tiled floor. That... wasn't right. Your bedroom had a carpet. You push yourself backwards and maneuver into a sitting position. The room you were in looked like an office building, only abandoned and run down. A desk to your right had been eaten away at by a mould, the whole thing looking black and rotten. Looking up, you realise that there was a rather large hole in the ceiling, that continued up for several floors.

And where your nose had been when you were laying down was a tiny pool of blood. Wiping at your nostril with a finger resulted in the red liquid coating the tip of your finger. You must have fallen a short distance to where you had laid.

Your apparel was also rather... bizarre.

From what you could feel, you were wearing a shirt and trousers - normal stuff. But over the shirt was what seemed to be a bandolier with sheets of metal layered over it, forming crude armour of some kind.

Okay, this didn't look good. Still, you just had to figure out where you were and from there it should be pretty easy finding the nearest town.

Suddenly, the ground begins to shake. Then it shakes again, and again, the shaking happening in a rhythm that steadily increases in strength until you can no longer stand without falling.

"Hey, [Your Name]! Up here!"

You obey the feminine voice and look upwards through the series of holes, and see something that would remain in your memory for a long, long, time.

A single, massive eye was looking at you through the hole, hovering a large distance overhead. The eye, and head, pull back, allowing you to see just what you were dealing with.

Through the hole you could see the head of an utterly titanic deer, your mind unable to estimate just how huge it was. You were so stunned by the sight that you barely noticed the hand that hovered above the hole, allowing two fingertips to deftly pick you up between them and place you onto a titanic palm, the nails of the hand it was par of being composed of a pure black keratin.

"Uh... you okay, little guy?"

Just what had you gotten yourself into?
115331.title: Post apocalyptia

choices: In a massive desert, next to the building you awoke in
Inside a huge underground hangar of some sort, that stretches on for miles!
1153311.content:
As you sit in the massive doe's palm you begin to feel rather faint. Before she can say another work, your vision goes black and you're out like a light.

You once again begin to wake up, this time on her furry palm. Your vision was rather blurry and it took a few seconds for you to see where you were.

Where are you?
1153311.title: Deer-y Me

11533111.content:
From what you could see you were in a large desert just outside the building you awoke in. The yellow and red desert stretched on for what seemed like forever, the uniformity of rolling dunes only broken by the odd tower jutting out of the sand that bore resemblance the one next to you. The odd bit of sand hit your face as gusts of hot wind whistled around the air but thankfully the shade you were sitting in did wonders in keeping you moderately cool. Although, as you regained your senses you noticed that the shadow wasn't coming from the tower but rather from something equally as large. Only just now did you register that you were still sitting in the palm of that large furry creature. Oh, right, you remembered.

It was the massive anthropomorphic doe that picked you up.What you were looking at should be absolutely impossible, yet here you were staring up at it as she sat cross-legged with her back leaning against the building you were just in. She was wearing what looked like a patchwork poncho made out of some kind of brown tarp, the same material also used to make herself a flimsy pair of undergarments. Looking way up you could see her face as she idly looked across the desert, intelligence flickering in her amber eyes. You think you could deal with suddenly seeing a humanoid animal but you were honestly struggling considering how utterly huge this one is. Just by a rough estimate she could be well over a mile tall standing!

For the most part she wasn't aware that you awoke and you flinched when the deer started moving. She reached down to her side and brought up what looked like the container of an extremely large water tower before she uncorked its 'cap' and started drinking from it. As you watched her drink you flinched again when her eyes suddenly turned downward to look at you. "Oh, you're finally awake." She said, setting her giant canteen down. You could feel your heart rate skyrocket as she slowly brought you closer to her face.

Experiencing a brief sensation of vertigo you suddenly found yourself lifted up until you were eye-to-eye with the deer. "Are you feeling better? I think you hit your head." She said.

"Uh..." Was all you could mumble. When she talked you saw flashes of the inside of her mouth and all you could think about was how easily she could throw you in there and swallow you whole. That, and how she could effortlessly crush you with a single movement of one of her fingers. For some strange reason you knew she wouldn't do something like that but the thought still lingered.

The deer gave you a worried look. "I think you might have a concussion. We should head back to base and do some scavenging another day."

A giant deer-person, a massive desert, metal armor, scavenging? Nothing was making sense and as much as you wanted to pretend the giant talking animal wasn't there you couldn't ignore her forever. You swallowed and spoke up. "I... I don't know what's going on."

"What do you mean?"

"I was in my bed sleeping and then I suddenly woke up to..." You motion with your hands at her and the surrounding desert. "...This."

"We were out scavenging, I left you in this building while I quickly scouted one of the other towers across the way," she explained. "Remember?" Listening to her you tried to remember something, anything, about this world you woke up in but nothing came except memories from your 'normal' life. You shake your head at her and her expression sank. "Do you remember who you are, where we are?" Again, you shake your head. She hesitated for a moment before she spoke up again. "Do you remember me?"

"I'm sorry, but I don't remember anything." You tell her. Your words took her aback as she sorrowfully looked down at you.

"You better not be tricking me." She said, a hint of frustration bleeding through the distress on her face. The look she was giving was making you feel faint again.

"I'm... I'm not. Please, I have no idea what's going on." You pleaded.

"Oh," she muttered. The two of you were silent for a few moments before she spoke up again. "The wound on your head looked pretty bad, maybe the impact gave you amnesia?"

You were so distracted by the situation that you completely forgot about it. Reaching a hand up to your head you winced as you felt a large bump through the cloth wrapped around it. Wait, bandages? "Did you do these bandages?"

"Yea," she simply said. Her hoof-like fingers were so large that you were actually incredibly impressed she could even work with something that was relatively so small. "I'm guessing you want me to bring you up to speed?"

"That would be nice."

"Well, long story short, there was a huge war many years ago before either of us were born and civilization was utterly destroyed. It was so long ago nobody even knows why they fought, but it reduced most of the world to a wasteland just like this one. People don't usually stay in one spot too long and are always on the move to try and find more resources." She explained before pausing. "As for me, I'm your partner. You found me when I was a sick little fawn out in one of the irradiated zones and I guess you must have felt sorry for me and nursed me back to health. Back then I was just a dumb animal but I still knew what you did for me so I followed you around. I'm not sure why you didn't kill and eat me, though, especially when I started getting bigger. You just kept treating me like a harmless baby animal even when you only came up to my leg."

"You weren't always like this?" You interrupted. "This big?"

"Nope, just kept getting bigger and bigger. Anyway, I followed you everywhere and the changes kept happening. I suddenly found myself introspecting and looking at the world differently, the sounds you made with your mouth began making sense and had purpose. Then my body started changing shape until I could walk on two feet and talk, just like a human!"

"Wow." You muttered as you took it all in, the deer giving you a nostalgic smile that you unfortunately couldn't share. It sounded like you two had a lot of history together.

"That was five years ago and we've been wandering ever since. You named me Nina."

"Thanks for being patient with me, Nina." You said to her. By now you were feeling safer sitting in her palms. Even if her sheer size was mind-boggling it was reassuring to know that you two apparently shared a long, trusting relationship.

"Well, hopefully your memories come back." You suddenly found yourself being lifted towards her face, gasping as her cheek suddenly pushed against your entire body. Nina gently rubbed the side of her face against you and you found yourself relaxing as she smothered you with affection. "And if not... We'll make it work. I owe you my life so I'll protect you no matter what!"

She held you in that loving embrace against her cheek for a while longer before she pulled you away. Nina gave you a look of admiration before you felt the world around you sway as she stood up to her full height, slinging what looked like an incredibly large bag around her shoulder. Just like earlier you could hear the shaking rhythm of her footsteps as she went into motion. "Where are we going?" You yell up at her, unsure if she could even hear you.

One of her large ears twitches and she looks down at you, still keeping pace. "To our temporary base. We usually choose a spot to come back to when we explore areas like these." You nod and look off at the horizon and from the orange painting the clear sky it must be close to dusk. After a short while she approached one of the towers and pressed the side of her hand against an opening. "Go inside and get some rest. I'll be outside if you need anything."

You thank her and hop down into the small dusty room. Any entrance to the room was completely barricaded so you assumed the only way of getting in was Nina. Not many possessions were in the room besides a small pile of bags, a bedroll and a few odds and ends sitting on a desk. Right in the middle of the desk was a book that had a piece of tape with the word 'journal' written on it that caught your interest. Reading that might give some clues to what was going on or at least give you some insight on what type of relationship you had with Nina. You were interested what the 'you' of this universe did on a daily basis, especially with a giant deer-person as a companion.

A large thud startled you and looking back you could see the fur of Nina's neck outside the large hole in the wall. That was another option, spending some time with Nina to get to know her, again. From the way she was giving brief side-ward glances at you it was obvious she seemed concerned about you and your predicament. You were definitely sure you needed to get used to her size, anyway.

You rub your eyes, just thinking about the circumstances you were in tired you. Perhaps you actually fell out of the bed but landed in some parallel dimension instead, but it didn't really make sense. Whatever the case the situation still left you confused but you felt you had to press on; for all you knew you could be stuck in this world. You probably had time to do one more activity before you should get some sleep. What do you do?
11533111.title: You're in a vast desert

115332221.content:
Your eyes flick open as you awake, lying on your back in your bed. Yawning, you pull the covers off and stumble over to the light switch, blinking sleep out of your eyes. As you begin to proceed through your morning routine, you can't help but feel that something is wrong, somehow. All of a sudden, it hits you; where was Mimi? You remembered your pet husky sleeping on your bed with you, and you hadn't seen her since waking up, which was very odd, seeing as though she rarely left you alone for a second in the morning if you hadn't fed her.

Frowning slightly as you enter the bathroom, intending to brush your teeth, you glance out the window - and then glance out the window again, not quite sure what you were seeing.

Where the city you lived in had once stood, now lay a gigantic meadow, seemingly stretching beyond the horizon. Mouth hanging open in bewilderment, you blink as you stare at the unfamiliar landscape.

Your confusion is only increased when the floor seems to tremble from some far-off impact. The trembling stops... and then resumes. The trembling continues, increasing each time it resumed. It was if a great Titan was striding along, footfalls shaking the earth itself.

Titan quickly proves to be apt, however, as the entire roof to your house is lifted away by two gigantic, fluffy white fingers, and you are harmlessly pinched between two massive claws. The claws quickly bring you upwards to a titanic, stormy grey muzzle - one that seemed awfully familiar. You were fairly certain that you knew who this gigantic, multi-dozen-mile tall anthro was.

Mimi's mouth opens and her tongue lolls out; the great husky pants, her hot breath buffeting you back and forth slightly.

A pair of green eyes focus on your tiny form, exuding love, compassion... and submission.

"Good morning, Master!"
115332221.title: The Biggest Pet

12.content:
(Here are some suggestions for story lines)

Giga Heroes: The mega-anthros are a team of super heroes who fight evil. You became close friends with one of the heroes when he or she saved your life.

World Leaders: You live in a world where country to continent sized anthros walk the earth. Humans live on the bodies of these anthros instead of on the ground, and each anthro represents the people that live on him or her like a world leader. You happen to be a patriot, and your 'country' supports you in return.

Protected Planet: You live in a universe where a group of cosmic-sized anthros take care of the universe. These anthros have the ability to keep things alive, so no humans are crushed when they or the planet Earth is handled.

Mega Adventurers: The planet Earth in this universe is inhabited by a group of fun-seeking anthros. Unknown to you, you had agreed to join them on their adventures on Earth.
12.title: A Little Group of Humongous Beings

121.content:
You wake up, finally remembering what that anthro was holding: a freight train, with many cars, yet shorter than its pinky. It comes to you so clearly all of a sudden that you have a feeling of deja vu, but you do not know why.

You struggle to get out of bed, but realize that your not in bed; you're in a sleeping bag. The air is a bit dank, and it is very dark, except for very shiny crystals poking out of the walls. You feel like you are in a very large cave, and try to remember if you were going camping.

"Hello!" you cry out, hearing a reverberating echo. Unexpectedly, a high pitched girly voice replies very quickly from above, "You don't have to shout, silly."

You automatically apologize, "Oh, oh, I'm so sorry for waking you up, miss!"

An odd cackle echoes through the cave. "Ee hee hee! You are SO funny! You know that I don't sleep! Here, let me get the light, I've been dying to show you my new outfit!"

You feel a powerful gust of wind and the sound of rocks crumbling on the ground, followed by the simple flick of a switch. Immediately, you see a huge bat girl, standing in the huge cave. Her wings alone are much thicker than you are tall, and the toes on the ground look like some sort of living mountain range. You notice her body is barely covered by a tight black outfit, but you are too surprised right now to think about how sexy this bat looks. Besides, the huge pointy ears and fleshy nose are pretty frightening. You flinch when she starts to move her huge hand towards you.

"Oh dear, your scared. Did you have that train dream again? I can only imagine how scary it would be to get hit by a derailed train. It was a good thing that I was there to catch you when it happened!"

You are perplexed by this story that never happened, but for some reason are greatly moved by it. Suddenly, part of the cave wall slides down, and three more towering anthros walk into the room. "Cacophony, there was no trouble tonight?" replied a deep, heroic-sounding voice.

"Not tonight, sir," replied the bat girl, who is named Cacophony. "I was listening all night, but I didn't hear anything worldwide that wasn't handled by the regular authorities." Amazing, you think, that her hearing is that good. Almost too good, like a super power of some sort. You suddenly realize that not only are you in the presence of four enormous anthropomorphic animals, you were in the presence of a band of super heroes.
121.title: A Different Kind of Batwoman
