1212.content:
As you wake up, you see that you're covered from head to toe in bandages. Then you remember what happened, there was a large rockslide and you were injured. But before you passed out, you saw something big, something really big and it was pushing the crumbling mountain away from you. But that's all you remember.

You look around to see you're on some titanic table in a dark room that looked like some kind of high tech laboratory. You look to the wall to see photographs, like wanted posters of what you could only describe as monsters. The first of the wanted posters showed a picture of monster made out of dinosaur bones, another wanted poster showed an image of a giant robot that looked like it had a second face on its forehead and a third wanted poster showed an image of a dragoness in gothic clothes with a third eye on her forehead.

You couldn't tell where you were and tried to get out of bed only to grunt in pain. Your injuries still haven't fully healed. Then you hear tremors, loud ones and get back in bed and crouch as you try to endure, but for some reason you weren't shaking. Maybe it was the height of the table... you didn't know, but then you saw five titanic figures, you'd say each had to be one hundred miles high and every last one of them looked feminine. One of them even let out a growl. "I can't believe it!" she yelled. "Doubletron got away again!" "Don't get in an uproar Hightail," says another of the giantesses. "These things happen. Besides he's damaged so it's not like he can get far."

The figures step closer and you see that you're looking at five anthro giantesses, all cats. The leader was a lioness with golden yellow fur and long hair reaching down to her butt. She was dressed in a green amazon style torso with a sword attached to her belt. The second of the giants was a white tiger girl in a light blue outfit similar to the lioness but without her midriff showing. The third giantess was a cheetah in a red suit of armor with a large shoulderpad on her right shoulder and two lightning bolt symbols on each breast plate. She was carrying a whip in her belt. Then there was a jaguar girl in a dark blue unitard and strange beads around her neck, with dyed blue hair. She sort of looked like a sorceress. The last of the anthros to come forward was a mountain lioness in a gold colored suit of armor with face paint on and a quiver of arrows strapped to her back.

You could not believe this. The lioness who was obviously the leader turned back at the other giantesses. "We can't waste time going after Doubletron until he shows his face again. "Hightail, I need you to stake out the Western Hemisphere. I heard a report of pirates terrorizing the Caribbean." The cheetah girl nods her head and zooms off before the lioness turns to the jaguar girl. "Dazzle," she says. "Could you please check on her guest. You know, the one Stripez carelessly brought back to the Den?" The tiger girl steps back and rubs the back of her neck. "Will do Hera." says the jaguar.

The puma girl lets out a scoff as Dazzle walks off to check up on you. "I don't know why you let a human into the Den Hera, it's much too dangerous." "What choice did I have Catseye? Stripez said he was in critical condition. "We don't leave humans behind in times of crisis."

Then you realize it. You were in the presence of superheroes, much like Ultraman except even bigger. This titanesses were guardians of the Earth.
1212.title: Wonder Cats

123.content:
((Sorry if there will be any mistakes, mine 'Engrish' is not very well))

You wake up in your bed and you feel excellent today morning, but somehow worried. Today its first day of Spring, but its a lot too hot, you are whole sweated. You stand up from your bed to open the window and bring some cool air into the room.

Then you saw it, a gigantic ball of fire its coming down at your town! Its must be a asteroid, with entering into Earth's atmosphere starts burning, thats why its so hot!

You start to panic, you don't know what to do! It can't end like this, if asteroid will hit a surface of Earth, humans will end like dinosaurs! You looks down at street and see a people with seem to even don't notice a danger. You starts to yelling to them about coming asteroid, but they seem to ignore you! What is happening to them?!

Then huge shadow looms over the land, but it wasn't asteroid. Two titanic black & white pillars covers whole sky, from below and above the asteroid. You don't know what is happening, but then.... fire ball dissapears between white sides of pillars. You feel somehow safe again, its getting cooler, but what are those pillars?

Then you can hear a female giggles with seem to come somewhere from skies. Second later you hear a soft, almost angelic voice with also come from somewhere above:

"Wiee! Orca sisters saves a day!"
123.title: Earth is in danger?

choices: "Well, he IS very cute.  Why don't we let him be our little friend?"
"His abilities could help convince others to worship us."
1231.content:
Continuing to look upward, you see, way high up beyone the sky, a face start to come into view. Also patterned in black and white, you at first think it is a tattooed human face, but by the somewhat jutting nose and enormous hole on top, you realize that it is a human-like orca girl. She looks absolutely stunning as she her face becomes clearer, and you can't help but thank her for stopping the meteorite. You still can't believe that nobody else seems to notice anything going on at all.

Suddenly, the huge orcaess starts to speak in her angelic voice. "Wait, come here, Amosa, I can feel something!" Suddenly, another gigantic orcaess, even bigger than the first by almost half a body length, swims through the sky to the first one. "What is it, Fortuna, do you feel an earthquake?" asks the larger orcaess in an equally angelic voice.

"No, big sister, I think someone is praising me!" You suddenly realize that you must be the one that this huge divine cetacean is detecting, and suddenly grow fearful that perhaps everyone was not noticing the goddesses on purpose.

"Really, one of the humans can see you? Let me try, little sister. Amosa, the larger sister, gently pushes Fortuna to the side and swim closer, until her looming head covers the whole sky. "Little human, wherever you are, if you can hear me, wave your arms and jump up and down!" You don't know if you should, but you perform the task anyway. Other people seem to be looking at you strangely, but the face beyond the clouds locks onto you with utter amazement.

"Wow, you're right, someone CAN see us! I must share this news with Prima, she'll know what to do." Suddenly emitting a high-pitched squeal, Amosa makes room for the third orcaess you have seen today. This one was even larger than the other two, by several times even, and her black and white patterned body looked to have a sort of golden aura around it. "Is there something that you need of me, my younger kin?" asks the eldest and probably most powerful goddess Prima.

"We discovered that one of the humans on Earth can see and hear us!" Now, even the great Prima looks surprised. Quickly turning her attention to the planet, you suddenly feel self aware as the huge orcaess seems to probe your mind. "You are right, a human does indeed acknowledge us, and he even felt it when I looked into his soul. This is something I have never witnessed before, my younger sisters, and unlike you, I have seen all of Earth's history."

"What should we do, Prima?" asked Fortuna, who never took her enormous eyes off you. "We can't just ignore something this big!"

Prima sighed as she thought, and you could feel the warm breeze enter Earth's atmosphere and almost lift you of the ground, although it did not seem to affect anyone else. After a minute, the great orcaess goddess revealed her decision.
1231.title: Noticed

choices: More like a pet or a toy than a friend, but they still respect you
Nearly like an equal, like a true friend or even a family member
12311.content:
Amosa and Fortuna squealed in delight, sounding like a cataclysm of noise from where you stood. Then, suddenly, the huge black and white fingers; the same ones that crushed the meteorite, started lowering towards you at an alarming rate! Positive that you will be crushed along with the rest of the suburb, you crouch and cover your head. Huge, powerful rubbery surfaces squeeze your sides, but you feel no pain. You feel a fast movement before you see again, and what you see is Fortuna's gargantuan face at the end of a vast field white orca skin.

"Hello, tiny human friend!" spoke the youngest goddess, the words forming like a beautiful song. "Since you're the first human that can see, hear or feel us, we're going to keep you for ourselves!"

Prima butted in, her voice seeming to cancel out everything other sense you have. Such is her commanding voice, you don't doubt that she could pretty much control anything. "You should see this as a special privelage, cute little guy. Being a god's friend is a very rare honor for a mortal, and you shouldn't take your new spot lightly."

Suddenly, another pair of thick orcaess fingers snatches you from Fortuna, and you find yourself staring at Amosa now. "Prima, you don't need to be so serious around him! He is our little friend, so we might as well have fun with him! He'll learn his place soon enough."

And learn your place you do, when the three huge orcaess sisters start treating you...
12311.title: Their Little Friend

choices: Why she treat you the way she does (Love)
123112.content:
They all really warmed up to you and started treating you more like a ture freind. Amosa and Fortuna treated like one of the family and brought you almost any where they went, but Prima just treated you like a true friend and nothing more. You were always nice to all of them, but Prima was a bit of stick in the mud. Amosa and Fortuna were going on one of explorations when Prima said " Could you leave (your name) here I need to speak with him"
Prima was about to speak to you about
123112.title: Nearly like an equal, like a true friend or eve...

124.content:
My name is Akira, I'm sixteen years old, and I'm a human looking for other humans. The reason I've been looking for others of my kind should be obvious. Most of the humans died off a decade ago, I don't know why, but that's all I know. I've heard that there are small settlements, but I've yet to find any. I have been on my own, wandering aimlessly from broken human cities to small ghost towns. Did I also mention the anthros. They're massive, bipedal creatures that appear to have animal features. I probably sound like I hate them, but I don't. With everything that's happened so far, I've been trying to avoid anything that's not like me. I heard they keep humans in zoos and stuff, mostly to protect them, but that's not what I want. I'm afraid that if I end up there, I can never be free again!
Right now, I'm in one of the many human ghost towns, looking for supplies. Mostly food, fresh water, and maybe a little to read, while I take refuge there for the night.
124.title: The First step to One Mega Adventure

1241.content:
The benefits of being one out of the few, free, traveling humans. I see a lot of untouched supplies. I peer at a bunch of unopened packs of water bottles, but it seemed suspicious, I could feel it. Food and water untouched. It's very unusual for anything to be untouched. I pull out a knife and yell "hello?". It was silent. I cut a pack open and take a few bottles, stuffing them into my bag. I look around cautiously, and see nothing within my line of sight. I stand straight back up and walk toward some canned foods. Just like the water, I grabbed whatever I could, stuff them in my bag, and look cautiously around. I then bolt out the door, covering my eye from the blinding light of day. My vision returns to normal, and nothing. "Maybe I was just paranoid." I said to myself. I walk around in the middle of the town, and spot a small bookstore. I walk in like it's heaven. When I was a kid, and wandering around with my parents. They would let me go to abandon bookstores and let me read. It was the only thing I could enjoy. There were many problems though. We would never stay long, and I couldn't keep a single book. My Dad said it was not valuable for survival. That's when I made my one rule, Finish every book I pick up before I leave! Back to reality, I see several great books. I pick out one on medical knowledge and human anatomy, the history on some Vietnam war, and several others. I jump up on to the cashier counter, and begin reading, losing all sense of time and my surroundings.
As soon as I finish my sixth book, I feel a slight tremor. I look outside, and realize it's night. I put the book down, and run to a dusty, broken window. I see something in the distance. I walk to the door, and out only to see a small group anthros. It was dark and hard to make them out. Then I see one split from the group, and walk my way. Feeling the tremors, I run back into the store, grab my stuff and try to find a hiding spot. The tremors became earthquakes, knocking books and shelves down to the ground. Then a shelf falls on me, it just pins me, barely leaving a bruise on my body, and luckily hiding me. Then the quakes stop. I lie still on my stomach, wondering what it wanted, especially from a human ghost town. Then I heard it speak. "HMM, LETS SEE WHAT I CAN FIND HERE?" Then I hear something brake. "HEY THAT LOOKS LIKE A LOT OF FOOD AND WATER!" My thoughts were "What! That would barely feed him or any of them!" Then I hear sniffing." SOMEONE WAS HERE!" My heart races, and sweat runs down my face. Then more sniffing. "THEY'RE STILL HERE!" My newest thought. "Why are they blessed with superhuman smell and hearing?" Then rumbling above me, allowing me to guess, It took the roof off. It flips the bookshelf off of me, I jump up, and try to bolt straight out of the building. Then a furred tower blocks my exit and plucks me out through the roof.
1241.title: Supplies, Books, And Titans

12411.content: "Get Off Of Me!" I screamed as I struggle, while being lifted into the air. I feel the lifting stop, the moonlight brightens up the anthro's huge face. It had silver eyes, and resembled a fox. "A HUMAN!" It spoke, but to me it sounded like someone used two megaphones in my ear. Its' voice was deep, so I assumed it was a male. "Put Me Down!" I yelled as I squirmed in his grasp. Then I felt myself descend, being placed on his mile long muzzle. I stood realizing I was knee deep in his fur. I look up, waiting for something to happen. "What do you want?" I ask. I was nervously waiting for his answer until I got, "WHO YOU ARE, WHY ARE YOU IN A PLACE LIKE THIS, AND WHY DID YOU TRY TO RUN?" "My first answer is, none of your business, two, none of your business, and three, none of your business!" "SIGH... OKAY" He replies calmly. I was expecting him to get angry or something, I know I can shot my mouth off at times, but his calmness took me by surprise. I then ask. "Can you put me down, like on the ground?" "NAH, I DON'T THINK I WILL." "What! Why?" I yell. "BECAUSE YOU WON'T ANSWER MY QUESTIONS." "Who are you, and why should I tell you anything?" After my question, it went silent, then out of nowhere he stands to his full mile tall height. I fall on his muzzle, then hear "MY NAME IS FOX." "Wow, what an original name." "REALLY!?" "No, that was sarcasm." He gets an annoyed look, and starts walking. "Fine, I'll tell you my name." I feel him stop. "It's Akira. That's all I'm telling you!" "THAT IS A NICE NAME." "Thanks. I guess?" "THAT WAS SARCASM." He replies. I got slightly annoyed, but I did start it, so I let it slide. "Can you put me down now?" "NO, YOU HAVE MORE QUESTIONS TO ANSWER." He starts walking again, back to his group. I sat there, holding on to his fur, nervously wait for what come next.
12411.title: Questions to be Asked and Answered

124111.content: As we approached his group, I started to tense up, my heart raced at the thought of the many questions I had, but one of them stuck out the most, will I end up in a cage to never be free again. Then the fear of the thought took over, and took action. I began to trek up Fox's face, and stumbled my way behind his left ear, and grasped the fur around it. "WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" Fox asks, but I Ignored him. I... I began to remember my bad history with the anthro kind. Then I heard Fox greet his friends. "HEY GUYS." "HEY FOX, DID YOU FIND ANYTHING YOU LIKED ?" A female anthro asked. "YEAH", then I heard fox speak calmly, "COME ON OUT AKIRA, THEY WON'T HURT YOU." I was hesitant and afraid at first, but after a few seconds, I walked out and revealed myself to his friends. It was silent, they looked at me as if I was something they've never seen before. I looked at each of them and saw four of them. I tried to register and identify them to the animals I knew, from the books I read so far. The female that spoke to fox, is also a fox, but her eyes are a more concentrated, bright green. The second is a bear, he is the largest out of the whole group, his fur is dark brown, and his eyes are pitch black. The third one is a lion, his mane was black, and his glaring, yellow eyes are starting to give me chills down my spine. The last one is a raven. Her wings are large, with black feathers, and warm, red eyes. After I and his group finished registering each other, Fox began to introduce me to his friends. "GUYS, THIS IS AKIRA, I FOUND HIM ALL BY HIMSELF." Then the lion coldly stated, "A HUMAN, I'M SURPRISED HE ISN'T IN THE ZOO." Then the word "Zoo" triggered me to breakdown. I was never a fan of the word, to me it meant "Put me in a cage and look at me." Then Fox somehow felt my discomfort. "I NEVER LIKED THE ZOO!" He calmly replied. His words calmed me down, and I regained my composure. "AKIRA, THESE ARE MY FRIENDS, THAT'S VIXEN, JON, LEO, AND RAVEN." I softly spoke "Hi." I was still a little nervous, but they seemed okay.
124111.title: They Seem Okay

1241111.content: As the night went on, Fox's friends, well most them, bombarded me with many random questions. "HEY, LET THE KID BREATHE, ONE AT A TIME." Fox interrupted. Then Vixen asked. "HOW OLD ARE YOU?" "I'm sixteen." "WHERE WERE YOU BORN, AND WHERE ARE YOU FROM?" Raven asked. "I don't know where I was born. I was always wandering with parents, so I never had a home." Then Vixen asked the question that ended the conversation. "WHERE ARE YOUR PARENTS?" "...Gone." It went silent. Then I began to ask questions. "Who are you, and why are you here." Then Fox answered. "WE'RE ARCHEOLOGISTS, AND WERE TRAVELING TO A TEMPLE, WELL JUST THE THREE OF US, JON AND LEO ARE THE MUSCLE." "I BET HE DOESN'T KNOW WHAT ARCHEOLOGY IS." Leo added. "Yes I do, it's the study of ancient artifacts and temples, left behind by the ancients." "WOW, HOW DO YOU KNOW ABOUT THAT." Raven asked. "I read about it somewhere. Why is that surprising?" "SORRY, HUMANS AT THE ZOO DON'T REGULARLY DISPLAY ANY INTELLIGENCE." "WELL, WHEN YOUR THROWN INTO A CAGE, THERE IS NOT MUCH TO DO." Fox replied. "WHAT SO YOU WERE IN THAT BOOKSTORE READING." Fox asks. "Yeah, whenever I find a place with books, I try to read every book I can." "HOW LONG HAVE YOU'VE READING, AND DO YOU HAVE ANY BOOKS WITH YOU?" "I have been reading since I was probably six or seven, and no I don't carry books with me." I replied "WHY NOT?" Vixen asked. "My Dad, taught me to take necessary items, books would be useless baggage, so I just read what I can and finish before I leave." Then I asked. "What temple are you going to?" "WE'RE HEADING TO THE EL TITINIO, IT'S DOWN SOUTH." Raven replied. "Oh, I was already heading that way." "WHY?" Fox asked. "I've heard there are small settlements, I've been looking to rejoin the rest of my kind." When I spoke those words, they saw and felt the hope I had. This is the first conversation I've had with an anthro or anyone since my parents were around. "WELL, I'M TIRED, I'M GOING TO SLEEP." Fox said. He then tried to sleep, while I sat on his head bewildered. "Hey, wait... Are going to put me back down on the ground!" I yelled. "I'LL THINK ABOUT IT, JUST SLEEP THERE." I look around to see everyone going to sleep. I gave up on getting to the ground, and I was tired, so I just went to sleep.
1241111.title: It Has Been a While since I've

12411111.content: Every time I try to sleep, I would slide an inch down his head, then I would grab onto his fur to keep me from sliding more. I look into the sky, it was still night. I gaze at the stars and moon, then I tried to estimate the time by their placement. I guessed almost three in the morning. I look at Fox, still asleep while I'm about to fall of his head. "He must be a heavy sleeper." I thought to myself. I decide to try to climb down. It only took me like 5 minutes to reach the ground. I look at Fox sleeping form, up against a humongous boulder. I realize how humongous he is compared to me. Then I began my trek back to the town. By the time I reached the town, it was already dawn. I began trying to look for clues ot where the people of this town went, I was thinking maybe it might lead to a settlement. I remember at the supermarket, everything there was untouched, so something must have happened. Then I walk up to an apartment building, and walk in. Then the feeling I had from the supermarket came back, it felt like something ominous was in the building. Instead of running out of the building, I walked in further, I then I pull out my flashlight and knife, for whatever's in the darkness. I pass the front desk, and to the stairs. I began to forget the true reason I was back here. I don't even know why I'm investigating the feeling. I got to the second floor, and shined my light through the darkness of the narrow corridor. I then I saw a door at the end of the hall, open just by a little. I walk up to the door, standing ready for whatever's behind it.
12411111.title: Back in Town

124111111.content: "Creak..." As I opened the door, then I froze. There was something in the middle of the room. I shine my light at it... I... I didn't even know what it was. It was black, It then turned around, and gazed at me, with its' blood, red eyes. I... I felt its' bloodlust, its' hate, its'... its' darkness. Then I blinked, and then... It tried to... It began attacking me, with claws longer than any knife I've seen. I was able to dodge its' attack, then began to run. All I knew was to get out of there. I bolted down the stairs to the lobby, and ran for the light that was out the door. It then triggered some security alarm, causing the security shudders to start closing off the building. "What apartment building requires security shudders!" I yelled. I slide under as the shudder closed behind me, I was out, luckily. I sat there trying to catch my breathe. Then I hear the shudders open up. I get up and gazed into the darkness of the building, and there it was, glaring at me. It sat there like it couldn't come out, like it hated the light. Just by looking at it lead me to guess what happened here. I began running, just to get out of that town. I make it past a sign, and stop. I look back at the town, not even knowing what to think. Then I hear "AKIRA!" I realize it was morning, so I assumed Fox was now awake. I begin my walk back to Fox and his friends. Whatever that thing was, I was lucky to even escape it.
124111111.title: Run, Slide, Run, Run

1241111111.content: I finally get back only to find Fox freaking out. "WHAT HAPPENED TO AKIRA, I THOUGHT WE WERE FRIENDS." Everyone else was looking at him like he was a crazy person. "I'm right here." I yelled. They all looked in my direction. "YOUR BACK, WHERE WERE YOU?" Fox sobbed. "I was... uhh... going to the bathroom, and why are you so emotionally attached, we just met last night." "THAT'S WHAT I SAID." Vixen added. "We're also traveling south, so I thought we would be traveling together." "OH, RIGHT." Fox replied, without crying. He walked over, and picked me up, then placed me back on his head. "Also, you guys seem pretty cool, well except Leo." "WHAT! WHY NOT?" Leo replied, angrily. "Sorry, but you were kind of a jerk, last night." As I said that, Leo got more angry. Everyone else looked as if they were agreeing with me. "WELL, ENOUGH WITH THE HONESTY, LETS GET GOING." Fox interrupted. "WE'RE GOING THROUGH THE TOWN, RIGHT?" Vixen asked. "YEAH." Fox replied. "NO!" I yelled. Everyone looked at me. "I lied, I wasn't going to the bathroom, I was in the town." They were shocked, but more interested in what I had to say. I continued, "I... I saw something, I don't know what, but... I know it wasn't friendly." "BUT THAT'S THE ONLY PATH GOING SOUTH." Raven argued. It went silent, then Fox said. "WE'RE GOING THROUGH THE TOWN." Hearing that had struck fear in my heart, but then Fox reassured me. "DON'T WORRY, I'LL KEEP A LOOKOUT FOR IT." I was still afraid, but it seemed I could trust Fox. "Okay, but first, can you put me down, I have to go to the bathroom this time."
1241111111.title: One Crazy Morning

12411111111.content: After my five minute bathroom break. We began our trek back to town, hopefully for the last time. I sit quietly on Fox's head, until Fox asks. "SO, WHY WERE YOU IN THE TOWN?" "I was hoping to find a clue to where a settlement might be." I replied "DID YOU FIND ANYTHING?" "No, I just ran into whatever that thing was." I unconsciously grasped tightly onto Fox's fur. "DO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT IT?" I remained silent. Then I answered. "No, I'm tired." "DIDN'T YOU GET ANY SLEEP LAST NIGHT?" "No, I couldn't sleep, I kept sliding off your head." "REALLY, I'M SORRY! DO YOU WANT TO GO TO SLEEP?" "I don't know if I can sleep." Just before Fox could reply. We make it back to the town. My grasp on Fox's fur tightened even more. Then Fox paused. While his friends walked ahead. "WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?" Vixen asked. "ARE YOU READY AKIRA?" Fox asked. I was hesitant, but I replied, "Yeah." Then Fox began walking through the town. I look down the side of fox's muzzle. I realized how high up off the ground I was. The buildings were barely tall enough to reach the top of Fox's toes. I also didn't see the creature, so I calmed down a little. We make it out of town in two minutes. I lie down on Fox's muzzle, and stare at the sky. His fur made it feel like I was in field of wild grass, it was warm. Then I close my eyes and find myself drifting off to sleep.
12411111111.title: Last Time in Town

124111111112.content:
Once Akira falls asleep on my muzzle. I begin to wonder what happened to the kid. When I met him last night. He was hostile and afraid. I don't blame him. He's a smart kid. He knows what my kind has been doing. Ever since the humans started to die off. My kind has been capturing and throwing humans in cages. I understand that it's for their own protection, but there are better ways to handling the situation. When I went to the Zoo, as a pup. What I saw was sad. The humans were miserable, they were separated, unable to interact with each other, and I bet they have never set foot outside of those cages. We took away their freedom. Our history with humankind has never been clear. We were always separated from them, and unaware of the each others existence. I wish I can ask Akira what it's been like for him to be out here, alone, and what happened with his parents, but it doesn't seem like he's comfortable with talking about his problems. When we go our separate ways, I hope he finds a settlement. I don't want him to end up in one of those cages. I've heard those settlements are well hidden. My kind has never found any of them. It would be better if he were there.
Two hours have past since we've left the town. It seemed to be the middle of the day. I gaze at Akira's tiny sleeping form. "Psst... Hey, brother!" Vixen whispers. "Hmm... What is it?" I replied quietly. "How is the kid doing?" "He seems fine. He's just asleep." "It's a surprise to find someone like him out here." "I know, this also might be the only positive interaction he's ever had with our kind." "You think so?" "Yeah, when I found him, he tried to run." "I can see why." "What do you mean?" "Well he has been on his own for a awhile, and the only people he has ever known was his parents, but it seems like he's warming up to you a lot." "Do you really think so, Vixen?" "Yeah, you may not know it, but your good at sensing another's feelings, and your always calm and patient with them, so it's natural for him to warm up to you." Vixen stated. I never really thought about it, but Vixen was right. We just met last night, and Akira already seems comfortable with me. "I'm glad I'm doing something right." I said to myself. Then after three more hours, we stop at a river for a break.
124111111112.title: Thoughts by Fox

1241111111122.content: "Yawn..." I sit up and look around. "Where is everyone?" I wondered. I stand up, and notice the surface I was on. I reach down to feel it. It felt like leather. Then my stomach started to growl. "I'm hungry." I sit back down, and begun rummaging through my bag. I pull out a can of peaches, a fork, and a can opener, and Yes, I own a can opener. I open the can, and begun to eat my peaches. Then I got bored, and begun to sing about how much I like to eat peaches, while eating peaches. After a few seconds, I begun feeling tremors. Then I see Jon with a bunch of... I guess logs, but they're larger than logs. "Hey, Jon!" I yelled. Then Jon looked down at me, without saying a thing. He just stared. "Ahh... Do you know where everyone is?" I asked, but he just remained silent. He sets down the logs on steroids, and walks off. I shrugged and went back to eating my peaches. I gazed at the clouds in the sky. I guessed it was almost five in the afternoon. I finish my can of peaches. It felt like hours until I feel another tremor. This time it was Raven. "Hey, Raven!" I yelled. "OH, HEY AKIRA!" She replied. "Where is everyone? I asked Jon, but..." "OH YEAH, JON DOESN'T TALK A LOT. LEO AND FOX ARE FISHING, JON IS GETTING FIREWOOD, AND VIXEN AND I ARE COLLECTING STONES FOR THE FIRE." "Okay, is there anything I can do to help?" "UHH... NOT REALLY, JUST WAIT, FOX AND LEO WILL PROBABLY BE BACK IN A FEW MINUTES." Then Raven left. "Okay..." I said. I pull out my knife and begun to play with it. "Sigh... I bored! I wish I had a book!" I yelled. Then it started to get dark. The sun was setting, and no one was back yet. Then the feeling from town started to happen. I stood up with my knife ready in hand.
1241111111122.title: Song About Peaches

choices: Fox and Leo are back first
Vixen and Raven are back first
12411111111221.content:
As soon as I was ready with a knife in my hand. The feeling subsided. It was strange. I sat back down and began contemplating my encounter with Fox, and that strange shadow. Before I met Fox, I never felt this way before. I feel like I'm on high alert. I should keep my guard up just in case.

I climb down off the bag and began walking around. I was hoping to waste time looking around. This place was a large, open field they must have picked to be their campsite I thought. Then I stood looking out toward the horizon, watching the sun disappear as the moon and stars appeared. I was always amazed by how the universe would show its beauty, while the ugliness remained underneath. The dwindling number of the human race, The Zoo, and everything that has happened so far. It felt impossible to comprehend. I always wondered what could have been, but I know it's not something I should think about. I turn back and see it. The shadow. I pull out my knife and ready myself once more. This time I wasn't afraid. I felt calm and focused. I wasn't gonna let it kill me. I stood staring back at it. I ask. "What do you want?" It pointed. Then replying creepily. "You." It flew towards me, claws ready. Then I pull out one more knife and successfully block both its claws. It drew back both of its' claws for another attack. I dodge and began parrying each of its' attacks. Then I saw an opening and tried to drive my knife through it, but I ended up passing through it. I turn and jumped backwards to get some distance. I stood and stared at it trying to figure out how to beat this thing. I began analyzing it. It's fast, It had claws, and is intangible, but what I did know was that it hated the light. So I decided to try something. I pull out a flash grenade. It was a tiny, grey ball with a ring of light yellow around it. I arm and throw it in the air behind me. I close my eyes and tried to focus. I began to hear it as the grenade went off. It wailed as the light bombarded it. When the light died out I open my eyes. I couldn't see it anywhere. The shadow was gone.
12411111111221.title: So far

choices: We got a few more minutes to talk
124111111112211.content:
Something was off, it was slightly effortless, I can still sense it. From the sound it made it definitely wasn't fond of light. My thoughts were interrupted by multiple tremors. "It's gone for now." I said to myself.
I paced back to the leather bag, as Fox and Leo appeared from a brief distance. "YOU'RE AWAKE." Fox bellowed. I stood next to the raw sienna, leather bag, struggling to stand as their footfall earthquakes made standing difficult. "Yeah" I loudly replied, baffled by the major size difference between them and me. I noticed the haul of massive fish they've brought with them. I've noticed four fish, it was understandable, the fish were the size of that ghost town. The quake ended. Fox knelt on one knee, laying his paw flat out on the ground, motioning me to hop on. I impulsively climb on, free of hesitation. It was strange for me, I hardly know Fox that well, and I'm sleeping on his muzzle and climbing on his paw without protest. He raises me to his head, I jump on, and he stands to his full height. "HERE, I'LL GO HELP JON WITH THE FIREWOOD." Leo said as he handed Fox his haul of fish before walking off. "HOW WAS YOUR NAP." Fox asked. "It was great." I awkwardly replied. "How long was I out?" "MOST OF THE DAY." Fox replied with a smirk. "Well, umm... do you want my help." "OH UH," "I insist, I haven't done a whole lot today. I feel awful for that, I know I might not have your stature, but..." I fell short of what to say, I do feel awful for doing absolutely nothing and being useless. "HOW WELL ARE YOU WITH MAPS?" "I know some stuff." Fox places the fish in a bucket. he rummages through his bag, and pulls out some decent tech. He pulled up a screen, and marked the location of the town and our current position. "Lets see, hmm... can you zoom out a little." "SURE" Fox readjusts the screen. "Do you know the location of the temple? latitude and longitude." "UHH, NO, NOT REALLY." I looked at him in the eye with disappointment. "Wow, that's not very helpful. were you hoping to wing it." He looked at me with a smirky guilt face."Do you have any information on the temple." "YEAH, I'LL PULL IT UP." He showed the research and It wasn't what I was expecting. "YEAH, WE'VE BEEN TRYING TO DECIPHER THIS LANGUAGE, BUT ALL WE'VE GOT WAS SOUTH." I stared at the screen with shock, the language system presented wasn't anything many seen, I wasn't common, I knew Fox didn't know it, but I could read it. "This language is dead, that's why it's difficult to read. You got south right though." " WAIT, YOU CAN READ THAT?" "Yeah, it's not common language. I've seen it before. My Mom knew it." As I looked at the screen, each symbol and mark rearranged itself in to the English language. I motioned for him to bring the screen closer to me, and I started marking the map of the humongous screen "We should pass through this town, then move southeast from the town to this jungle. That's where it should be." "ARE YOU A GOOD LUCK CHARM, CAUSE THAT WAS AMAZING!"
124111111112211.title: Just Helping Out

1241111111122112.content: At some point everyone returns, they began to prep the fish and campsite. Fox and I were going through some of his research note. "FROM WHAT SEEN FROM SOME OF THE PHOTOS, SOME OF THAT LANGUAGE CAN BE FOUND HERE AND HERE, CAN YOU TRANSLATE IT." "Sure, It mentions the history of our two kinds. it seems we've used to live amongst each other before, but that parts blurry or scratched out. Can you enhance the photo?" "YEAH" Fox enhances the photo. We both saw that most of the markings in the photo were demolished. We both sighed simultaneously. "Where were you able to get these photos?" I asked. "FROM THE SAMPLES WE ACQUIRED, BUT WE HAVEN'T BROUGHT THEM WITH US." He sighed once more. " IT SOUNDS LIKE YOU BOTH HIT AN OBSTACLE, YOU WANT TO FILL ME IN." Raven spoke as she approached. Everyone finished whatever they were doing, and sat around the campfire. The pleasant aroma of cooked fish got me famished. "YEAH WE'VE HIT IT ONCE MORE, BUT WE GOT MORE TO WORK WITH. THANKS TO AKIRA." Fox replied as he grabbed his cooked fish on a stick. He took his claws and tore off a tiny piece, handing it to me. It was the size of my head. I grabbed it. I took my first bite, it was delicious and hot. I kept chowing down as Fox filled them in on the new information we've discovered. "WAIT, AKIRA CAN READ THAT. NONE OF US OR OUR TECH COULD DECIPHER IT." Vixen shouted. She looked at me with shock. "YEAH, HE LEARNED IT FROM HIS MOTHER." Fox replied. "A DEAD LANGUAGE FROM HIS MOTHER, HOW CONVENIENT. AT LEAST WE KNOW WHERE TO GO. Leo stated. Jon gave a thumbs up in approval as he took a massive bite out of his fish. "AKIRA, HOW DO YOU AND YOUR MOTHER KNOW THIS LANGUAGE?" Raven questioned. I replied. "I umm... It's difficult to explain, but I'll try. This language is not something that can be spoken, only read and written. Not many can read it, because you have to born to read it. It can be taught, but it's tricky for other. It presents itself as marking and symbols to others, but for my Mom and I, it rearranges itself as plain English." "AKIRA, WHEN WE GET TO THE TEMPLE, CAN YOU BE OUR TRANSLATOR." Fox asked. "Oh, sure!" I replied. I heard his tail wag a little. at some point we finished eating, and Fox made his way to one of the tents. "It's strange," I spoke. "WHAT." Fox asked. "We're complete strangers, but you've been kind. Why are you being nice to me? Why haven't you've turnt me in to your authorities?" " YOU REMIND ME OF A FRIEND I HAD AS A PUP. SHE WAS HUMAN."
1241111111122112.title: Everyone returns

choices: The Days We Met: Part Two
12411111111221121.content:
"I WAS NINE AND THE RUNT OF MY GROUP, WHEN I MET HER. HER WHITE CLOUD COLORED HAIR IS SIMILAR TO YOUR'S. HER KINDNESS AND LAUGH WAS INFECTIOUS. HER NAME IS NORA."
Seventeen years ago, the day they met.
'IT WAS A THURSDAY, SUMMER AFTERNOON. I WAS PLAYING WITH MY SISTER AND FRIENDS, WE WERE IN THE FOREST, I WAS SLOW AND EXHAUSTED, I COULDN'T KEEP UP WITH THEM.'
" HUFF...HUFF... GEEZ WHY CAN'T THEY SLOW DOWN." Kit Fox complained. 'I TOOK A SEAT ON A FALLEN TREE TO CATCH MY BREATHE. THAT'S WHEN I HEARD HER' "I al... most... got... it!" 'I DIDN'T KNOW WHERE THE VOICE CAME FROM, UNTIL I SAW HER ON A THIN BRANCH IN A BUSH, SHE WAS REACHING FOR A SMALL BERRY.' "Wow, is that a human, I've never seen one before." Kit Fox whispered to himself. 'I WALKED UP TO HER, HER FIXATION ON THE BERRY LEFT HER UNAWARE OF MY PRESENCE.'
"HELLO"
"Huh.. what the..." 'LIKE YOU, SHE GOT SCARED AND RAN AWAY FROM ME. FROM OTHERS, I HEARD HUMANS WERE SLOW, BUT SHE WAS FAST AND AGILE, SHE MADE HER WAY TO THE GROUND WITHIN SECONDS. THE BUSH SHELTERED HER FROM HER PERCEIVED THREAT, ME.' "WAIT, I'M SORRY, I DIDN'T MEAN TO SCARE YOU." 'I PLUCKED THE BERRY SHE WAS FIXATED ON, TRYING TO SHOW HER MY GOOD INTENTIONS.' "Will you please go away, I don't want to have anything to do with you!" Nora shouted. "HERE I PICKED THIS FOR YOU, I WON'T HURT YOU." 'I WAITED MINUTES. I KNEW SHE WAS STARVING, HER STOMACH WAS ROARING.' "No, you'll just put me in a cage like the other humans, I'd rather starve." "NO, I WON'T, AND I WON'T TELL ANYONE ABOUT YOU, I PROMISE." 'I DID WHAT COULD TO REASSURE HER THAT I WAS A FRIEND, IT TOOK AWHILE, BUT I CONVINCED HER. SHE WALKED OUT OF HER PROTECTION.' "HERE." 'I GAVE HER THE BERRY. I WATCH HER TAKE BITES OUT OF HER BERRY.' "MY NAME IS FOX. WHAT'S YOUR'S?" "It's Nora." "ARE THERE OTHER HUMANS WITH YOU?" "No, It's only me.I'm looking for others though." "HEY, DO YOU WANT TO BE FRIENDS, YOU WON'T FEEL LONELY IF YOU HAVE A FRIEND." 'SHE LOOKED AT ME WITH A KIND FACE.' "Sure, can...can I pet your fur?" "YEAH." 'I LOWERED A RED, FUR COVERED FINGER TO HER, AND SHE PET ME. I FORGOT ALL ABOUT MY SISTER AND FRIENDS, LOST TRACK OF TIME. I SPENT ALL THAT TIME BEING WITH NORA, WE TALKED AND PLAYED, UNTIL I HAD TO GO HOME.' "DO YOU WANT TO MEET UP BACK HERE TOMORROW?" Kit Fox Asked. "Yeah, and thanks." Nora replied. 'I WENT HOME, AND GOT SCOLDED BY MY PARENTS FOR GETTING HOME LATE, HEARING MY SISTER SNICKERING BEHIND THEM. I DIDN'T CARE THOUGH, I WENT TO BED, WAITED EAGERLY FOR THE NEXT DAY.'
12411111111221121.title: The Days We Met: Part One

choices: The Days We Met: Part Three
124111111112211211.content: 'THE DAYS I GOT TO MEET UP WITH NORA, I WOULD TRY TO FIND HER. "HEY NORA, I'M BACK." "Hey Fox, I'm over here!" 'WE TALKED FOR A WHILE, AND DID A LOT TOGETHER. THEN SHE TOLD ME SHE WOULD LEAVE AT SOME POINT. "Hey Fox, I'm leaving to find one of the hidden settlements." 'I WAS YOUNG, AND IGNORANT TO HER DANGERS, SO I BEGAN CONVINCING HER TO STAY.' "NO, PLEASE STAY, YOUR MY FRIEND." "I can't, I have to find the others, if I don't I'll be captured." "IF YOU GO YOU'LL BE ALL ALONE, PLUS WHAT'S WRONG WITH BEING CAPTURED BY THE ADULTS?" "What do you mean, Your people have been throwing humans in cages for no reason! They've taken our freedom! They took my family, my mom, dad, and brother! "I'M SORRY... WHAT IF I PROTECT YOU. KEEP THE ADULTS AWAY FROM YOU, WILL YOU STAY?" "I don't know, maybe." 'I MADE A PROMISE, I NEVER SHOULD HAVE MADE, ONE I COULD NOT KEEP!' "I PROMISE TO PROTECT YOU." "Okay, then I will stay." 'I WAS HER FRIEND, I SHOULD HAVE LET HER GO.'
124111111112211211.title: The Days We Met: Part Two

1241111111122112111.content: 'THE DAY THEY TOOK HER, I COULDN'T PROTECT HER. MY PARENTS FOUND OUT ABOUT HER. AN OFFICER OF THE HUMAN PROTECTION BUREAU TOOK HER, A WOLF NAMED DASAN.' "NORA YOU HAVE TO GO! HUFF... HUFF... MY PARENTS FOUND OUT, YOU HAVE TO..." 'MY PARENTS AND THE WOLF FOLLOWED ME.' "Fox what's... Oh no... Please Fox don't let them take me." Nora cried. "KID, GIVE US THE HUMAN PLEASE, WE DON'T WANT IT TO GET HURT." Dasan begged. Then Fox's parents spoke, "FOX... LET THE GENTLEMAN DO HIS JOB, HE ONLY MEANS TO PROTECT THE HUMAN. I KNOW SHE'S YOUR FRIEND FOX, BUT HUMAN ARE SMALL, FRAGILE, AND DYING. MEN LIKE MR. DASAN PROTECT HUMANS LIKE YOUR FRIEND. PLEASE DO WHAT'S BEST FOR HER." 'I LET THEM CONVINCE ME, AND LET THEM TAKE HER. SHE SCREAMED AND CRIED AS HE TOOK HER, I FAILED HER. I THOUGHT SHE WOULD BE FINE, BUT MONTHS LATER, MY PARENTS TOOK ME TO THE ZOO. I SAW HER. SHE WAS ALONE, IN A CAGE. SHE SAW ME AND REACTED IN A WAY NO ONE SAW BEFORE.' "Bang... Bang..." 'NORA SCREAMING FOR ME, BANGING ON THE GLASS, BUT I COULDN'T HEAR HER VOICE. I WAS PULLED AWAY."
1241111111122112111.title: The Days We Met: Part Three

12411111111221121111.content: "I... WISH I DID MORE AKIRA, AND I WANT TO DO MORE! THAT'S WHY I'M TRYING TO FIND THOSE RUINS, I KNOW IF WE FIND SOMETHING CONNECTING US TO THE HUMANS, I COULD FIND A WAY TO FREE THEM." I began to stroke the knee-deep, fur on Fox's head. Processing what he said, the genuine promises and regrets he feels. "Fox, I can't imagine how it was for you and Nora, but I understand what it's like to be put in a position where you feel conflicted and utterly useless. Sometimes I wish the situation we're in was different. Before I met you, avoiding you titans was something I was taught to do, but meeting you has changed what I thought about you and the others. Not everyone is the same. I want to help you. I don't want to run or hide anymore." Fox plucks me off his head, placing me on his palm. Then brings me in for an embrace, I thought my life was flashing before my eyes. I heard hard thumping. " His' tail," I thought to myself. He was more gentler than I thought... like him. "THANKS... AKIRA," Fox replied. I hug back. Then he pulls me away and begins licking me with his enormous tongue. "Hey... hehe... stop... please." I shout and giggle. Fox stops and backs away. "OH... HEHE... SORRY! I GOT CARRIED AWAY." "It's okay." I replied as I try to wipe the slobber off of me. It was nice though, having someone I can be at ease with. For the first time, Fox puts me on the ground. We go back over his notes. Then at some point, we both were out cold. Too tired to decipher the remaining notes.
12411111111221121111.title: Genuine Promises

124111111112211211112.content:
Everyday and night, even in my dreams, I think about my mom and dad.
My mom's name was Nora, she was human, and she left the world when I was 7. My Dad's name is Seke, he is a anthro, a wolf, I never knew what happened to him after he was arrested by his own, I was 10.
The girl in the glass cage, with cries unheard, age 9. She remained in her prison until she was a woman, age 21. For 12 years of her life, she coped with her prison. Then she met my dad. she always told me he was the biggest and strongest of his pack, not that it mattered, he was always huge to me. He was assigned to care for her by the Human Protection Bureau. He was 22.
"GOOD MORNING, MY NAME IS SEKE. HERE IT SAY'S YOUR NORA, IS THAT CORRECT?" said the warm, pitch black wolf. "Yes, sir." Nora giving an unenthusiastic reply. "LET'S START BY CHECKING YOUR WEIGHT AND HEIGHT." He pulls out a scale and hooks it up to a monitor in the room. he places her on the scale. "HMM... IT'S SAYING YOUR BARELY A GRAM. WHAT ARE THEY FEEDING YOU?" "Oh, I think you did it wrong, you forgot to transfer over to human measurements." "OH, I GUESS YOUR RIGHT. SORRY, FIRST DAY." "Hehe... haha... let me guess, I'm also your first patient?" "YEAH." Seke replied embarrassed. "Oh, I didn't mean it like that, I'm sorry." "NO, IT'S OKAY, THIS IS SOMETHING WE'RE USUALLY ASSIGNED BEFORE WE GO OUT IN THE FIELD." "Your different from the others." "WHAT DO YOU MEAN?" "You show how much you care. I think you'll do great." "OH, THANK YOU!" finishing up with my mom's check-up he puts her back in her cage.
Days going into her care, my dad felt more interested in caring for my mom. At some point, his' betters tried assigning him field work, but he would decline just to take care of my mom. No one suspected it, but he began falling for her, and she felt the same too. He felt conflicted at some point, keeping her in a cage no longer felt right, he changed.
"NORA, I'M GETTING YOU OUT OF HERE." "Seke, you can't, they'll catch you if you talk or act like that." "I DON'T CARE, WHAT WE'RE DOING TO YOU AND THE OTHERS, IT'S NOT RIGHT, YOU DESERVE BETTER. IT MIGHT SOUND WEIRD BUT... I LOVE YOU NORA." "Seke...!"
He found a way to smuggle my mom out of his job. He packed up and left everything he knew for my mom. They were successful, he traveled on foot with her, and they remained undetected.
A year later my mom became pregnant with me. I don't know how they managed it, but they found a way. Then at some point I came into the world. I was tiny, barely looked anything like my dad. I only got his earth green eyes. It never mattered to him though, he was filled with love. When I was in my terrible two phase, dad would fail trying to get me to sleep and nap, unless it was in his fur. Mom was the only one who got me into bed, she was the reason I got into reading. When I turned 5 dad taught me all the survival skills, he made up some games to help hone those skills. Then I turned 7.
"Dad... When will we make it to one of the settlements?" "AKIRA, I TOLD IT WILL TAKE AWHILE." We make it to an abandoned city. "Akira, be patient, the settlements are well hidden, finding one will take time." Nora answered. "What will happen when we make it to one mom, Will they let dad stay?" Dad stopped, hesitant when I asked that question. "HEY AKIRA, WHY DON'T YOU GO TO THAT BOOKSTORE AND READ UP FOR A LITTLE WHILE." Dad let me down. I ran off to the store. "HE MIGHT BE RIGHT NORA." Seke said as he sat against one of the buildings. "Seke, he's just exhausted, we all are, but we shouldn't give up." "BUT WHAT IF I CAN'T STAY, WHAT IF I CAN'T BE IN YOUR LIVES." "Seke, you will always be in our lives. If we can't find a settlement where we all can settle down. We will make a place for ourselves." "WHY DON'T WE JUST DO THAT, GET AS FAR AS WE CAN AND SETTLE DOWN." "That's better. I'll go get Akira, and tell him our new plan." "OKAY" Seke replies and lowers Nora to the ground. "AHH... Dad, Mom!" I screamed. "STAY HERE!" I was in the clutches of a wolf, Dasan. Dad came around the corner. "DASAN, PUT... HIM... DOWN!" "OH, SEKE ITS BEEN AWHILE, I'M SURPRISED YOU ABLE TO PRODUCE A HUMAN SON. I'M TAKING BACK THE WOMAN, AND I'LL BE TAKING THIS ONE AS WELL. YOU WILL BE ARRESTED FOR MULTIPLE CHARGES, IF YOU DON'T FIGHT IT, YOU MIGHT GET OFF WITH NOTHING." "GRRR... I DARE YOU TO TRY, PUT HIM DOWN, AND I'LL SHOW YOU WHAT I MEAN!" The wolf put me down, and I ran back to my mom. "NORA, AKIRA GET AWAY, QUICKLY." "SEKE, I'LL TEACH YOU WHAT HAPPENS WHEN DEFY YOUR BETTERS." Mom and I ran off as fast we could. The fighting begun. I wasn't able to see what was going on, but they both could be heard from miles away. It got quite quickly. We then heard Dasan. "HUMANS WHERE ARE YOU, YOUR PROTECTER HAS BEEN BEAT, SUBMIT." "Akira to your father, see if he is okay, I will try to lure him away. GO NOW!" I ran hearing my mom shouting to distract the wolf. I find dad on his back, claw marks all over him. "Dad, wake up, are you okay? Mom needs help!" he gets back up. "AKIRA, HOP ON." I jump on dad's paw and he places me on his head. We make it to a bridge disconnected from the other side. mom was cornered and the wolf had where he thought he wanted her. "DASAN, STOP!" Dad yelled, but the wolf didn't listen. Then mom said something. "I Love You Both, I'm Sorry." She jumped. "NO...NO...NO" Dasan muttered as he tried to catch her. I was stunned, I couldn't move, breathe, or say anything. Dad screamed and cried. "NOOOO... NO.NO.NO." No one moved then I said. "Dad, we should go." He looked at me, then Dasan. He ran with me fast, fleeing from the wolf. at some point we find a good place to stop. "Huff... Huff... Huff..." I was hyperventilating, breaking down, processing everything. Dad tries calming me down. "Why... Dad, Why?" I cried. he couldn't answer. I just cry myself to sleep in his fur.
I wake up. "SORRY AKIRA, DID I WAKE YOU?" I can hear the sadness in his voice. "Dad... Are you... Sad?" he didn't react. "I... I AM... I AM SAD, AKIRA."
We just kept moving. We continued, we had no choice. It wasn't always bad, we had our good days. Then I turned 10.
The wolf, Dasan, he brought a pack with him. Dad held them off long enough for me to escape. He was arrested. I was alone. My mom and dad were gone. I've gone 6 years without them. I miss them both, but I have to keep moving.
124111111112211211112.title: My Before

Here are some more choices:
