125.title: More Choices

1251.content: What sort of pantheon would you like in particular?
1251.title: Choose your Style

12511.content:
"Lord Pharaoh," A voice addresses you, "You must rise." You open your eyes to see a figure standing over you. You get up and get a good look at the man who addressed you; he is wearing some colourful but loose clothing and looks like a religious official. As you stand you're suprised to find servants coming to dress you.

"I do not remember any of this." You inform the priest, seeking for an explanation.

"My Lord Pharaoh," He comments with surprise and alarm, "What force has drained your memory? You are the Pharaoh of the Kingdom of Tipyeg, I am the Head Priest of the jackal God Sibuna and your mother has died." You look shocked at this news. "We must prepare for her funeral." You take this in and decide to go along with whatever's happening.

You follow the priest through what must be your palace, various people bow as you pass and you raise your hand acceptingly to each one. You go down some stairs until you find yourself in what is either a basement or a cellar. Upon a stone slab you see the still body of your mother, dressed in jewellry and robes. On the wall you see pictograms showing anthropomorpic animal figures, each one holding something in one of their paws. One of them you suspect to be Sibuna, a jackal with its paw held up to its muzzle but you cannot quite see what is in its paw.

As you stand over your deceased mother the priest mutters something incomprehensible and two lesser priests reverently throw some plant material over the corpse; you look to see this material as being chopped parsley and jasmine and then the priest you first met takes a handful of yellow powder from a container and sprinkles it over your mother from head to toe, a whiff of this powder tells you that it's saffron.
12511.title: A Pharaoh and a Funeral

12512.content:
You wake to find a bloke dressed in robes standing over you.

"You must rise, my lord," He addresses you, "The Festival of the Harvest is about to begin. Clover says that it's the highlight of the year for her." You get up feeling confused. You do not know where you are nor who Clover is.

After you are dressed in what look like extravagent garments you speak to who must be a high-ranking priest.

"Remind me," You instruct him, "Who is Clover?" He looks at you with shock and says.

"My lord, she is but the great goddess of the harvest, she is the lady of food and the mistress of refreshment." You nod to him now knowing what he is talking about.

The priest leads you out of what looks like a mansion of some kind; at first glance you think it's Georgian until you notice that the gardens seem rather small and contain more fruit trees thn ornamental plants. You follow him through the streets of the surrounding city where people bow to you as you pass, you acknowledge their bows while the priest just waves them off; they must be bowing to both of you.

The architecture of this city seems to be rather Athenian, like you've just entered Ancient Greece but there was never a Greek goddess called Clover. You remember that Ancient Greece had a goddess of the harvest called 'Demeter'. Eventually the priest leads you up the steps to a temple that looks like a mini-Acropolis.

Inside the temple several bushels and bails of hay are stacked in a ceremonial fashion on both sides of the aisle down which you walk. Deep friezes run along the walls depicting scenes of prosperous harvests and of an unusual sight, a colossal anthropomorphic rabbit floating in the sky smiling down upon the farmers.
12512.title: A New World, A New Power

choices: Choose a differant Furry with the same situation
Choose a differant storyline all together
1252.content:
It's been a thousand years. A thousand years since we lost our home to a being we've come to refer to as "The Monster". Something of an irony really, seeing as we're now living inside this monster for a long time now.

When the planet was being devastated by massive objects too large to describe, we had a plan - we loaded up as many people as we could into shuttles and sent mining teams to dig a way in. Luckily for us, it's skin was over a thousand miles thick, meaning we had plenty of space to move in and make ours. Over time, the colony grew itself - we used the iron from the creature's blood to build cities, as well as harvesting any Asteroids that it happened to eat (which required a lot of protective gear to survive the stomach acids alone). It's blood plasma was distilled into a new water source. It wasn't pleasant to drink, but there was enough to supply us all without debating an alternative.

And all this time, it didn't seem to notice us.

Moving forwards a thousand years, I decided to be the first man to climb out onto the surface. Since I did this quietly, there was no fanfare on my departure. Using a drill, I climbed out near a pore...which didn't seem to disturb it one bit. The surface was...unusual. It had a reletively tanned flesh tone, but around my exit point were Grey hairs...hairs easily large enough to mount an entire city stably on.

I got out my pickaxe. This was going to be a long climb...
1252.title: Pack Alpha

1253.content:
How about these choices?

Little or Big Brothers/Sisters: Same as big brother/sister but in this universe there is more then one mega-sized anthro siblings.

Anthro God siblings: In this universe you wake up to fined that the mega-sized anthro Gods has became your siblings.
1253.title: Other

12531.content:
"Sarah?" Mom called from downstairs. "It's time to get up, sweety. It's the first day of school and you don't want to be late."

Sarah woke up with a start, sitting bolt upright in bed. Almost immediately she knew that something wasn't right. The dream that she had woken up from was so vivid. She was in her house, sleeping, when she was woken up by a bright light and then pulled...somewhere. She was told that she would be transferred to another universe, where she was needed. She was told not to be afraid of what was going to happen, that she would be all right and everything would work out in the end. There was no way to tell who she was talking, or perhaps she just didn't remember. They might have been balls of light, or thin, stick-like silhouettes bathed in blinding illumination.

Even though the details of this strange dream were fading, Sarah had the creeping feeling that it wasn't over. She looked around her room and immediately spotted several differences. All of her furniture was the same -- her bed was exactly the way she remembered it, and her dresser and computer desk were in their usual places -- but some things were very, very new.

There were pictures all around her room of some...immense creature that was part-man, part-horse. He had short, thick brown fur and gray hooves, and his mane was a brown so dark it was nearly black. His hands were rough, padded leather on the palms, and tipped with blunt, hoof-like nails on each of his four fingers. He kept modest (as much as a titan like him could) with a simple pair of overalls that were big enough to cover city blocks. Sarah couldn't get an exact sense of scale from the pictures, but she knew that this...man was immense, measured in miles the way she was measured in feet.

It was stunning. She had no idea a being like this could exist, but at the same time she felt herself regarding these pictures with no small amount of affection. How could she feel so strongly for someone she had never met before? It was as if some hidden part of herself knew things that she didn't. She sat in bed for a few minutes, trying to figure out what else she knew about this...thing. Her mind came up blank, though.

This is what she did know. Her name was Sarah Lancaster. Her parents were Philip and Rory Lancaster, and they lived in rural Pennsylvania, where they owned a horse farm. She had one brother, whose name she couldn't remember, and he was 18 years old. She was 20, she was studying to be a veterinarian, and this life -- whatever it was -- was not hers. She didn't belong here.

"Sarah, honey," her mom called again. "We really have to get moving. Avery's waiting for you in the Meeting Area. You don't want him to come over here looking for you, do you? You know what happened last time."

Avery. Why did that name sound so familiar? The part of her brain that knew these things seemed to be somewhat amused. Avery, she suddenly remembered, was her...
12531.title: Little or Big brothers/sisters

choices: ...the train stopped in the tunnel for some reason.
125311.content:
Her brother. Avery, she remembered, was her brother. And with that realization came a flood of memories.

She remembered her parents coming home with something that looked like a small, bipedal horse one afternoon. She was told that this was her new brother, and that they would all have to move someplace very far away so there'd be enough room for him. Sarah remembered her mom being pregnant before, but it took her a while to connect the two events. One in every ten million births resulted in this sort of mega-sapient organism, as they were called, and no one knew why. It just...started happening a hundred years ago.

That's when they moved to rural Pennsylvania. There was a burgeoning mega-sapiens community there, with an adjoining village where family and friends could be close by. She remembers going to school with Avery and a bunch of other students -- both human and mega -- and got along with just about everyone really well. In fact, she chose a rural veterinary college just so she could keep living at home.

She remembered Avery's first day at school. His first school play. How he had become a rambunctious, willful colt and how the destruction of half the farmland outside of their village cured him of that. She remembered having long conversations with him about how tough it was to be his size, how difficult it was to be so careful. But how much harder it was to imagine hurting his family. She remembered going out on double-dates with him and....

Sarah's head spun. She had to stop thinking about that.

Her parents were waiting for her downstairs, looking as they always had. Philip was a tall, middle-aged man with a kindly face and light brown hair streaked with grey. His eyes were almost honey-colored, always amused and sharp. Rory was paler, with nearly-black hair storming around her head and shoulders. Her blue eyes were almost predatory, giving her a hard look that made her maternal personality all the more surprising. Both of them wore conspicuous bracelets around their left wrists; they were a quarter-inch thick on all sides, and appeared to be made out of solid metal. Lights coursed underneath the surface in a pattern that made Sarah think of circuitry.

"Come on, sleepyhead," her mother said, reaching to usher her out the door. "You know how impatient your brother gets."

Her father moved in behind her as she was being lead out of the house. "And goodness knows we don't want him peeking in at us. He'll give the whole neighborhood a fright. Have you got your ID turned on?"

ID. Sarah briefly thought about it, and a phrase came to her: <i>interaction device</i>. The metal band around her wrist would let her interact with the megas safely. They provided a quantum forcefield that rendered her immune to an insane amount of pressure, in case something were to fall on them or (Heaven forbid) one of them stepped on her accidentally. It even came with a small supply of oxygen in case an incident occurred. They automatically synced with similar devices the megas had, allowing them to be seen and heard, mitigating the ear-splittingly, bone-crunchingly loud voices of the titans and making things that much more...manageable. The same part of her mind that recalled this information didn't seem too impressed with this. IDs had been available publically for at least fifty years, with new features being added all the time. But Sarah was floored by the technology. This is the sort of thing you only saw in science-fiction novels!

She briefly checked the ID, instinctively knowing where on the smooth surface to touch. The lights running just underneath the metallic surface turned green briefly and there was a strange prickle all over her skin. Her mind was telling her it was a familiar feeling even though she had never experienced before. "It is now. Let's go!"

Everything was so futuristic. The car that the Lancasters stepped into was completely self-run, leaving them to talk about their plans for the day as it whirred to life and took them out of their garage and onto the road. It was roomy enough to look like a small train car, with a navigational panel in the front that gave them their route, destination, weather and news, and approximate time of arrival. Even the large windows that Sarah looked out of had an option for some sort of "augmented reality" display. She played with it a bit while her parents talked, and learned that she had a near-instant directory of her neighborhood. She could watch herself traversing a map of her own village in real time. It was really quite cool.

Once they sped out of their neighborhood, they came upon a place that looked a bit like a train station. The front of the Lancaster's car magnetically locked with the back of the car in front of them, and there they waited for a moment as other cars attached to theirs or whirred to a stop in a side lot. People got out of those cars and joined the newly-formed train; a couple of people even wandered into their car, gave a polite greeting, and played with the augmented reality display in their windows. Some part of Sarah recognized them, but she couldn't for the life of her remember their names.

They only waited a few minutes before the 'train' of interlocked cars started moving. They were quickly whisked away from the village, into a beautifully-maintained buffer zone between their village and the place where the megas lived. Miles of forest gave way to fields, then rolling hills that looked increasingly deserted. Then, finally, the train came to the city of the megas around a bend.
It was hard to know what she was looking at, at first. Gigantic skyscrapers stabbed the clouds some distance away from the tracks they were on. Even though Sarah could see them, they appeared to be at least a mile away on either side. They were either incredibly huge or her ID was allowing her to see things in a way she wouldn't normally be able to. Each building seemed to stretch on forever; it took her five minutes to run the length of one, even at their incredible speed. Sarah looked at the map, and it told her that this one of the mega's houses. Privacy protocol wouldn't let her know who owned it, though.

Sarah's mind whirled; she had been struggling with the idea of creatures so big, let alone the idea of interacting with them on a regular basis, and each new piece of information forced her to re-adjust her ideas. It seemed every time she started to get a handle on how immense they were, she was being told by her environment that these beings were bigger still. How would she react when she finally saw Avery and his friends? Would she simply go into shock? Would some part of her brain take over in her stead, the part that found this completely normal?

The sky darkened considerably, quickly. It was enough to snap her out of her revelrie just in time for her view of the mega-skyscrapers to be replaced with a wall of waving white fur. It landed with a cataclysmic impact, the ground rolling like a wave away from it until it came to the train. It hit a forcefield and passed underneath with minimal effect. It just felt like Sarah's stomach dropped several inches. She shrieked.

All of the faces in her car turned to look at her. Her mother merely chuckled. "Excited to see Timothy, aren't you? He wanted to surprise you by meeting the train." She looked back at Sarah with a broad grin. "Don't be shy, you can wave in front of your parents."

Sarah felt her cheeks warming, though she wasn't entirely sure why. She looked out of the window and was met with the single biggest foot she had ever seen. It looked like a rabbit's foot, broadened out to fit a bipedal stance, and was immense -- even in proportion to the body on top of it. It rose like a great cliff for what looked to be thousands of feet, leading up to an ankle that stretched even higher and a great mountain of a calf even higher than that. She could barely see the knee from where she was sitting, and even that looked hazy with distance. The size of this thing was...unthinkable. Not knowing what else to do, she waved.

To Sarah's surprise, a hand came down from the sky, filling the rest of her upwards horizon. It waggled its fingers, and both of her parents laughed.

"Tim's such a sweetheart," her mother said.

The gigantic rabbit stepped beside the train as it rode into what looked like an enormous artificial hill. The car tilted back as it seemed to climb the tracks at a fairly steep, fast grade. Sarah realized that she was almost to her destination, and that once the car stopped it would disconnect and be carried (carried!) by Avery over to their meeting area.

It felt like Sarah's stomach never recovered from that first big jolt. Faced with the reality of meeting these impossibly-sized creatures, she started to panic. What in the world was she doing here? When and how would she get back home? Whose....whose strange life *was* this? She didn't have time to think about this much before...
125311.title: ..brother!

choices: "No, I think I'll skip breakfast. Go on without me."
1253111.content:
Sarah's mind was still twirling when they entered the station. Several of the people who had joined them before got out and milled around, meeting other people from other villages who commuted in to interact with these titans. After hugs and pleasantries were exchanged, they filed into different cars. A shadow passed, a wall of fur descended, and one by one the cars disappeared. Each time Sarah felt like screaming. The only thing that kept her from doing so was how normally everyone treated this. Her parents chatted peaceably at each other, making their plans for the rest of the day.

A shadow passed over their car. The ID on Sarah's wrist activated, giving her a heads up display that included a video feed of what was happening outside of her car and information about the titans that had made it to the platform. She had no idea what camera could be so far away to take in all of the multi-mile horse and rabbit, nor so powerful that she could still see her own car and its platform between the two mountainous animals. Whatever it was, the technology had to have been far beyond anything she had experienced.

To the left of the platform was the gigantic rabbit that had followed her car from the titan's metropolis to this much more relaxed mountain range. He was listed as Timothy Hutch. He was a white rabbit Mega, apparently, and his full height and weight were listed by the heads-up display: 7 miles, 23.37 billion tons. It was difficult for Sarah to even wrap her brain around that number. Billions of tons. And it was just outside of her car, peering down at her. She had never felt so small and helpless before.

Next to him was Avery. He was a black horse with a white stripe of fur bisecting his long head between the eyes. He was noticeably taller than Timothy and a great deal wider as well. The rabbit barely came up to his shoulder and looked to be only half his width. Even if the horse had been her height, she would have found him an incredible physical specimen. As it was, he was nothing short of deific. The heads-up display gave his stats, too. Her brother was 8.5 miles tall and weighed 62.78 billion tons.

Timothy reached for the car that was little more than a spec to either of them, but Avery nudged the rabbit's paw aside. The mega-horse had rather thick fetlocks covering his wrist and forearm, and it looked like an entire forest of white fur had descended around them. Sarah looked out the window, but she couldn't see much more than that. She returned to the video feed hovering in the air in front of her.

The rabbit was looking up at Avery with an expression of confusion and annoyance. "I'd really like to take Sarah to breakfast." His voice sounded surprisingly normal considering how large he was, but the rumble of it still shook the miniscule car they were in.

"I know, dude, but they're my family. I'll take them." Avery's voice was deep and booming -- nothing like the way she remembered her brother. He took up the car without another word, and the Lancasters felt themselves rising a few miles in a very short amount of time. Sarah assumed there must be inertial dampeners or something in the car; they would have been flattened to the floor otherwise.

The view outside the window changed rapidly. At first, there was only the platform -- then there was a field of blue denim that Sarah recognized as Avery's overalls. That switched to the horse's immense chest once they got high enough, then a brief view of a bullishly thick neck, then an immense horse's snout. Finally, a deep, dark brown eye that looked like it could be the size of the moon peered in at them. It blinked, and Sarah could feel the rush of air from the movement rock the car gently.

"Morning, fam," Avery boomed. The rumble from his voice was much stronger now, shaking everything around. "Ready for breakfast? I know Sarah's got a bit test today, so we'll have to be quick." The eye crinkled, and on the video display she could see her brother smiling at them. Without another word he turned and went for the shorn mountain-top that doubled as a table for these two. Sarah saw that Timothy remained where he was through the video feed. A shadow passed over the rabbit's face, and he stared at the retreating form of the horse.

Avery turned to look at the rabbit over one broad shoulder. "You coming, dude? We don't have a lot of time."

Tim responded...
1253111.title: The Pick-Up

choices: She decides to take Avery's hand.
She decides to take Tim's hand.
12531111.content:
Sarah watched in rapt fascination as a multitude of emotions crossed over the rabbit's face. She was a bit surprised that she was able to recognize so much in him, just from the twitch of an ear or the flick of a whisker. She knew that Timothy was annoyed, and then memories that weren't hers told her that he really didn't like her brother. They had conversations about this -- fights, even. It made her shiver to remember her standing on a cliff-side, the storm whipping her hair as she screamed up at a titan miles away. What's worse, he was yelling back, bits of rock falling from the mountain underneath her simply from the volume of his voice. She remembered what he looked like -- ears flattened, teeth bared. Instead of feeling afraid, she remembered being angry and frustrated. It was odd -- she really would have been scared shitless.

Unconsciously, she looked away from the video feed and hugged her arms against herself. Her mother noticed. "Are you all right, dear?"

Sarah nodded, forcing herself to smile. "Oh, I'm fine. Just thinking about this test."

Rory chuckled. "You always were a worrier. But you've studied hard and you're a smart girl. You'll pass this with no problem."

Once she started the conversation, she found it easy to continue. "Mom, it's not just any test. It's a mid-term. Passing with a B is not an option. I'll need nothing less than an A to keep up my GPA."

Philip leaned over and touched her leg. "I know how much this means to you, my girl. But you can't let yourself get worked up over it. You get nervous, you get tight. And if you get tight..."

"...you aren't flexible enough to see the answer around the problem." Sarah remembered that her father always told her this when she worried; it was one of those things that seemed constant from her world to this one. She had two versions of the same memory fighting for dominance in her brain -- in one, Avery was on her dad's knee while he comforted them, and in another, they were all in the vast black plain of Avery's palm. It was a strange feeling, having these memories called up from a life she didn't have. She didn't know if she would ever get used to it.

She smiled, a more genuine one this time, and squeezed her father's hand with her own. "Thanks, Dad. I just....veterinary medicine is a super-competitive field these days."

Her parents looked at each other and chuckled. "Don't we know it. Everyone wants to be the first to crack the secret of the mega-sapiens." Philip shook his head. "Well, if anyone's going to do it, it's going to be you."

Sarah felt a flush of pride and gratitude. No matter what she wanted to do, her parents had her back every step of the way. They were two of the most unselfish, long-suffering people she had ever known, and the made sure she and Avery had a good life no matter what happened. The fact that her brother was a horse the size of a small city brought immense challenges for them, but they had all faced them gladly. Other people weren't so lucky -- like Tim, whose parents abandoned him the moment they saw what he was.

The structure they were in landed on the mountain top, a soft bump indicating that Avery had rolled them to the surface and it was safe to get out now. "Sorry about the rough landing, everybody," he said. Sarah felt her ID chirp and a forcefield protected her from the soundquake of her brother's voice. It still made her knees weak. "Still getting the hang of making sure I'm as gentle as I need to be. You can come on out now."

"That's why I wanted to carry them. I've got a much lighter touch than you do and I aced my Human Interaction classes." The only slightly less booming voice of Tim rattled the Lancasters as they stepped out of the vehicle. Sarah was the last to leave, and for a moment she was blinded as the sun streamed in around her parents.

"I know you did, Tim, you won't let me forget about it. Still, how am I going to learn if I don't get in some practice, dude?" Avery sounded friendly enough, but she knew it was just a show for her parents' benefit -- and hers. Tim didn't like her brother, but Avery liked the rabbit even less.

"That's true enough, I suppose." The rabbit relented, but she guessed it was only because he wanted to focus on better things.

When her vision cleared, she saw a site that should have made her insane. Filling her vision were two unspeakably immense beings, hazy with vision yet blocking her view of the entire sky before them. They were so big that the mountain top made a cozy "table" for them, even though it spread out for miles in front of her. Avery was dressed in a pair of blue overalls that strained around his incredible bulk, and his hands were the relative size of bricks -- incredibly, it looked like the stallion was still growing into his own body. Next to him, Timothy was noticeably thinner but still quite well-toned. He looked like he was still growing, too.

When the rabbit saw her, he leaned down until his face was all any of them could see. Then his nose, and then his chin. One immense paw gripped the size of the mountaintop, creating and earthquake that made them all sway on their feet. "Sarah!" he chirped, his whiskers bobbing with excitement. "It's so good to see you. How've you been? A pleasure, as always, Mr. and Mrs. Lancaster."

Rory and Philip both nodded to the mega-rabbit and smiled happily. "Great to see you too, Tim. We're all fine here."

They all sat down to breakfast. The Lancasters were seated at a permanent table that had been carved out of bedrock and fitted with a display that worked quite well with their IDs. Both Avery and Tim sat cross-legged in the valley next to the mountain, filling it with their bulk. They spoke about safe things -- classes and plans for the semester, news that any of them had heard from the outside world. Their small community was still seeking representation in Congress, but it would be another ten years or so before DC was deemed safe for a visit by a Mega.

Sarah had eggs, toast and orange juice. All of it was fresh, grown right her in the community. One part of her had never had a breakfast so good, while another thought the eggs could have used some salt. Avery had a nutrient bar made of oats, barley and honey. Timothy had one made of blueberries and alfalfa hay. She knew that they both had digestive systems that were as blended between human and animal DNA as their appearance was. They could eat meat, but neither of them really liked to.

At last, the plates were scraped, the coffee was drained and everyone was standing up to begin their day. Timothy, of course, asked to carry Sarah to classes, but Avery quickly stepped up to ask as well -- for more practice, he said. The look on both faces told her that they had something on their minds to talk to her about.

"We'll let you handle this one, Sarah." Philip clapped a hand on her shoulder while Rory hugged her. "You have a good day now. All of you."

"We will," Avery and Timothy rumbled. Then they both looked at Sarah.

She shuffled her feet uncomfortably -- she hated being stuck in the middle like this. Avery usually didn't want her undivided attention unless it was really important, while...well, Tim probably just needed to be in the company of someone who loved him. Seeing Sarah with her family always made him a bit wistful, a bit clingy. She sympathized with the ache he must have felt, that pang of belonging. Maybe her boyfriend needed her a bit more than her brother right now.
12531111.title: The Lancaster Family Breakfast -- With Tim

125311111.content:
Sarah looked up at Tim and smiled as brightly as she could. "Bun, Avery really could use the practice handling little old me. Mind if he takes me to school today? I'll meet you in the Quad for lunch."

Tim's ears dipped but he managed a smile. Sarah knew that he was taking this like a personal rejection, and they would need to talk this out through the rest of the day. She sighed inwardly, but accepted that as the way things were going to go. If there was something her brother needed to tell her, then she would do her best to listen.

"All right," the Rabbit said. "Take good care of her, Avery." He was trying to be gracious, but Sarah could detect the sadness in his voice.

"Dude, she's my sister. Of course I'll take good care of her." Avery, for his part, couldn't keep the annoyance out of his booming rumble. Sarah winced, but she understood why he responded the way he did. If this were allowed to continue, she thought, it very well might come to blows one of these days.

Timothy, for his part, didn't respond to the challenge. He simply took one last look at Sarah and thundered away. His long strides took him over the horizon rather quickly, his impossible form growing hazy with distance by the time he stepped twice. A third one was accompanied by a distant thump, and then he disappeared from view.

She couldn't imagine what it must be like to live in a world where you were so large you could test the laws of physics. Nothing that big should be able to exist -- at least in the way that it does -- without serious issues to contend with. Yet, here was Avery and Timothy, both impossible creatures that the world was forced to deal with. Just the thought of them took her breath away, but seeing them so close was something else entirely. She hesitated as she approached her brother's building-dwarfing fingers, the tips pressed against the cliff face as tightly as he could make them without chipping rock away.

"Come on, sis," the horse thundered. "We don't have all day. You don't want to be late for your class now, do you?" Her brother's long equine face was a little harder to read, but she could tell from his expression that he was trying to keep the mood light.

She shimmied onto the enormous hand as quickly as she could, her body taking over with a surprisingly strong muscle memory. She had done this thousands of time, she suddenly remembered. It was no big deal. Never mind the fact that she's in the hand of a six-mile-tall horse, or that one twitch or spread of her fingers and she would be plummeting miles down to the ground. That wasn't a big deal at all.

Avery rose up to his full height and peered down at Sarah to make sure she was secure. She knew that he had an ID as well, that automatically detected for life forms in his vicinity and magnified his range of vision to focus in on them automatically. Without them, he wouldn't be able to see the mite-sized people he shared this community with, and he'd be even more dangerous than he was now. It stung her a bit to think of her brother as a danger to life in the community, but with his size it was absolutely undeniable. He could erase entire city blocks with one step from a hoof.

They walked in silence for a little while, with Avery glancing at her every now and again. She could tell that he wanted to talk to her, but he hadn't yet worked up the courage to do so. That was OK. He would speak up in his own time. For the moment, that gave her time to get used to the extraordinary thoom of his hooves and the continuous thundering of his breaths.

He didn't speak until they were nearly at the university, and then he stopped. He took a deep breath and sighed. To Sarah, it looked like his chest was an expanding storm cloud, solid shiny black framed against a blue sky. When he exhaled, his breath smelled of sweetgrasses and fruit. If he were any closer to small buildings, the force of it would have sheared them right out of the bedrock.

"Sarah," he began, then took another deep breath. "I...I don't think this is my life."

She blinked at that. "What do you mean?"

"I mean, I'm...not supposed to be like this. Like, a giant horse I mean. I wasn't like this when I went to bed last night."

Her heart skipped a beat. Avery must have seen her go pale, because suddenly she was lifted closer to the colossal horse's face. "Are you all right down there?" He sounded genuinely concerned.

"No, no it's fine. I...don't think this is my life either."

Avery whinnied in surprise. His ears flicked and he looked apologetic for a moment or two. "Sorry. Are you saying what I think you're saying?"

"That yesterday you were just my bratty younger brother and we lived in a normal world without giant animals running around all over the place?"

Avery laughed at that. "Yeah, exactly." He breathed a heavy sigh of relief. "Aw man, thank goodness I'm not the only one. I thought I was going crazy."

Sarah brightened and sat up in the giant horse's palm. "With the two sets of memories?"

"Yeah, like two versions of the same thing. In one I'm always in the house with you and Mom and Dad. And in the other, I'm just like...this. You have no idea how weird it is being this big. It's...it's really scary, Sare."

Her heart immediately leapt for her brother. She hadn't even considered what it must be like for someone to go from normal to a city-sized horse. Just changing to another species would be difficult enough. Adding impossible size to it would have to be...a strain to the psyche.

"I know, Avery, I can't imagine what you're going through. Listen...I don't know what's going on exactly, but if it's happened to us it must have happened to other people. I'll...try to find out if there's anything going on. If I hear anything, I'll let you know. You'll do the same for me, right?"

Avery smiled, broad flat teeth bigger than buildings gleaming down at her. "Of course! Aw man, Sarah, I can't tell you how relieved I am. I'm really glad I talked to you."

She smiled broadly and patted the plain of his palm below her. "I am too. Now, we should get to class before we're both late."

Avery thundered over to the drop-off point and let Sarah go there. She scampered away to classes quickly, her mind reeling with both the pressure of her mid-term and her conversation with her brother. What was going on here? Surely there was some sort of...consciousness transfer.

She shook her head and found her way to her first class. This test would need her full concentration. Even if she was in some alternate, strange reality, she would need to give this her full attention.
125311111.title: A Surprising Admission

12532.content:
You awake to find yourself in a luxurious bed with crisp white sheets upon a pearly-white marble plateau. There's an oak walk-in wardrobe off to the side with enough space to occupy your entire bedroom as you remember it and a marble-walled box of some kind leads off from that. A set of mahogany shelves stands opposite your bed stocked full of hardback books, the kind you see in the private libraries and studies of stately homes. Finally the bedside table holds a most elegant reading lamp and, curiously enough, a fresh cup of tea. Someone left you a drink that would have to be drunk within minutes and so must've known you'd wake soon. Taking the saucer in your hand you marvel at the fine china with the characteristic blue pattern associated with the Ming dynasty. You take a cautious sip; it's perfect, everything about it is just the way you like it. Still you have to wonder what happened. There are no walls you can see nor any other features beyond the furnishings that are specifically set around your bed. How can this be your bedroom?

You finish the tea and put the cup and saucer down on the bedside table before getting up, deciding to check if any of those books will give you an idea. You browse over the titles: The Divine Authority, A History of the World, The Laws of the Universe, Civilisation: A Guide to Human Life, Animals and Anthros: Spot the Difference, you stop when you come across a more familiar title in this lot; Precious Memories. You take this book off the shelf and sit in an easy-chair you don't recall seeing earlier and confirm that it's a family album. The photos are stunning.

First you find a couple of anthropomorphic animals cradling a smaller equivalent; you identify the species as fox, raccoon and the baby's a dog of some kind. The second picture shows a single female anthro bouncing a young male on her knee, both are rabbits. The third shows you as a toddler standing in the middle of a golden forest... or is it a field?

It's bewildering why you've got a photo album full of furries and of you standing on oddly-coloured plains and in oddly-coloured fields or forests. One thing's for sure those anthros sure are beautiful; every one of them, male and female, possess powerful charisma that would make even the most ardent heterosexuals and homosexuals take a bisexual stance. However you find yourself completely incapable of tolerating any real romantic feelings for these beings. Suddenly you hear a magnificent voice addressing you from up above.

"I know how much those memories mean to you." It says. "But it's high time you got ready for the day." You close the book and put it back before it's even registered that you can't find the will to disobey that voice. Looking round you discover that your bed's already made.

"Uhh, where are you?" You ask, prompting the angelic voice to giggle before answering.

"Up here, silly mortal." You look up and are blown away by the sight of a gorgeous mink anthro looking down at you. She was immense! In the distance you can see her fingers resting upon the plateau, they must've been at least a mile thick.
12532.title: A Family of Gods

125322.content:
You are gently roused from your sleep by an unknown force, and receive a shock when your surroundings are, instead of being your bedroom, a cross between the insides of a temple and a palace. Your are lying in a four-poster bed, the sheets of which are a deep purple colour, and the frame is constructed out of a dark wood, which you guess to be mahogany, and has been inlaid with gold.

You draw the curtain of your bed and your attention is immediately drawn to your surroundings. An elegant table is positioned to the left of your bed, formed out of an upturned marble pyramid, with a spiral carved into it, inlaid with gold and supported by a blue crystal frame. Resting on top of it is a small clock made of brass, hundreds of tiny gears visible on its surface, constantly rotating this way and that.

You turn your attention to the rest of the room. The walls are constructed out of a whitewashed marble and several alcoves have been built into the walls to hold decorative items like small urns and the occasional manuscript displaying what appeared to be hieroglyphs. You see a bookcase built out of the same wood as your bed and reluctantly step onto the semi-cold marble floor and approach it.

You begin to browse the titles displayed on the spines of the various books, but none are recognisable. Many seems to be religious in nature, but do not belong to any religion you have ever heard of. You pull a faux-leather-bound book entitled 'Anthros, Animals, And Proper Worship' out of the bookcase and examine it.

The front cover has a simple depiction of a pawpad on it, while the back has two Vetruvian man-esque diagrams of a human and what seems to be an anthropomorphic fox, as well as a normal fox, all three arranged in a triangle, with lines reaching out from each of them to the other two. Puzzled, you slide the book back into place and notice one called 'To My Brother And High Priest'.

You retrieve it from the case and flip it open, and realise it is a photo album of sorts. A note falls out and you bend down to retrieve it.
It reads,
'To my brother and high priest,
I know you often long for the past, and experience a great deal of nostalgia. Me and your other sisters have compiled this book for you so that you may indulge in whatever happy memories you desire, as we know you are also under a lot of stress due to your duties. Your Sister and goddess,
Lily.

You weren't really sure of what to make of that note. You had a goddess as a sister? And you were her high priest, as well? You slip the note back into the book and begin to leaf through it, until you come across a picture that truly stuns you.

Five figures, wrapped in swaddling cloths. Two anthro dragons, one pure gold, the other white as silver with a gold underbelly. One anthro horse, with chestnut brown fur, and sparkling blue eyes. One anthro dolphin, her skin as grey as a stormcloud. And finally, an anthro vixen, her red fur contrasting with her black hands, which were eagerly grasping the air.

And you, in the background, a toddler, beaming at your sisters.

You set the book down on the table, stunned and slightly shaken. You attempt to gather your thoughts but you are interrupted when a loud but gentle and kind voice, seemingly coming from nowhere, says to you,

"Brother? Are you alright?"
125322.title: A Gentle Awakening

1253221.content:
"Who's there? Who are you? Show yourself!" You nearly shout, almost hysterical at this point. You were in an unfamiliar location, there were anthro animals being worshipped as gods, and now a voice was talking to you out of nowhere, as there was definitely no PA system here.

"Oh no...Brother, do not remember who I am?" the voice asks in a concerned voice. "Do you not remember your sisters? Do you even remember who you are?" By this point you have curled yourself into a ball, unable to face the barrage of existential questions, and are only able to utter a single word to answer this beings questions.

"No..."

"Oh, brother...Don't worry, it'll be okay..." The voice reassures you, and you feel a warmth spreading throughout your body, replacing the dread that had permeated within you just seconds ago. There was just one problem, though: you still didn't know who this person was. "If you don't mind me asking...Who are you?" You slowly ask.

"I knew this would come up sooner or later...Alright, brother, hold on!" You close your eyes as you feel and hear an immense wind rushing past you before stopping. "You know, brother, you can open your eyes now." The voice teases slightly. You do as it instructs and find yourself in what appears to be an immense forest of... Red hair follicles.

"This still doesn't tell me who you are." You say, bluntly. "Alright, brother, have patience..." the voice replies, and you find yourself zooming backwards, until you have a full view of...

"Hello, brother!" The very busty, ten thousand mile tall anthro vixen says in a gentle, yet overjoyed voice. Seeing your non-comprehension, she begins to explain, "I'm the goddess Misha...And, uh, your little sister..." The last bit she says with a touch of embarrassment, blushing slightly. "Well, technically, we're all your little sisters. Me and the other goddesses, that is."

Wow...You, the big brother to a pantheon of goddesses? That was...Unexpected, to be sure. Before you can really think about this, Misha draws you back in to her palm from where she was suspending you in midair, and announces, "I think we should see our other sisters and tell them what has happened...Let's go and see..."
1253221.title: Amnesiac Acclimatisation

12532212.content:
The air around you and Misha ripples, and you suddenly find yourself hovering over a vast ocean, safe in Misha's palm. She lets out a cry of "Aquaria!" and a titanic dolphin anthro larger even than her, begins to rise out of the sea.

"Hi, Misha! I didn't expect to see you so early!" Aquaria says in a casual manner, and upon seeing you, lets out a small clicking noise. "Hi, bro! Uh, are you alright? Misha used telepathy to tell me what happened..." "I just lost my memory, nothing else happened." "Well, if you're sure, bro...Anyway, I have to get back to my 'goddessly duties', so I guess I'll see you two later."

And with that, Aquaria descends below the waves again. Misha seems to be thinking, and says, "Now that we've talked to Aquaria, we can go and speak with...
12532212.title: Aquaria.

12533222.content: Praetorian Guard: You are an emperor, and like any self-respecting emperor, have an elite unit of bodyguards to protect you. Of course, these bodyguards quickly turn out to be humongous anthros that tower over literally everything else. Still, they're devoted soldiers that follow your every command, and given their size alone, it's unlikely that anyone who would want to so you harm would be able to get anywhere near you.
12533222.title: Other

125332221.content:
Your eyes suddenly flick open, your body lying completely still. Seeing only darkness, you look to your left and to your right, but find yourself unable to see through the blackness. Turning your thoughts to what you were laying on, you flip yourself over and gaze at the surface.

The surface in question radiated a powerful warmth, and seemed to be grey - although that may have been due to the lack of light. A small carpet of fur also covered the surface, tickling you slightly when you later down. Looking at your body, you find yourself wearing what seems to be a set of silk pajamas of some kind - the almost total lack of light made it difficult to make out anything more than a few inches in front of your face.

Deciding that you were most likely experiencing a strange and unusually vivid dream, you lay on your back and close your eyes, waiting for yourself to fall 'asleep' again and wake up.

As you feel yourself fading into unconsciousness again, you dimly register two voices from up above, talking to each other.

"Hold on, I felt him move just then- no, he's falling asleep again. Are you ready to take him?"

"Yes, I am. Hand him over, and quickly. We don't want him waking up, so late at night. It'd impact him in the morning."

You can feel yourself leaving the surface you were on, before being placed on one almost exactly like it. Your eyes were still closed, but you could feel that the hair - or fur - on it was slightly longer.

"There we go. Your shift's over, now. I'd advise you to go and get some sleep, like our dear emperor is doing, as you can see."

"I think I might just do that. I am loyal to the emperor, and I love serving him, but it can still be tiring, from time to time."

"I'll see you tomorrow."

"Likewise."
125332221.title: Praetorian

125332222.content:
Similar to Club Anthro.

You are the owner of an Anthro Strip Club known as The Den that caters to human patrons. Every night thousands of individuals come to see the dancers and at the same time line your pockets. There are currently 2 other clubs like this in the entire world and none of them are even on your continent. It could be considered a lucky break or even fate that you came in possession of this club.

You'd just moved into the city. After finishing college and winning the lottery you set out to start a business. As you walked around the city you say the Club being put up for auction after a foreclosure. Anthros only made up a very small percentage of the world's population so finding work was very difficult. The main bidder planned to turn the fairly large building into a factory and put all the girls out on the street. Feeling a pang of conscience you outbid the man and bought the club with the intention of keeping it open. Needless to say the girls were very very grateful.
125332222.title: The Den

1253322221.content:
As you awoke from a deep slumber you began to wonder why you felt terrible. There was a pain coming from the base of your neck and you felt like you hadn't gotten any rest at all not to mention that super weird dream. Opening your eyes you realized all these feeling were completely normal since you apparently fell asleep at a desk. The desk was filled with papers arranged in several stacks. After looking at a few of the papers you realized you were the owner of a business and not just any business. You owned a very successful strip club. As you shook of your tiredness you remembered you purchased the club a few months back to save it from closing. The girls that worked here were very grateful that you saved them from the horrors of unemployment. They were grateful enough that a few of them showed some... Interest in you. If you owned a strip club then where were all the girls... A knock at your office door stopped your train of thought.

"Boss, It's almost time to open. When are you coming out?"

Well that answered that question and looking at the clock you saw it was indeed near 10 o'clock PM. Man you must have been tired to have slept that long. Getting up from your desk and walking to the door you wondered what did the girls under your employ even looked like since for some reason you couldn't remember. Opening the door you were met with the shock of your life when you saw that the door opened onto a balcony. Your office was built into a very large wall and standing in front of it was a anthro horse. The horse or mare since it was female had to been dozens of miles tall and was wearing a very revealing outfit. She was smiling down at you and said "So are we ready to open Boss? Oh and after my shift ends I be sure to give you a private dance." She then gave you a wink and seductively walked off her hooves creating booming sounds leaving you in complete shock.
1253322221.title: One of those days

choices: And they said you were Mad!!!!!!
1253322222.content: You are a Mad Scientist...metaphorically speaking. You weren't insane but most of the scientific community labeled you as such. Have one unique idea and suddenly people expect you to live in a castle and have a servant called Igor. After graduating at the top of your class in the world's most prestigious scientific university you began to dabble a bit in genetics. Specifically splicing the DNA of animals and humans. Originally you wanted to create a super pet that was more intelligent and human like so you could make a fortune. As the years went by and you became more absorbed in your work it became much more than that.
1253322222.title: Mad Science

12533222221.content:
Beep Beep Beep Beep

You opened your eyes to the sound of the blaring alarm clock. Shutting it off you climbed out of bed and wiped the sleep from your eyes. That was a weird dream you had last night. You barely even remembered what it was about but that doesn't matter now. Not when you are so close...Getting up and walking over to your closet you so you could put on some clothes and get to work. You opened your closet and were greeted by the mirror on the door's inside. Apparently you stay up so long working that you fell asleep in your work clothes...again. You were glad no was around to see this and closed the closet. You then left you room and entered your laboratory.

Your lab was quite simply huge. It was an old aircraft hanger for Nuclear B-52s hidden in the mountains. After the fall of the Soviet Union this place fell into disuse and was put up for public auction a few years ago. There weren't many bidders and you could use a place like this so you bought it. Despite your young age you were very intelligent and gained a lot of money through your scientific exploits. A place of this size was perfect for the project you were working on. Speaking of which you turned to the pods containing your 'daughters'.

Taking up one entire side of the hangar were 3 giant pods filled with a green liquid. Floating inside them were your daughters. You created them after splicing animal DNA with humans. You admit you had a fascination with the story The Island of Dr. Moreau. Unfortunately there was a slight mutation and they began to grow out of control. They final stabilized at you guessed about a 1500 feet in height. You'd been educating them through on of your inventions. It allowed you to speak directly with their minds through the various wire providing them life support. They'd already been informed of your relationship with them and their vast height difference with the rest of the world. They had expressed joy at having a father but were understandably upset at their appearance and size which would certainly make having friendly relationships significantly harder.

In the first pod was Marie. She was a grey furred cat. She asserted herself as leader of the group given how she spoke with the others and the amount of respect and admiration they had for her. She was also a scientist after your own heart. You think it might be her instinctual curiosity giving her such and interest in science. You would have long conversations throughout the night and she'd offer a good second opinion on some of your work. You looked forward to working with her in the future.

In the second pod was Anna. She was a German Shepard and unlike her quieter sisters she was loud and quick. That didn't mean she was an less intelligent. Sometimes when you and Marie would try to find an answer to a particularly hard question she'd come in and tell you the solution. Like Marie she was slightly interested in science but admitted paleontology was more her speed. Marie then mentioned something about Dogs & Bones and you swore you could see the dog girl floating in the pod blush.

The last pod contained Clara. Clara was a brown furred dairy cow. She was more interested in medicine and humanitarian work then science. You encouraged her to follow her dreams like your father encouraged you. She was glad that you supported her and couldn't wait to bring food and medicine to the needy. You hate to admit it but once when she mentioned the word 'nourishment' your eyes wandered to the large... assets were currently pressed up against the glass. You could tell that was definitely the Cow DNA at work. Since humans didn't have udders her body improvised. You didn't think it was possible for a female to support breasts that large without them either sagging or causing back pains. Her spine had adapted and was much thicker than a regular human one so she'd have no problems there & they didn't sag in the slightest. On the bright side she could provide milk to a lot of... No Bad Brain.

You went over to the computer console in front of the pods to see if everything was ready. Yes. Today was the day. You felt a something push on your mind and you heard a female voice you recognized as Marie's say

"Is that you father? I trust everything is finally ready?!" she said with excitement.

"Yes it is sweetie. Everything is finally ready." You answered back.

The girls then began to stir happily in their pods. You've been growing them for over five years. Teaching, and caring for them. All of your hard work and sacrifice was finally going to pay off. They were going have to invent several new Nobel Prizes to award you. The money from that was definitely let the girls follow their dreams like you followed yours. Who knows. They might even be awarded Nobel Prizes too someday. Final preparations are now complete. You then hit the button that would finally awaken your daughters.
12533222221.title: And they said you were Mad!!!!!!

12533222222.title: Two More Ideas

125332222221.content:
You groggily wake up from your dream, wondering about how it was that everywhere you looked seemed to consist of some part of a gargantuan animal and yet you felt as though it was all familiar and safe. As you stirred you look around to find that there was something decidedly off about your bedroom; it seemed to be a lot bigger than before and there were windows everywhere. Eventually you realise that what you're looking at is effectively the entirety of the house you're in; it's all open plan! There's only one space where there was a distinct interior wall that you figured must be the bathroom but the rest of the top floor seemed to be dedicated to your bedroom with a number of other beds, presumably for visitors. No doors separate this area from the balcony overlooking the ground floor and, curiously enough, there are stairs at every corner. Once you summon up the willpower to rise you make your way out onto the balcony and look at the open space below you. There's another interior wall lining up a bit too well with the one on the first floor which, to your mind, must be the kitchen space. The rest of the space seemed to be a living room with the alcoves formed by various columns functioning as spaces for similar non-essential living space, such as a TV space or a library-type area.

Once you recover your clothes you make your way over to the walled-off portion of the top floor and open a surprisingly large door to find that there's not only a fairly spacious bathroom but also a separate space for dressing and even a wet room with a walk-in shower. As you do yourself up ready for the day you feel a number of steady tremors reverberate through the house, causing you to worry for a moment until you notice that these tremors are too rhythmic to be an earthquake. As you recall the rate of them as being reminiscent of footsteps you hear a familiar voice ring through the very foundations of the house while remaining at a polite and reasonable volume.

"Are you up yet?" That voice seems so familiar to you, there's something almost familial to it.

You are a...
125332222221.title: A New Morning

13.content:
(Here are some storyline starters)

Familiars: In this world, every human has an anthro partner, with which they spend their entire lives with. This is a bit of a fantasy story, as the human and anthro can do such things as heal each other, read each other's minds, etc.

The Lesser Sex: In this universe, either every single male is a mega-anthro if the main character is a girl, or every single female is a mega-anthro if the main character is a boy. The main character either has a mega sized boyfriend/girlfriend or husband/wife.

Neighbors: In this universe, mega-anthros and humans have managed to live together in complete harmony. Your house is next door to a mega-anthro families house, and your family and the mega-family are close neighbors and great friends

Passing Around Humanity: In this universe, there are two planet Earths, one much bigger than the other. You live on the small one, which the mega-anthros living on the larger Earth ceremoniously pass around every day so that every anthro can have humanity to keep at least once in their lives.
13.title: One Titan per Human

choices: continue the story if you want
131.content:
You were just waking up from a weird dream. It was fuzzy as your eyes lazily pulled apart. Rubbing the crust off it, you found yourself on a weird bed. You don't know why but if felt weird like a couch. It was too dark to see the color but you had a hunch it was white. Walking towards any direction, it took a full minute just to reach a wall. "Ok," you said with a eye raised. "What's going on," you said as you touch the wall. It was cold as metal as you pull your hand away surprised. "You're finally awake," a male voice boom.

Suddenly the sky got a lot darker as you felt immense weight around your side. Soon you found a giant eyeball probably 60 ft from bottom to top. You were in complete shock as the eye ball looked at you intensely when it suddenly blink in a fraction of a second. Something that big shouldn't move so fast.

"Awe not again," it boomed. "This is the third time this month...that blow to your head really messed you up man," he said as he pulled you away so you can see his full face. You can tell it's a wolf anthro, male too.

"Ok...let me work my magic," he said as he let you go to fall on his palm. Falling down, you landed with a soft plop with a bit of pain but nothing broken. "Sorry about that...keep on forgetting you can't survive without remembering what we learned as partners when we were kids. Holding on to the pink flesh of his palm, you and the wolf were at a table with a few steps of his colossal, padded feet.

Tilting his hand, you fell rolling down his palm towards the hard table. With a hard landing, you soon stood up in pain. "Sorry about that," he said as he stared towards his bare belly button before looking to his face. "To answer your question, I'm about two miles to you," he said as if he read your mind. The only thing in your mind was fear. And all these puzzling questions running through your mind. "Don't worry Mack, this won't hurt a bit," he said as the index finger of his right hand was falling towards you. Thinking he was going to skewer you with his long claw. You ran but it was futile as his finger landed softly but not enough to crack a rip.

"Wow dude....I ain't going to tick a claw into you or anything like that. We're best buds," those few words calmed you down as his finger glow blue. Comfort came all over your body as your brain starts to feel unlock. All types of memories seeped into you mind as you finally remember everything. Pulling his finger away, the wolf crouched down to see if his buddy is ok.

"Yeah-yeah...I'm ok," you said reading your friend Marty mind.

"Wow man...if you don't stop having amnesia I'm going to have to take you to the Doctor," he smiled cheerily.

"Yeah sure and you're paying the bill," you said as you rub the back of your head in pain. "Pick me up, we got to get ready for class, we just started collage you know," as your friends index finger and thumb gently picked you up. Letting go you fell towards his palm as you remembered how to slow down you decent with your psychic powers.

"By the way, we're suppose to be meeting the Alophidor sisters. That vixen has lust in her eyes when she just met you...I can tell," Marty smiled as he drop you off on the dresser table by your miniature dresser.

"And her human partner have the same thing," you laugh as you friend starts getting dress and you do too.

"Something tells me this is a good day," Marty says.

"I hope your ready ladies because two sexy studs are coming to start some trouble,' you said as both of you laugh in the moment of friendship.
131.title: Familiars

choices: you left him to be assualted by Veronica without a good comeback
needed a good pick up line for Holly but without your help he  blew it
1311.content:
It was early noon where you and your friend Marty were eating launch. Of course as partners you both shared the same food. His gigantic claw scraped a piece of meat bigger then you off his burger. While grabbing his straw and placed his thumb over the top. Pulling the straw out of the titanic beverage of soda. Marty placed it inches above you head while you sat up to take a drink.

You two were currently at one of the campuses cafes enjoying the time between classes. The last class was computer animations where both of you were passing with ease. You two worked together better then any partners in the gym. Marty's giant maw tore through his burger with a ravenous appetite. Sadly he wasn't a clean eater and had pieces of burger chunks fall around you. Even with your memories you were still in awe with this giant creature. It was a good thing you can block him from your thoughts or he'll get embarrassed.

Finishing up your lunch, Marty gave you more sip from his soda before drinking up the thousands of gallons of orange soda. After cleaning himself up, you did the same before he placed his hand by the edge of the table. Luckily you were close to the edge and walked over upon his hand. Giving you time to reach the middle, you sat down and watched as he lifted up. Turning around, you struggled to see past his titanic pillars of fingers. This time you made sure he can read this, thus moving his fingers apart.

Just before you two can leave the cafe. You spotted the Alophidor girls and yelled up to your wolf friend. Of course he was one step a head of you and was already walking towards the girls. Suddenly the giant platform under you rose or quickly but you already knew what he was planning. Tilting his hand, you ran down his palm not wanting to roll down and used a bit of your powers to slow you decent onto his shoulder. "Make a smooth entrance my bro and don't choke," you yelled up from your safe perch.

"Chill man...you should already know what I'm going to say," Marty whispered before taking a seat in front of the vixen Veronica and her human partner Holly. "Well hey girls...enjoying a lunch without us," Marty smiled as the girls giggled.

"Well apparently you had one without us...not very smooth for a man," Veronica retorted as Marty rolled his eyes.

"(And this is why we could never work)," Mart thought to himself.

"(Well stop grouching, Holly's waving towards you)," you sent your pal the message as he redirected his attention towards her. Making eye contact, he smiled as Veronica did the same to you while you simply waved.

"So...can we eat by ourselves or are you planning on missing your next class," Veronica said with venom towards your wolf pal. His shoulder suddenly shifted while you held on the the ring of his shirt. His large hand rose up as his head fitted softly on it.

"Oh really...we got time to stay here a bit," Marty smiled easily getting on Veronica's nerves. You now remember why the relationship between you and Veronica and Marty and Holly began. It was like yesterday when you and your brother like friend Marty entered the collage campus for the first time. After having your things settled in with a private dorm, both of you decided to go over to one of the cafes for something to eat.

Of course it was this same cafe where you laid your eyes on a large fox walking inches by Marty holding onto her human partner. You only had a glimpse of her but her eyes landed over you towards Marty. It was the same thing but in reverse where sneaked a look at Veronica while she eyed you without catching her until Marty told you. This all happened in a second before you and Marty kept on walking.

Amazingly, fate brought you and Marty to meet Veronica and Holly again at a party. You were placed at a coffee table where the humans can mingle by themselves. While all the titanic anthros act as a large background dancing and talking to themselves. You can only remind yourself that the scene was pretty loud. You and Holly got a chance to sit by yourselves and had sometime to talk.

Sadly it turned out that she had interests in only Marty. You were pretty crushed at the time and felt that Marty got both girls. But instead, this morning Marty revealed to you the giant vixen had interests in you other then Marty. What a weird combination but it was possible you thought when you snapped back to reality. Marty was stood up abrupt without you having a chance to brace yourself. You nearly rolled off his shoulder and with a panic you couldn't focus on stopping when Marty's hand fixed fell upon you lightly.

Moving his thumb and index finger upon you, you were lifted up where Marty's mad face filled your view. You are pretty nervous and couldn't help to smile when Marty assaulted you with many of his anger thoughts. This wasn't the first time where you left him on his own while you were unreachable in your own mind. Having a titanic wolf bare his fangs and scold you with his large predatory eyes is a scary experience but nonetheless a normal one for you.

If only you can figure out what was wrong...
1311.title: Lunch

choices: Yes, you are a brilliant friend, how could I turn you down?
13111.content:
"You left me with Veronica!" He scolded. That must've been a punishment to him.

"I thought you liked her!" You joked, Marty didn't seem to laugh, he bared his fangs at you again and placed you roughly on his shoulder, as he started to walk to class. You and him didn't speak for the rest of the walk, he seemed pretty angry with you. Well, you would be angry too, left alone with an angry vixen who seemed to hate the guts out of you.

"Sorry, Marty, but I was lost in thought!" You say appologetically, he seemed to ignore you and carry on, he should have forgiven you for this by now, or did he try to hit on Holly and mess up the line? Marty had noticed you thinking that and replied.

"Great you recognized it now, she thinks I am a weirdo." He seems really angry, pinning the blame on you. You were going to add a remark, but thought it wasn't a good idea. "You're the best person to have after an emergency, I mean sheesh man, you couldda gave me a line, you are better at chatting up humans, remember back in the days when we were at Secondary school (high school to you Americans)." Then you remembered back to those days.

You and Marty would go up to girls, you would chat up the human getting her to go along with you, then that would get the anthro for Marty, he always seemed pleased when you would do that, this usually got him the week-long-girlfriend, you could keep a relationship longer than that, but Marty would mess it up with the counterpart and make you lose your relationship, you always forgave Marty on this.

"I forgave you when you lost me Hannah!" You scold, he seems quite shocked and he knew that you would use one of the girls you would get as a reason.

"But man, this is the love of my life!" He replies, a pathetic reason, he would just break up with her in a week and he would forget all about her, Marty heard you thinking this time, note to self, remember to block Marty always! "I will keep this relationship, just give me a try." He uses this and gives his puppy-dog eyes, he knows that you can't refuse them, but was today an exception. You reply,
13111.title: His crush(es)

1312.content:
“He’s coming around doctor,” said a voice, and a small light enter into my darken world as I slowly opened my eyes, and I blinked in confusion has I found myself laying in a bed with a man shining a light at me, I notice that he was wearing a white lab coat, and wore small spectacles on his careworn face. “Where am I?” I asked looking around, I was in a hospital room, and it appeared to be early morning judging by the pale light that was filtering in through the window. I tried to get up, but a hand held me down again, and I turned my head to see a woman standing there with her hand on my shoulder, she was dressed in standard uniform of a nurse even the funny little white paper hat. “It’s alright, you just made a dimensional jump, your body needs a little more rest,” the doctor said as he wrote something down on a chart he was carrying, “A dimensional what?” I asked, wondering if this wasn’t a poor attempt at humor.

“A dimensional jump, the Immigration Board brought you here this morning,” the man said, all I could do was stare in disbelief, “they brought your partner as well, but she will need to stay here for another day, the jump was harder on her then it was on you,” the doctor said and then turned to the nurse, “let’s allow him to rest, we’ll check up on him later,” he said and the nurse nodded as they both left the room. “Dimensional jump? Immigration Board? Partner?” these words ran through my mind as I tried to make sense of them but failed as I listened to make sure they were gone, before making my move.

I slowly got up finding that I was dressed in my normal nightclothes of a T-shirt and sweat pants, and I make for the door slowly and opened it. I peek out to see that it lead into a hallway, I had to shut the door quickly as I saw another doctor turn the corner that was a little ways down the hall, and I waited till his footstep faded before opening the door again and stepping out. I slowly made my way down the seemly silent corridor just waiting for someone to raise an alarm of some sort, my worries cause me not to notice till it was to late a door opening and someone stepping out, and bumped into me. “Terribly sorry,” the young nurse I bumped said as I spun around, I stared as she straighten her dress before looking at me, I wonder if she was going to let out a cry, but instead she gave me a small smile and turned and slowly made her way down the hallway in the direction I had just come from.

I blinked in confusion as I continued; this place felt strange, something about it wasn’t quite right all I knew was I needed to escape, and I saw my way out, a stair way leading down that bore a sign over it reading, “emergency exit,” well this did seem like a emergency, so quickly I made my way down the stairs and push opened the door.

I had assumed that the door would lead me outside the building; instead my jaw fell to the floor as I saw were I was. It was a giant room, everything was enormous, and if I wasn’t mistake this room looks like a giant waiting room, with a long row of chairs that you could drive a semi-truck under at it wouldn’t even touch the bottom of the chair, “Where the heck am I?” I cried as I looked around the room. I could also see a desk were a two-story tall television stand, throughout the room I could see giant piles of old magazines, suddenly there came a thumping sound, and I felt the ground give a little shake, and I turned around toward the giant doorway as something came in.

My eyes threaten to pop out of my head as I saw the creature, it was a giant humanoid rabbit dressed in a, (and I couldn’t believe) nurse’s uniform. The rabbit had golden fur, and I could see a look of exhaustion on her (I figured it was female) face as she made her way across the room toward me, “Shoot,” I thought as I was forced to run for cover as the rabbit’s large feet nearly crushed me as she walked over to one of the chairs and sat down, “I’m going to drop dead in a minute,” I heard her groan as she sat back in her seat. I hide behind one of the chair’s legs that was across the way from this giant creature as I look between the giant door, and the one that almost looks like a mouse hole in comparison to the room, the one that lead back to the other hospital. I knew I couldn’t stay here, but I wondered were I should go, the big door probably lead to a giant version of a hospital, and probably filled with more of those giant creatures, and toward the little door lead back to those strange people, that is also when a strange idea creep across my mind, maybe I could get the rabbit to help me, although I have no idea what she would do to me if she caught me.

Well I got to move somewhere, so which one?
1312.title: other

choices: I wake up back among the humans
13121.content:
I made up my mind, and rushed for the large door, although I kept looking at the large rabbit wondering if she was going to notice me, but she seem too tried because she closed her eyes and sighed as she lean a little farther in the chair. I made it to the door, and walked out into a giant hallway, and realized that my original thought about this place was true, I saw giant creatures walking around, all of them like the rabbit walking on two legs, and dressed in clothes of different styles. I pressed myself against the wall as I watch these huge creatures that luckily seem unconcern about the tiny human that had enter their world.

“Where am I?” I said feeling my sense of reality breaking down as I slowly made my down the hall, although now wondering what I was going to do now, but my heart suddenly leapt as a voice suddenly boomed over the giant hall’s intercom, “attention all hospital staff, be on the lookout of a outsider human that had escape from the dimensional ward, he will be scared and confused, once found please bring him to the front desk of the ward, thank you,” almost instantly I could see creature turning their eyes downward toward the floor as they began to search for me.

Panic filled me as I now broke into a dead run although not having the slightest clue were I was going, “there he is!” I suddenly heard a cry and I look to see a giant bird dressed in a lab coat pointing with his long wing-arm at me as dozens of eyes turned toward me, and they started for me. I let out a cry as I ran blind avoid giant paws that all were making scoops at me, and without thinking I dive into one of the rooms, finding it to be the giant counterpart to the hospital room I had woken up in. I could hear the sound of the giant creatures getting close, and in a rash decision, I rushed over to the giant bed, and to my great fortune saw a rope hanging down, I look up and realized that the rope was actually a few stray stings for the material that made up the bed sheets. I quickly climb up onto the bed, and through a small hole in the cover.
I was now in pitch darkness, and I held my breath as I heard the room door open, and the sound of footsteps, “I was sure I saw him enter here,” a voice said, and looking through the small hole that I crawled it from to see two creature, one a lion who was scratching his mare as he looked around the room, the other I recognized as the rabbit from the waiting room. “Well, we better find him,” she said looking around as well, “poor thing, he must be terrify,” she said and I was surprised to hear genuine concern in her voice as they left the doorway.

I breathed a sigh of relief as I stepped back from the hole feeling confused but at the same time a little relaxed, although this was the first time I realized that it was kind of warm in here as I stepped back, but that is when I felt my back hit something that was soft and warm. “Uh oh,” I thought as I suddenly felt the thing I bumped move, and there came a low growling sound as I heard something in the darkness move, and in a heartbeat something grabbed me. I screamed as I felt myself being draw out back into the light, I found that I was now in a grip of a giant claw, and my eyes widen farther as I saw it was bring me in front of a giant face.

I nearly fainted as I saw the face of a dragon looking at me with a groggy look, the dragon’s scales were a slivery color, and I couldn’t help but notice that the dragon’s slim face held a very feminine aspect to it. “Where am I?” the dragon asked in a sweet voice, although at the moment I was too terrific to speak, I couldn’t even make a sound as the dragon became fully awake, and got to sitting position in the bed. She then looked down at me and noticed my expression, “Cain what’s wrong?” she asked, this was all too much for me, and I passed out.
13121.title: Awakening
