Before you knew what was going on the wall with the main window in it swung away, revealing an enormous pink eye looking in on you.

"Come on now, sweetie." You hear a familiar feminine voice coming from outside. "It's high-time you were up." You try to figure what's going on but, currently, you're not ready to defy someone who could just grab you out of your bed, so you throw your covers back and swing your legs out. "That wasn't so hard, was it." The immense individual remarked. "Now, I'll let you get ready but I'll be back in half-an-hour to pick you up." The eye moves away from the opening, a great landscape of grey fur flashes by before a mighty paw-like hand came into view, steadily pushing the wall back into place.

You get up and enter the bathroom, which isn't too hard to find. As you tidy yourself up you try to get to grips with what's going on. Okay, You muse, So I seem to be living in someone's dollhouse; they're absolutely massive but don't appear to think of me as a toy or a slave or something like that. Whoever it is they seem to be some kind of anthropomorphic animal and they're definitely female. As you prepare to brush your teeth a realisation hits you like a flash. Their voice is kinda like my mother's! You try to understand what this change means for everything else. Why is she so huge? Why is she an anthro? How will this affect your family life? Who else might've become a titanic anthro? It's so hard to understand just what it would mean for someone to have such a tiny...
1552.title: Wakey Wakey

15522.content:
You daintily walk back to the bedroom, still thinking about how your mother's eye could fill one wall. Wait a minute! You stop and think. My mum's eyes weren't pink. What exactly is she now? You step into the bedroom and look at the clock. It's difficult to say but you'd guess there's eight to ten minutes before you'll see your mother's new form. Swiftly you get dressed; your ensemble comprises of undergarments, a leaf-green skirt, a cream-coloured blouse and a beige jacket. You put on a pair of shiny black shoes with moderately-sized heels and begin to tie your hair back into a ponytail when you can feel the vibrations again.

You're more prepared for it this time. You turn to the window, curtains still closed, and watch as the wall it's in opens again. Mum's enormous eye returns and she says.

"Ready for breakfast, dear?" There's a tone of unease in you when she says this but, considering just how big she is, there would be no chance of avoiding her grasp. You slowly stand up straight and gingerly step towards her.

"As ready as I'll ever be." You squeeze out as you come up to the opening. Looking out you see your mother's an enormous...
15522.title: Mommy's Tiny Girl

155221.content:
You gaze out at the rolling furry landscape that seemed to be your mother. She was a mouse! I real anthropomorphic mouse bigger than anything you've ever seen before, except on TV. Looking up at her face you feel a mix of shock, awe and affection; her eyes were filled with familial compassion.

"Come along, then." She said, holding out her massive paw. "Don't want it to get cold." Her digits were a sight in themselves at such close proximity. By your estimate she must be, in miles, what she should've been in...
155221.title: How Vast?

1552212.content: It would seem that, where she used to be measured in feet and inches, from your perspective your mother could now measure herself in miles that same value that would be her original height in...
1552212.title: Inches?

15522121.content:
You recall that your mother was five foot ten, but now your mega-anthro rodent of a mother must've been seventy miles high. It was amazing to think that she was able to speak to you without shaking the walls of your bedroom with the power of her voice, and to think she could see your minute form all the way up there. With great care you step onto her middle finger, the pad absorbing the impact and you promptly land face-first when you lose your footing. You hear and feel your mother's giggle from this.

"Come on, honey." She states, "Don't kid about." As you pick yourself up she stands up straight and carries you off to the dining room. You sit upon the pad of her middle finger and look round in awe of the edifice that your mum calls home; it seemed to be a run-of-the-mill suburban-type residence but, from your perspective, it was a great temple to accommodate your god-like mummy. You figure that she could just scoop up any one of the largest cities as you've known them in one paw. You espy a couple of giant photos on the wall as you're carried through the house. You recognise the pink-eyed face of your mother but see two other anthros as well. It seems that you live in this house with at least three massive mammals. It turns out that they are...
15522121.title: Off to breakfast

155221211.content:
As your mother carries you into the family dining room another familiar voice calls out.

"Good morning." You look beyond your mother's paw to espy an immense white rabbit dressed in some smart and casual clothing waving in your direction. "Did you sleep well?" He asks. You glance up at your massive mother's face, wondering which of you he was addressing. She nods down at you.

"Go on, answer daddy." When she says this you look at the rabbit, wondering what it would be like when you get closer. This behemoth of a bunny is, in fact, your father.

"What's matter?" Another voice asks; you trace it to a particularly young-looking fox wearing a T-shirt and shorts who just stepped in through another doorway. "Cat got ya tongue, sis?" This is getting to be a bit much for you. Your hands fly to your mouth as to try to come to terms with having country-sized parents and a younger brother who could grab entire cities on a whim. Your mother carries you closer to the table.

"Now, you know it's rude not to answer." She tells you. The sheer physical authority she holds is bad enough without any condescending lectures. It's impossible for your whole family to be a mixed-species group who are all over forty miles tall, especially if they interact with you as easily as if you were all normal-size. It seems they can vary their volume depending on how close you are, they can see you from a distance that's sensible for them but insane for your scale and they don't appear to be deafened if you talk really close to their ears. "Darling," Your mother now sounds less insistent and more concerned, "Are you feeling all right?"

How do you respond?
155221211.title: A Nuclear Family... as it were

1552212112.content:
"I...I don't know." You squeak. "I can remember having parents and I recognise your voices but I don't recall being this small, nor all of you being anything other than human." You feel yourself being lifted up closer to your mum's eye.

"Oh, you poor thing." She cries without sounding like a thunderbolt. "Do you remember your name?" You reply affirmatively and speak your name. "Thank goodness. Can you tell what our names are?" You correctly identify your father and mother but are stumped as to your brother's name. "He's Liam." She extends the digit your sitting on towards him. It's a shocking sight to behold as he looms larger and larger in your vision.

"Errr," You struggle under his gaze, "Please to meet you?" You hold out your right hand towards him.

"Oh, cut loose." He answers while resting a part of one of his claws in your microscopic hand. "You've always been an open girl. Where's that sassy tone I've always known?" You stare at him. It's like no-one gives a damn about you being smaller than one of your mother's ova.

"I just don't remember ever seeing anyone this huge." You gasp. "I've never met anyone twice as tall as me before, now I've got an entire family big enough to be colonised by immigrants." They stare between you and each other at this revelation.

"I think we may have to get you booked in for an examination for amnesia." Your dad states.

"Yes." Your mother acknowledges. "But, for now, we'll just have to try and stimulate your memory however we can." She then lowers you onto the tabletop where you see a dinette set beside the vase. It turns out to be rather grander on your scale when she rests her finger nearby. With great care you slip off and walk towards your seat, which takes all of two minutes. Amazingly you don't see your mother lift her paw away and depart to get the breakfast. Before long you feel slight tremors and watch your mother sail through your skyline, setting state-size plates at places for your father, brother and herself before taking a few crumbs off her plate and setting them on platters at your table. Her immense digits easily dwarfing the entire set. It soon becomes clear that you are supposed to take even smaller helpings from these and set them on your own little plate.
1552212112.title: First Plans

15522121121.content:
You watch in awe, shock and terror as your mother lifts pieces of bacon and egg the size of a city into her cavernous maw. The food she consumes in one bite would be enough to feed a million people for a week. Trying to stop yourself from shuddering you turn towards the looming mountain of your father, who is scoffing his food at such a pace you dread to think what would happen if you fell in. Swiftly you switch your gaze to your brother, and that's no picnic either. Although he isn't having bacon and eggs you can see slices of toast as big as New York being hungrily demolished in seconds. You rapidly focus all your attention on the generous spread mum has provided just for you.

"Hey." Liam starts off a conversation. "Mum, if you have to take *insert name here* to the doctor's, does that mean she'll get the day of at school?"

"It all depends what day we can get her booked in." She answers. Having to look up again at your mother you shudder as you think about what school would be like if everyone else is on her scale while you could stand on the tip of the shortest pupil's finger. She spotted the signs of your unease around this point. "Don't worry, dear. No one's gonna put you under duress. After all, you've managed so well for the past fifteen years."

"Sorry, mum." You answer. "I still can't get over how enormous you all are. And no matter what I do I continually end up watching you eat, and the size of your mouthfuls..." You struggle to continue.

"It's just something you'll have to get used to, again." She replies. "But you certainly make a good point. Really, Liam, how many times have I told you not to bolt your food?"

"Anyway, don't let it get to you." Your dad remarks, gesturing in a teasing manner with his fork. "There were a few times when you were a nipper you ended up in our food." Your eyes bug out at the implications. "But your little squirming figure is too hard to ignore. You'll always be visible and we'll always be alert."

After breakfast your mother...
15522121121.title: Breakfast with Titans

choices: Your mother takes you to a doctor
You get to spend some quality time with your brother
15522121122.title: After Breakfast...

15523.content:
You wake up dazed, the dream still buzzing through your memory. You saw a whole multitude of behemoths looming over you but not one of them seemed affected in the slightest over the size difference, indeed they seemed to be behaving as though nothing was out of the ordinary. You now discover that you're not in your bed; you find yourself resting in some kind of forest of white bamboo or something like that. Up above the sky is dark but not cloudy, nor is it night. It looks to you as though the sky is a real blanket. Beneath you the forest floor is coloured a strange gentle pink and actually seems to be radiating heat, negating any need for you to sleep in a bed while wearing your nightie. You get to your feet and begin to explore when an earthquake knocks you back down as you hear a familiar giggle emanate from beyond this forest.

"Why didn't you say you were awake?" You hear your younger sister's voice as a strange mass begins to advance through the thicket; you instinctively step backwards as you see just how huge it is and the fact it's coming straight for you! "Aw, come on sis." Your sister remarks, every syllable accompanying a tremor under your feet. "Mommy's not gonna be too happy if we dawdle." You stare agog now as everything fits together. Your dream, the forest you awoke in, the earth tremors, your sister's voice, that monster coming after you. Somehow you've awoken in a world where your sister is a massive beast and you're standing on her torso. You've been sleeping on your younger sister!

The feelings of incest conflate with the thought that your sister's about to slam her city-sized fingertip into you. How can she determine where you are? How can she consider you a person at this scale? Before you can dwell on these things that monster of a digit sweeps right into you, causing you to yelp slightly as you're scooped right off her chest and effortlessly lifted up to her eye level. The young lady's massive pink eye could easily beat New York City in a Largest Area Competition.

"So," She says nonchalantly at a shockingly low volume for her size, "You wanna get ready with me or do you want to be on your own today?"
15523.title: My Sister, the Continent

choices: You exit before your sister returns.
Your sister comes back before you're finished.
155231.content:
As you sit on your colossal sister's fingertip you wonder how best to handle this sudden switch on how life works. If you join her in preparing for the day you can see exactly how furry people bigger than India get ready when they intimately know someone like you, who's a mere molecule by comparison, but the chances are you'd be too gobsmacked to take it all in. If you get ready by yourself it'll give you time to let it all sink in but then you might miss on certain elements of how life round here functions. Looking up into her island-dwarfing eye you try to gauge which your sister prefers.

"Ummm," You respond at last, "Could I have some time to myself?" You ask, fearing your voice is much too feeble for her to hear.

"Okay." She answers, rising from the bed. It was a shocking sight to behold ordinary furniture on a scale that would make it visible from over two hundred thousand miles away. Your sister strolls over to a dressing table and lowers you to the base of the mirror. With great skill she manages to slip you off her finger, which must be at least a mile thick. Standing on the vast wooden surface you look up as the giantess withdraws her hand; you know see she's an anthropomorphic skunk, clad in a pair of ocean-blue night shorts. She speaks like your sister, her voice is the same as your sister, she seems to be a pre-adolescent like your sister and those shorts are definitely your sister's; and yet she's so humongous that she could've single-handedly brought about the apocalypse to humanity had this been the world you knew. There was no way humanity could fight against a girl like this. "I'll be back in a few." She stated before turning and strolling out of the room. It was a sight to behold, seeing her just walk away like there was nothing important about you being the size of a microbe to her; her footfalls reverberated right up to you but you didn't fall over and, oddly enough, it was quite a nice thrill for you.

Turning back to the gigantic table mirror you saw a door just right for you in the base. Stepping in you found a bathroom perfectly suited to your size and a set of clothes hanging on the wall. You wonder just how you could've got dressed if you went with your younger sister.

As you prepared yourself you had to wonder just what kind of world this was. Were there any more people like you who'd have to hitch rides on fingers? Was that why there seemed to be no fuss over your size? What kind of society could function if there was such a drastic difference in size? If you were the only speck why were you still alive?
155231.title: Super Mega Skunk

1552311.content:
Once you were satisfied with your appearance you stepped out, and were promptly stunned once again as the difference in size became apparent again. The bathroom was most capacious, of a standard equal to only the best 5-star hotels, and yet it resided in the base your younger sister's mirror on her dressing table. Looking around the various items on the table you could see a hairbrush with bristles rising like the Himalayas, a jewelery box that could accommodate Rhode Island and then some and a cuddly toy sat beside the mirror looming so high that it could crush all of Tokyo under one leg.

The whole room was a rolling landscape that made the Grand Canyon look like a garden ornament. Without your giant sister in it there was a real sense of emptiness in having country-size furniture around. You can hear distant sounds of flowing water like Niagara Falls, which promptly stopped and, not long afterwards, a gargling sound issued forth like great mud pools dragging foolish animals to their deaths. You realise that this was your sister cleaning her teeth; you kneel on a thread of lace cloth as you think how many extinction events could be perpetrated by this one girl being careless.

After a while the Richter 5 footfalls of your sister return and you look up again. Somehow you feel relieved as she slowly but casually approaches; she makes the room complete. However you do wonder why she didn't take as long as you since girls that age didn't preen themselves as much as your age group and you had to take your time to let everything sink in. She giggles with the force of a super-cell, but you find it reassuring rather than deafening.

"You look so cute like that." She remarks as she once again proffers a finger of alpine proportions. You grab hold of a strand of fur and let yourself be effortlessly lifted off her dressing table. You then hear another familiar voice call out from a distance you can't even begin to fathom.

"Girls, breakfast's ready!" That was your mother's voice. The fact that she could call out at such a distance strongly suggested she was as big as your sister, bigger even. Without even checking on you your sister turns about and strolls to the door, her footfalls not registering except by sound as she bobs her arm in time with them.

"COMING, MOM!" She calls out. Oddly enough it wasn't a shout that could rip fault lines, though that would've killed you with such sheer volume, but seemed more like a cross between how you'd expect your sister to shout and a volcanic eruption.
1552311.title: Grasping for Scale

15523111.content:
Your sister carries you downstairs. The lack of ear-popping and the swiftness of her movement telling you that this world is on her scale, which means that, technically, you shrunk even though she's a different species. When you enter the dining room you get your first sight of your mother. You stare in awe. Your twelve-year old sister was the size of India but your mother, another magnificent skunk lady, was almost as big as Australia! You try to take her in before the two titanesses could close the distance. She was wearing a puce ankle-length dress with lavender highlights and gold hoop earrings. By your reckoning she could balance any city in the world as you knew it on the tip of her finger and could walk faster than the Earth could spin even when she wasn't in a hurry. Her smile was comforting in spite of the knowledge that it covered a distance comparable to ocean trenches; people could probably go for hikes on her eyelashes. By anyone's standards both your mother and your younger sister were god-like figures beyond all reach and resistance, but they were still your family.

"Good morning, Emily." The continent-size matriarch greeted your sister. "Morning, Alice." She addressed you as you knelt on Emily's fingertip.

"M...m...morning mom." You stammer, receiving a rather concerned look from the mustelid colossus.

"Why." She exclaims. "What's the matter, honey?" She strolls over with planet-shattering steps and crouches down so her eye fills your view. You fall back, which Emily compromises for so you don't tumble all the way into her knuckle-crevice.

"Buh...buh...buh..." You jabber in shock and awe of her stature. "Why's everything so massive?!?" You cry out before curling up into a sobbing ball. After a minute or so you feel something like an obsidian cliff on your back, before you know you are sliding across a black curved surface and land softly on your mother's fingertip.

"Alice," She whispers with astonishing gentility, "You mean you really don't remember?" You look up into her pupil; she's holding you so close to her eye that the only thing you can see beyond her fingertip, including the claw she scooped you up with, is her pupil and her emerald-green iris. You shiver with uncertainty and fear at the power she represents.

"I know who you two are," You get out in a meek tone, "Because I recognise your voices, I know this is our house because the furniture and layout are almost the same. But everything else is alien. Either you're impossible or I'm impossible!" You bring your knees up to your face and start sobbing again.

"My dear little Alice." Your mother whispers. "Please don't be frightened. No one's gonna harm you. You've always been small enough to carry around on my finger and nobody's ever caused you any grief because of it. Indeed, you've been an inspiration in developing things suited to you; the real marvel is that you're a human." You look up into the shiny black void in wonder. "Okay, so your small size was amazing enough, but the fact that you're something no one's ever seen except in art."

"H...Humans are fiction?" You check.

"We all thought that before you were born. It was certainly something when my pregnancy didn't show through and it was another wonder when you were born; I wouldn't have known if everyone's senses didn't improve during that time." There was some amusement in her voice.

"It's not that I don't remember anything other than the house and your voices." You point out. "It's just that I remember everything being on the same scale as me and people were humans." The massive skunkettes gasp with the force of a geyser.

"I whole world as small as you?" Emily does a double-take. "Wow! Think what it would be like, mom. We'd be..."

"Easy now." Your mother moves you away from her eye, allowing you to see more of her, the room and Emily. She places her free paw on the child's shoulder. "Don't get carried away. If such a world does exist somewhere any one of us would be more than enough to cause chaos and destruction on a level I'm thankful to be unable to conceive." Emily looks away in shame; you can now see that she's changed into a blue T-shirt and pink shorts, neither of the anthros are wearing anything on their feet.

"I was trying to wrap my head round that." You declare, peeking round your mother's claw. "As soon as she held me up to her eye I thought 'It's bigger than New York'." The two giants now look back at you.

"Alicey," Emily asks hesitantly, "You're not scared of me, are you?" The poor girl looked so sad at the idea of terrifying her own sister. You look up at your mother, wondering whether you should be honest or tactful. It would only take a certain kind of look from her and you'd know; all the easier since her face is bigger than Texas.

Your mother would like you to answer Emily...
15523111.title: Try and Clear Things Up

choices: Dad would be on his way to work now.
155231111.content:
"Um, Emily." You answer, actually scuffing your feet against your mother's fur. "When you brought your finger towards me first thing, I was rather alarmed but that was more to do with knowing it was a lot heavier than me and was coming quite fast."

"Fast?" She seemed incredulous. "I was taking my time." You put a hand on your chest as you think that if she was taking her time what would she have considered fast.

"But when you said 'good morning' to me," You continue, "I was somewhat reassured but then I was more awestruck by how vast you are." You spread your arms as you say this. Emily now smiles embarrassingly.

"We can continue sorting this out later." Mother says. "Right now your breakfast's getting cold." She turns about and carries you to the table, Emily following closely behind. "Now don't worry about the size of everything." She tells you as she sets you down about twelve miles away from her plate. "We've been giving you the right sort of crumbs for years." You espy a dinette set about a mile away and make for it. As you progress your mother starts lowering a syringe of sorts onto her plate and then moving it over the dinette set before depositing microscopic (to her) crumbs of her own breakfast for you to dig in to. Emily sits down adjacent to her, the both of them looming over your tiny place on the table. As you sit down the syringe descends to your place again, you cringe as it squirts a drop of tea into a tiny mug just right for you.

"Mom," You ask, "You mean to say that I've been this small all my life?"

"Of course, honey." She replies. "And I'd be quite happy to help you regain understanding of what it's like living amongst us *teehee* giants." Her tone was mildly cheeky, causing you to blush as you consider this.

"Mommy," Emily asks, "Suppose Alice really is from a different world? Suppose the Alice we've known is now living her life?" These words strike home for you. You think about an alternative version of yourself waking up somewhere that gives her more independence but also a lot more responsibility. You just have to cope with everyone being humongous, she'd have to cope with a multitude of chores and suchlike.

You think about how more awkward it would be if you had to deal with dad at this time; you strain to imagine an anthropomorphic male skunk sitting across from your mother on an even bigger scale. Fortunately you recall that...
155231111.title: The Truth Can Hurt

choices: I'll be picking you from school today."
Your bodyfriend is picking you up on his way to school."
1552311111.content:
While you thought about dealing with a giant sized anthro skunk as your dad you were quickly broken out of your thoughts when you heard a deep voice when it said, "See you after work, dea. And I'm sorry I can't stay for breakfast. But I promised my boss I'd go into work early today."

"I understand honey. But aren't you at least going to stay goodbye to our daughters too?" You mother asked, which caused you to stop eating and turn your attention towards the front of the dining room.

And once you had done this you felt your eyes widen in shock once your FAther had entered room. Or at least this world's version of him anyway. Because what entered the room was a heavily muscled male skunk who was wearing a nice light blue dress shirt with a black tie, along with black pants and black dress shoes. And when you saw him walk past you, you felt a slight rush of air zoom past you as he kissed your mother on the lips for a few seconds before he moved to Emily.

Upon doing so he then saw your father give her a kiss on the cheek while he tol dher, "Have good day at school, Emily."

"I will, Dad." Your little sister replied, with a big smile on her face.

After this had happened though you were soon engulfed by your Father's shadow. And once you had looked past his six pack clothed abs and large chest you saw a gleam in his eyes as he slowly and then gently used the tip of his finger to rub the top of your head while he said, "Have a good day at school, Alice."

"I-I'll try, Dad." You stuttered out, as he then moved his finger away from you head.

"That's my girl." The giant muscled skunk replied, with a proud smile on his face. And upon doing so he then began to walk out of the dining room, and most likely head off to work. But before he did saw him stop in his tracks which gave you a view of his wide and muscled back along with butt to which ou blushed and quickly away out of embarrassment. However, this didn't last long as your attention was brought back to his large green eyes when he back from over his shoulder and continued, "Oh, that's right I almost forgot to tell you, Alice.....
1552311111.title: Having A Giant Skunk As Your Dad.

15523111112.content:
Your eyes widen for a few seconds before you find your face become a light shade of pink from hearing what your dad had just told you. You then rubbed your right arm with your left hand while you said, "M-My boyfriend? Do you mean Sammy......I mean Samuel?"

"Yes, that's who I'm talking about....." Your Father let out, to which you thought you had seen eyebrows narrow a little.

But before he could say anything else you heard your mother get up out of her seat to which she walked up to him and placed a hand on his right shoulder and told him, "Oh Roger dear, don't be like that. Although I guess I can't blame you since you've always been protective of Alice. But remember that Sam is a very nice and respectable young man who would force our daughter to do anything that she'd be uncomfortable with."

"I-I know darling. But no matter how old she gets. Alice will always be my little girl." Your Father softly told your mother, before his eyes widen. You then saw him give your mother a quick kiss on the lips before he ran off and added, "Oh crud, I best get going or else I'll be alte. I'll see all of you later for dinner."

To this your mother just let out a light giggle and waved goodbye as the last thing you saw was his large and fluffy tail as she said, "Have a good day, dear." And once you heard the front door open and close you saw her face you and your sister when she continued, "And now you both had best get ready school since the bus will be here soon to pick you up Emily. And I'm most certain Samuel will be here soon to pick you up, Alice."

"Yes, Mom." Both you and your little sister say at the same time, to which Emily gently picked you up and took you upstairs.

But while you both got ready you couldn't help but think of your world's version of Sam, who remember was a part of the football team in your high school. Not only that, but he was a part of the drama club when he wasn't playing football. That was how the two of you met when you were both picked for the leads of one of the plays. After that it was history so to speak as the two of you became boyfriend and girlfriend. However, since he was quite popular with the girls you did have to deal with them being quite jealous. But you made sure not to let it get to you too badly.

But while your sister carried you downstairs once you were done geting ready remembered how protective your Dad was of you.. And how this version of him always had you sleep in between his pecs whenever you ahd a bad dream. You even somewhat remember him staying home once when you got sick.

However, these thoughts were quickly pushed to the side when you were handed over to your Mother once Emily's bus had arrived and she had left for school. Within a few seconds though you saw a car pull up into your driveway. And to your surprise you saw a well muscled male anthro walk out from the driver's seat. And upon a better look you saw that this world's version of Sam was in face a anthro.......
15523111112.title: Seeing Your Boyfriend For the First Time, Sort Of

choices: at your high school to pick you up and head somewhere before dinner.
wanted to talk to you and Sam while they worked out at a local gym.
155231111121.content:
You found yourself blushing upon seeing this world's version of your boyfriend Samuel. You weren't sure why you were blushing though? WAs it because of just how huge his muscles looked now? No, since they were pretty impressive back in your world. Maybe it was due to the fact thsat with his pure white fur it just seemed to make his deep blue eyes really stand out. Although you did notice how tight his short, pants and high school jacket was on him as he walked up to your mother and looked down at you while you were still in her palm.

And upon doing this you saw his expression become very soft as he greeted you with, "Good morning, Alice." You then saw him look up at your mother, wh youo noticed was a few feet shorter then he was, although that really shouldn't surprised you since your world's version of him was pretty tall too. But once he had looked at your mother you saw him get a bit nerous while he continued with, "Um, hello, ma'am. Good morning to you too."

After he had said this though you were then placed into Sam's right hand as your mother reassured him, "Sam dear, there's no need ot be so nervous. You know that I have no problems with you and Alice being together. And I assure you that my husband is okay with it as well. His just a tad protective of Alice is all."

"Oh, yes of course. But we better get going though." Sam replied, before the two of you waved goodbye to your mother and he got into his car with you still in his hand. You then saw him slowly sit down into the car seat before you were placed onto his right shoulder. You then saw him turn his key thus turning on the car before he started to drive out of your neighborhood. Upon doing this though you saw a blush form on his face as he looked down at you and added, "Hey babe, I missed you."

"I know, Sammy. I missed you too." You replied, while you moved over to his necka nd hugged it as best you could.

But once you had done this you felt that body part of him move a bit when he confessed, "But you know even though you told me not to be nervous, I'm afraid I can't it."

"What, really? My Dad doesn't scare you that much does, he?" You asked, tkaen aback by the giant arctic wolf's words.

"Well it's not that. But I do know how much your Dad cares about you. So I just don't want to do something that'll make him think poorly of me and think I'm not treating you right." Sam told you, as he continued to drive.

"Don't worry Sam, I know you've never do anything to hurt me. I trust and love you so much." You reassured the wolf, before you saw one of his hands move away from the steering wheel.

Once he had done this you then felt one of his huge fingers gently rub itself up against you while he replied, "I know you do, Alice. And I love you too. Nor would I ever do anything to hurt you or put in harms way."

After he had said this the rest of the drive was silent. The two of you then got to eh high school and spent the entire day together since you both had the same schedule. In fact your locker was just a small part of Sam's locker which was nice since he was always there to make you had everything before going off to class, or lunch, and then more classes followed by a study hall here and there until the school day was over.

But once it was over however, you both soon realized that your Dad.....
155231111121.title: Samuel The Arctic Wolf

choices: You've got the whole day to yourself.
1552311112.content:
You remember when Emily was approaching her fourth birthday you lost your father in a road accident while he was out shopping for presents. It was a most tragic event; you had to comfort your sister and try to explain what it meant while your mother needed to tackle the extra responsibility of raising two kids and be the breadwinner. You now wonder how that would've worked in this world.

"Mum." You state once you're through with your breakfast, her enormous eyes focus upon you. "Can I have a talk with you, alone?" The mighty mustelid seemed a bit taken aback under the circumstances, but her motorway-length lips curl up into a serene smile and she answers.

"Of course, Alice." You still can't get to grips over how you can interact with someone so massive. "We can talk while I do the washing up." You wait, watching the astonishing sight of your mother and younger sister eating their breakfast, every mouthful enough to sustain a million people for a week. You shudder at the thought that you could get lost in those portions. Eventually they're finished and your mother reaches towards you, briefly casting you and your entire dinette set into shadow before a single finger rests on the giant tabletop about twenty yards away. You approach as swiftly as you can while admiring the sheer scale of her. You pull yourself up onto the tip, thankful that her fur is so effective as a climbing frame. Once you're settled down she effortlessly whisks you up towards her face.

Before you know what's going on you find yourself tumbling onto a great soft trampoline, which you discover is mum's dress. You're sitting on her shoulder! It really strikes home how tiny you are in this world; to your left her neck rises up like a mountain range towards her head where she beams down at you like an Olympian goddess, to your right the expanse of soft fabric stretches off and stops as it reaches the sheer drop of her arm.

"Emily, dear." Your mum addresses her. "Why don't you get yourself together while I do the washing up?" The two giants rise from their seats, prompting you to grip onto the fabric of your mum's dress as you can't be sure how she expects you to stay on board.

"Okay, mom." The colossal child cries, thundering away back to her room. You look up at your mother's cheek.

"I'm not gonna fall into the sink, am I?" You ask apprehensively, causing her to giggle with the force of tectonic plates moving against each other. It shakes you up but your position doesn't change.

"Not at all." She answers. "You did go diving in a few times when you were younger, but I've found how to keep my shoulders straight while doing the dishes." She reaches forth and gathers up the dirties that are on her scale and carries them into the kitchen. You gasp at the sight. The sink is so large you'd guess that all the water in the Great Lakes could barely fill it, the oven could recreate the Sahara to scale, the fridge was worthy of a new Ice Age.

"Uh, should I have picked up my dishes?" You ask.

"Don't worry about it." Mother replies. "They may be smaller than you but there's still a way of dealing with them." You look at her neck in bewilderment.

"How?" You ask.

"Well, since they're so tiny they are easy to mass produce and are disposable." She smiles down at you, but it now looks like she's got a joke to tell. "I swallow them." You gasp at the thought that anything you leave behind vanishes down your mother's throat, which could easily take the entire US Navy in one gulp. The continental skunk-lady puts the normal size dishes on the side and reaches over to turn the taps on. You watch and listen as a mighty rushing sound of tepid water comes forth that would place the combined power of all the waterfalls in the world to shame. "So, what's on your mind now?" Mum asks as she adds some washing-up liquid.

"I was just wondering how we managed when dad..." You reply. Mother's muzzle now sinks into a look of sorrow.

"You did manage quite well, comforting little Emily." She answers. "You even cheered her up, scurrying all over her head." There was a hint of a smile. "In fact we didn't have too much to worry about after the grieving passed. We've got so much financial support from various sources, thanks to you my little speck of a girl," An enormous claw looms over you and drenches you with a single water-drop before you find yourself being petted with a finger that could obliterate an entire civilisation, "I didn't need to go out to work as much as I would've done." You are fairly satisfied with this for now and sit watching her wash-up. The suds look like ice caps from your perspective.

How are you going to adapt to an entire world populated with anthros that could individually bring about the apocalypse due to their sheer size? If it's a school-day you may end up going in at the deep end, but if not you can ease your way in with some help from your family.
1552311112.title: In which a girl watches her skunk mother wash up.

155232.content:
You wake up and rub your head as you let out a groan. "Oh," you say. "My head. What happened?" You then realize that you appear to be in a field of tall gray grass. "Huh?" you ask. The ground also feels surprisingly soft. "Where am I?" you ask. You walk forward and then see a sparkling light. Before you can walk forward you feel a shaking noise. You grab onto the grass and then look up to see each strand of "grass" is so big that each blade has to be as big as a skyscraper. You run out as the ground keeps on shaking and then you see a wall of silver.

You look at the silver and walk forward. That is when you realize that the silver is a large ball that appears to be lodged into the wall, just like a piercing. You look up and see more grass, but then you see something even weirder. What you see is a large black covered wall with two bulbous projections jutting out. You assume that you're in the cave of some strange mountain, only to feel vibrations. Your entire area was shaking. You try to run back in the cave but then the shaking stops and you are picked up by two large pointy black objects. "What's happening?!" you yell. "What's...?! As you're lifted up, you are placed on a big leathery black platform.

You then see a large black wall big enough to build an airport on. You then see a horrifying sight, a titanic brown eye the size of the sun. You step back and look down to see that the mountain wasn't a mountain at all. The projections you were under before were enormous breasts and your cave was actual the navel of a giant bulging belly and the grass was actually fur. Then you turned to see blue colored hair and then you realize, you're on top of a big beautiful raccoon girl the size of an entire continent.

You worry of how she would react to a tiny human, but then she speaks in an unusually soft voice. "Hi little man. I see you're finally awake. How's that head doing." You couldn't believe this. This raccoon sounded just like your girlfriend.
155232.title: Planet Raccoon

1552321.content:
You walk forward to your girlfriend's eyes and give a look of confusion. "Sakura?" you ask. "Is that you?" "You see any other raccoon around here Dex?" she asks. You realize your name is Dex and then you shake your head. "Exactly why are you a raccoon?" Sakura lets out a laugh that shakes you and causes you to nearly fall off her nose. Then you let out a yell and fall back only for Sakura to catch you on her tongue and then spit you into her country sized hand.

You shake off raccoon saliva as Sakura holds you up by the leg. "I've always been a raccoon silly," she said. "You're the one who should be feeling weird. After all, you're the one who came out of your mother as a teeny weenie human. There isn't anyone as tiny as you." You squint a little in confusion. You were the only human and everyone else, including your mother was a giant anthro. Of course, you didn't know if your mom was a raccoon like Sakura, but how could any giantess anthro, hundreds of miles high give birth to someone as small as you.

"You're joking right?" you ask. Sakura shakes her head and rubs her huge chubby belly before stroking you on the head. "I wouldn't joke about a boyfriend so small he lives in my belly button. You must've hit your head harder than I thought. I keep telling you to be careful. I'll explain everything elsewhere. But I gotta put you away now little guy, okay?"

Where does your titanic raccoon girlfriend put you?
1552321.title: The Biggest Raccoon

1553.content:
Up the Beanstalk: Be like Jack and climb this beanstalk you found where you'll enter a world full of humungus anthros. It's your favorite fairy tale with a Flangies twist.

Part of the Team: Similar to Mega Adventures. You are an average Joe/Jane who, every so often and without warning, will be taken from your world and transported into a universe full of titanic anthros. You were brought here by a team of lovable characters who wants you to join them on their adventures.
1553.title: More Choices

15531.content:
As you go to bed, you look and see your garden and let out a sigh. It was a nightmare. You never could go anything to grow, so you just lay down and try to sleep. After two hours you hear something rumbling. "Huh?" you ask. You look outside and then let out a gasp because there's something going on. You run to the window and see something you never could believe. A real beanstalk like in that fairy tale. "You gotta be kidding me." You say. You run out to check what's going on.

You tun up and see the beanstalk is still growing and jump on the leaf near the top as it grows hundreds of thousands of feet into the air. "Oh good grief." You say as you cling to the stem. You shake because you nearly had a heart attack with your fear of heights. Soon you are in the clouds when you slam your head on something. "Ouch!" you yell. "Huh."

You look up to see that there's wood above you. "Wood?" You then see a hole your size and then you start to climb that hole up. You hold out your legs to make sure you don't fall to your death below. As you crawl up for what you'd say, half an hour, you reach the top and climb into a linoleum covered floor. "Huh?" you ask. You look around to see that you appeared to be in a giant kitchen. You let out a groan and slap yourself in the face.

"Why did I do this. I should've known there'd be a giant. Then you hear rumbling and turn around to see something big was coming into the kitchen and might see you. But you're too frozen in fear to run. From the sound of it, the creature had to be fifty miles high. It was a wonder it would fit in the cloud. The figure comes closer and reveals itself to be female in shape, somewhat muscular but still with an hourglass figure and with glowing eyes.

Then you realize you're looking at a giantess hyena. A spotted hyena from the looks of it with long reddish brown hair and to top it all off, she didn't even have clothes on.
15531.title: Up the Beanstalk

155312.content:
You let out a heavy sigh of relief once you had reached the top of the giant beanstalk that had grown the previous night. You were just glad that you lived alone or else you certain your parents would not be too happy to see something like that in their yard. But when you had reached the top of the plant your eyes widen shock as you jumped off of it and saw taht you were standing on solid ground. In fact it seemed to be made out of every day dirt. And upon lifting your head you saw that you could see a giant village in the distance along with a castle in the back of it. Sadly you weren't able to stare at your surrounds for that long as a very large shadow engulfed you.

Before you knew it a large hand enclosed around you. You then foundyourself being lifted upward rather quickly. ONce the montion had stopped the hand that held you opened and you saw that had been grabbed by a giant anthro tiger. And by the looks of it he looked to either a thief or a bandit or something. You quickly felt a cold chill run down your body when you a wide smirk spread across the tiger's face as he said, "Well, this is a surprise. Here I was going to steal from the local village and palace. But instead I come across a tiny creature." He then got a better look at you and added, "I'll bet you'll get me a pretty good amount of gold in the marketplace. Or maybe I'll just end your life right now."

"No, please don't hurt me! I don't even know where I am! Won't you let me go?" You begged, while you got onto both of your knees.

A loud laugh left the tiger's lips when he replied back with, "Sorry, but I'm not letting a hcance like this spill away form me.":

Hearing this caused you to let out a loud scream before you closed your eyes and expected your life to end right then and there. Instead however, You heard another giant's voice as it ordered, "Bandit, I'm not sure what you're doing. But I know that you are the one who has been stealing from the village. So come quietly and let go of whatever it is that is in your hand. If you do this then your sentence may be shortened."

"Tch, I don't think so. And if you want what's in my hand so badly why don't you just catch it!" The tiger shouted, before his hand enclosed around you again.

Thankfully before the bandit could throw you, you felt someone tackle him to the ground. You then heard the tiger get hit by something. And before you knew it you saw the hand of tiger open. And to your surprise you saw a giant in red armor staring down at you. You proceeded to climb out of the bandit's hand and look up at the giant knight. You lowered your head and said, "T-Thank you for saving me."

At first the knight said nothing. After a few seconds had passed though you saw the giant remove his helmet and were shocked to see a giant anthro bear looking down at you. To your relief though he had a smile of warmth and relief as he responded back with, "There is no need for thanks. I am just glad that you were not harmed." He then lowered his head to get a better look at you and continued with, "Although I must admit I never knew that there were such small creatures like yourself. But where I are my mannered, my name is Fredrick, and I am one of the three knight captains of this fair kingdom." He then lowered a armored hand down to you and ended with, "But I don't think we should be speaking like this out in public. So please won't you come back to the castle with me?"
155312.title: The World Above The Clouds

choices: Let him leave to change his clothes.
1553121.content:
You stared at the giant brown furred anthro bear for a few seconds before you nodded your head and told him, "I-alright, I'll go back tot he castle with you. But what will you do? Will you take me to meet your ruler of this kingdom?"

The bear waited until you were safely in the center oif his palm before he slowly began to stand up to his full height. Upon doing this he replied back with, "I was thinking about doing that. But I don't think that would be a wise decision. If word got out that a tiny creature like yourself found thier way here. Then some people may try to take over your lands...whereever they may be."

"Oh, yes that's understandable. But um for the record I"m not a small creture I'm a human, and my name is Alex." You said, as you were brought up to one of the bear's large brown eyes.

Once this had been he stared at you as he let out a light hearted chuckle and said, "A human you say? I'm afraid that I have never heard of that before. But I will say that from the looks of it. You appear to be no different then us. Well expect for the lack of fur and the fact that you're so small."

You wanted to say something in response to what the knight had said. But before you could you heard a voice and saw two other anthros running towards you and Sir Fredrick while they shouted, "Sir Fredrick, are you alright?!"

"Well, it seems that two of my comrades have caught yp to me." The bear stated, before you found yourself being lowered towards the bear's right armored thigh. You then saw him puch open a small leather pouch while he added, "So if you don't mind little one. Please hide in here until I have arrived at my house. Once I have I will you out and we will talk some more."

You knew that you did not have a choice in the matter and so you jumped into the leather pouch.Upon doint this you saw the outside light go dark as the front of the pouch was shut. You then heard the bear's deep voice when he ordered, "About time you two showed up! Now please take this bandit to His Majesty so he can receive his punishment for his crimes. I will return to the castle after I have used the herbs I have collected to make some medicine at my home."

"Yes, sir!" The two other soldiers shouted, before you felt the pouch you were in begin to sway a little.

That did not last long though as you heard the flap to the pouch open and you saw a two red armored fingers enter the darkness. You then felt the fingers as they were gently presed against you as the bear said to you, "Don't worry little Alex. We will be arriving to home shortly."

And to the giant anthro's word you heard a door being opened and then closed. You then felt the two fingers that were against you gently lift you up out of the pouch. And after your eyes had adjusted you saw the bear had a very modesty home with one large room with a large table, a few chairs, and a couch. You then looked to the back right of the room and saw a small hallway which you guess led to the bear's bedroom. While you were looking around you did not realize that Fredrick had walked up the large table and had lowered his hand to it for you to get onto.

Upon doing this you commented with, "You have a nice home, Sir Fredrick."

"Thank you Alex. But you do not need to be formal with me. You are a guest in my home after all." The bear replied, before you turned and saw him begin to remove his armor.

And since the bear had his back to you saw him remove the arm section of the red colored armor. And not to your surprise the bear had large muscles all along his arms. Next came the midsection of the armor and again not to your surprise you saw a very wide and muscled back. He then removed the chainmail that covered his back and front of his body. ANd when he turened to face you, your eyes widen in shock as you saw the giant bear had no amount of fat on him whatsoever. Instead you saw two massive and firm pectoral muscles. Below that you saw a very firm eight pack on his stomach.

You then found youself blushing a little as you let out, "Um please forgive me for staring like that Fredrick."

"No, it's alright. I always do this so taht I may check for damage to both my armor and body. I should have been a better host and changed in my room and not in front of you." The brown eyed giant replied, before he bent down and grabbed the pieces of armor and chainmail. Once all of the pieces where in his arms he added, "So allow me to continue to finish checking my armor in my room while I change. Once I do this then you can watch me make some medicine. Besides if I were to return to the castle empty then I'm sure my men and others would get suspicious."

Before the giant anthro bear left though you....
1553121.title: The Giant Knight In Red Armor

15532.content: are you a boy or a girl?
15532.title: Part of the Team

15533.content: Pop Star: In this one your a singing pop star who just started his or her tour threw the anthro world.
15533.title: pop star

choices: Nah, I went to the doc just yesterday!
155332.content: Infected: It goes something like this. There's this ordinary world where anthros lived. However, you ended up 'catching' a virus, which turned you human, and made you micro, making everyone else macro in your eyes. It also wiped your memory of ever being an anthro in the first place. Interestingly enough, you're the only one who ever got this, while every other anthro is currently 'immune' to it.
155332.title: How about this then?

1553321.content:
Thump. Thump. Thump. Your head is pounding...it feels like your brain is being hit by a truck repeatedly. Your skin, too, felt like you were constantly being pricked by thousands of tiny needles. Groaning loudly, you struggle to open one eye, and you manage to squint it open slightly before closing it in pain. Recollecting what little data you collected, you were in a blank, grey metal bed with a blue blanket. Focusing on the sound around you amidst the uncomfortable feelings confirmed your fears; you were in a hospital bed. As of the pain didn't make it obvious enough.

"Doctor, will he be okay? What's...wrong with him?" came a distant, booming voice. The pain was screwing with your head. You could almost recognize the voice. Almost. But the pain was too much of a distraction. You just had a feeling that whoever it was cared for you very much. "It's hard to say." said another, equally loud voice. As the pain seemed to finally wind down, atleast, your migraine was dying down, the voice still seemed to have that strange loud, distant feeling that you just couldn't shake. "He seems to have contracted a very...peculiar disease, of which we're still studying the sample of. Along with doing...*this* to him, it seems like he's the only person alive who's even capable of contracting it. Which is VERY unusual, as you can imagine."

So you were the only person in the world to contract some disease? Was it the cause of this pain? That couldn't he right...the pain was really quieting down now. Your muscles began to relax as your body felt relief unlike anything you've ever felt as the pain seemingly vanished over the course of the last few minutes. It was an invigorating feeling, actually! Stretching your arms painlessly above your head, you opened your eyes with a smile.

The smile faded away into awe as you gazed at the sight before you.

A woman and a man, with animal attributes, no less, towered above you at many thousands of miles tall, you estimated. And from where your bed was perched, you were only about chest level! "He should be waking up now." said the Doctor, which filled the girl's expression with glee. You couldn't help but scream as her giant eye lowered itself to your puny form, taking every microscopic inch of you in. "Hi, babe!"
1553321.title: A migraine and a micro.

choices: A World of Gigantic Royal Subjects
1553322.content: This option is similar to Paradox. You awake in a world of invincible titanic anthros as their monarch with a 100% approval rating.
1553322.title: Microcracy?

15533222.content:
Extended Family:

You are, or were, an animal lover, owning several pets of different species. After waking up, you soon realise that your pets have been transformed into titanic anthropomorphic versions of themselves, although they still see you as their master. In addition, you are the only human, so it's just you and them.
15533222.title: Different Choice

155332221.content:
You always were an animal person. You kept several pets, and lived on your own, preferring their company to that of other people's, although you frequently talked over the phone and on the computer with friends and relatives. Your house was situated in the countryside, a small distance away from any major roads, and you had a large amount of land to yourself.

You had four pets: a white husky dog named Lily, a reddish coloured gecko with a white underbelly called Lexi, a small, stereotypical bright canary named Melody, and finally, a large, chestnut coloured horse named Bella. Needless to say, all were female.

Right now, instead of your warm bed, all you could feel was an equally warm coat of fur coming into contact with your entire body. While strange, it was very inviting, and made you want to just go back to sleep again. It was probably Lily. She must have decided to sleep on the bed with you. You stretch out and open your eyes, only to be met with an entire forest of white fur, stretching in every direction.

You begin to panic slightly, and yell out "Hello? Is anyone there?" And nearly go into shock when a gigantic canine muzzle appears above you and says, "Good morning, master!"
155332221.title: Extended Family

choices: Taking you to Bella, she must know how to help!
1553322211.content:
The corner of your left eye twitches slightly as you gaze several hundred miles up at the titanic muzzle of what used to be your faithful husky, now twisted into a bizarre, titanic approximation of the human form.

Puzzled with your silence, Lily lowers her muzzle down so low you can almost touch it, able to easily observe you despite her size. However, you rapidly shuffle backwards, until she places a single titanic digit, able to hold entire cities on its tip, into your path, blocking your attempted escape.

By now, Lily's face is full of concern, her bright blue eyes easily locked right onto yours, despite the size difference. "Master, are you okay?" She asks softly, though she is unable to hide the worry her voice displays.

Your eyes dart to the left, then to the right, as you swallow anxiously, not sure how to respond. You close your eyes and let your head droop, before replying. "When did you... Get so big, Lily?"

Lily's eyes widen for a brief second, and she begins to mutter under her breath, although you can still clearly hear her due to her size. "Oh, no, Bella said he was ill but I didn't think he was this ill..."

Rubbing you gently with a single, multi-mile thick digit, Lily draws in a breath before...
1553322211.title: Continue

15533222111.content:
"Well, a few weeks ago you got... Sick. Really sick. You started to have hallucinations but you snapped out of them eventually. I guess you must have been even worse off than I thought for the illness to affect you memory, master..."

You sigh again. Everything had been a disease messing with your mind? Lily begins stroking you again, the city sized fingertip offering comfort as the skyscraper sized hairs brush against you.

You decide to ask Lily just how large she is. "Uh, Lily?" You begin to enquire, somewhat timidly. "Do you have a question, master?" "Uh, yes... Just how tall are you?" Lily smiles at the question. "Exactly one thousand, five hundred and seventeen miles, three thousand four hundred and twenty two feet, and four inches." She replies.

Lily stands up, the action forcing downwards into the pawpad of the palm she had placed you in before doing so.

"Come on, master, let's go and see...
15533222111.title: Explaining Your Amnesia

155332222.content: Similar to the "Paradox" storyline. You are the god to an alternate universe populated by titan-sized anthros. They aren't anymore advanced than your universe but they manage to construct a machine to bring you to their world so they can worship you properly. To bad it's impossible for them to send you back.
155332222.title: God among Titans

1553322221.content:
You stir slightly, just awake enough to move, yet too tired to really think. Your bones feel as if they are made of lead, and it's all you can do to roll over onto your back and slowly open your eyes. Unfortunately, your eyelids are too heavy to move, so for now you've got to really on your senses that aren't sight to tell you where you are - you can't feel your duvet, so you may well have fallen off your bed during your sleep. Hopefully that wasn't the case, that always made your back hurt.

Slowly dragging your hand across the floor, you are startled to feel not carpet, but... metal? You can't really smell anything that might help pinpoint your location, as you were pretty certain that you weren't inside your house by now. Listening intently, you can just make out hushed whispers coming from all directions, sounding vaguely reverent. This wasn't looking good. Okay, time to open your eyes and find out where you were.

Opening your eyes and rubbing them so as to allow yourself to see, you are shocked into silence by what you see. An utterly... massive... Grey wall, made of something you couldn't identify by sight alone, stretching off endlessly into every direction, was pressing slightly into whatever it was you were lying on. Managing to stand up without falling over, you walk over to the wall and touch it, feeling the warm and soft material, which felt somewhat similar to rubber, yield slightly when you applied pressure.

Confused and... well, more confused, you sit down and lean against the warm wall, staring upwards but finding yourself unable to see an end to whatever it was. You begin to hear distant murmurs yet again, but they at much more clear this time.

"Oh my..."
"It worked?"
"He seems confused..."
"Should we greet him?"
"Do it."

The grey wall behind you suddenly shifts, rushing downwards at immeasurable speeds while drawing backwards. Your draw drops open and a breath gets caught in your throat when the grey mass draw back enough for you to discern what it is.

It was a shark. Or rather, and anthro shark.
That was thousands upon thousands of miles tall.
And... Wearing robes?

The shark, whom you know as a female due to the orbs straining the cloth of the robe she was wearing, bows to you.

Huh?

You can see more anthros in the distance, each and every one of the planet-sized beings bowing to you for some unknown reason.

The shark anthro, easily sensing your confusion and fear, gives you the most comforting smile she can when from your viewpoint she could chomp a continent in half. As she draws in a breath that pushes her massive breasts out even further, causing her robe to creak dangerously, her tail wishes behind her.

"BEHOLD! Our God has been brought before us! We must bring him before the people, so that they may bask in his glory!"
1553322221.title: A God to A Race of Titans

choices: Another anthro enters the room before Mira can start talking!
15533222211.content:
Before you can even react, you are harmlessly pinched between two shark fingers that could have ended entire civilisations on their own. After several seconds spent between the rubbery digits, you are deposited onto the shark anthro's... Nose? Muzzle?

Off in the distance, the shark's country sized eyes focus on you, a wide grin almost splitting her face in two. The shark - and the other anthros - begin to walk, the thundering vibrations from their footfalls surpassing any earthquake imaginable. Your attention is drawn back to the shark as she begins to talk as quietly as she can. Given the fact that she rivalled Earth in size, if not surpassing it, the quietist voice she could manage was still one that overwhelmed all of your senses and seemed to come from all directions simultaneously.

"Don't worry, my Lord! We're going to bring you before your followers, then we can get you settled, and, heh, explain everything..."

Ears ringing, you blink and shake your head in an attempt to dispel the after effects of hearing the massive shark-woman's voice. Blushing, she begins to speak again, but significantly quieter this time.

"Sorry about that, my Lord... My name is Mira. I'm your head priestess, and it's an... honour, to finally lay eyes upon you Lord... Such an honour..."

Mira's eyes glaze over slightly, the anthro seemingly caught up in a moment of religious awe. You weren't sure why these utterly, utterly titanic beings viewed you as their god, or how they even bought you to this place, but you intended to find out after being introduced to your 'followers'. Hopefully you'd just be the god of a small cult or something.

You are quickly proven wrong when the small group of anthros arrive at what appears to be a balcon of some kind, forged out of more marble than could ever be found on Earth. Mira gently takes you onto a fingertip that stretches outwards in every direction.

"Ready to meet your followers, o Lord?"

A tiny smirk makes its way onto her face, ever so slightly amused by your stunned reaction to everything you had seen since being summoned by that machine. You still hadn't spoken a single word; your brain was still struggling to process everything that had happened in such a small amount of time. Mira moves her hand, allowing you to gaze down over the edge of the balcony. What you see would have rendered you speechless if you were not already so.

An innumerable crowd of anthros, all gazing up at you with rapt attention, their eyes widening and their mouths hanging open. So much for being the god of a tiny cult - it looked like you were the god of a major religion! A thunderous roar rises up from the crowd, each individual having their own reaction. Here, a wolf yelling praises; there, a lioness too stunned to do anything other than stare, her hands grasping a religious icon of some sort; and there, a donkey deep in prayer, her ears twitching every so often.

Eventually, Mira withdraws her finger from the edge of the balcony and re-enters the building. You hadn't been paying much attention to your surroundings before, but now you realise they are almost impossibly lavish, looking like the inside of a palace; impossibly expensive furniture adorns every room Mira carries you through, the deep red carpet complementing the dark brown wood that formed the majority of the furnishings. Eventually, Mira stops. Looking around, you realise you are in a bedroom that put even the other rooms to shame in terms of sheer opulence.

Almost every wooden surface seemed to be inlaid with gold leaf; a titanic four-poster bed dominates the far corner of the room, large paintings adorning every wall. The ceiling is made of marble; the walls and carpet the same deep, luxurious red as in the other rooms. A massive window with what appears to be silk curtains allows soft sunlight to filter in from the far end of the room.

Mira chuckles 'quietly' at your reaction to the sheer extravagance of the room. "Welcome to our room, my Lord! Since it's my duty to care for you due to the difference in scale between us, you'll be staying in here with me! But don't worry, Lord; if you'd look to the bedside table..."

Standing on the flat plane of the table is a tiny speck. On closer inspection, you realise that it is in fact, a massive house. Despite the size of the towering dwelling, it still pales in comparison to the table, which it is barely visible against.

"So, my Lord, I guess you'll want some explanations?"

Mira sits down on the bed, placing you on her snout again.

What happens next?
15533222211.title: Iapetus

1553322222.content: You wake up to find yourself in an alternate world populated by anthro versions of your friends, family, and neighbors. The weird thing is that no one even notices the difference. To them you are the exact size they are. This turns your chores into impossible tasks, playing with your friends dangerous, and walking to school a literal journey-of-a-thousand-steps. But even if your mother has to pick you up of the floor to bring you to the kitchen table she still doesn't acknowledge it...
1553322222.title: An Unequal Equal

15533222222.content:
Alright, let's shake things up a little bit!

You find yourself fading in and out of consciousness, vague memories being all that is left of each time you briefly regain consciousness. When you finally truly regain consciousness, you shortly discover that humanity is a precursor race - a la Mass Effect's Protheans - to a massive collection of species known as 'anthros', all of whom possess a level of technology that belongs in a sci-fi novel.

And humanity was even more advanced.

Was.

The anthros don't know what happened to the rest of humanity, but they have plenty of relics left behind by humankind, each and every single one of them defying understanding. Now, with a real, living, breathing, human, perhaps they can find out what happened?

No such luck. Your memories have been damaged and corrupted after untold millenia in stasis. As your memories begin to re-emerge and repair themselves, you begin to understand what happened to mankind - as well as the origins of the anthros.

Needless to say, this one will be sci-fi, with the rare human tech dwarfing even the anthro technology that would be considered impossible in real life.

So, do you want to go for a sci-fi scenario where humanity is a precursor race, or perhaps, would you like something else?
15533222222.title: No

155332222221.content:
Your eyes open a touch, most of your vision obscured by your eyelids. Everything is hazy, as if you were dreaming.

"Not supposed to...apply sedatives! Put... Cryo chamber!"

You can't see enough to focus on anything - all you can see is an ambiguous swirl of whites, greys, and blacks; you can hear, but the voices keep fading in and out. Your eyes close.

Your eyes open again.

"This one...waking up. Stop...in the future..."

Your eyes close.

Your eyes open.

"...Temperature is too low? Should...adjust?"

Your eyes close. Your eyes open. Your eyes close.

Your eyes open. All you can see is a swirling maelstrom of colours, yellows and reds swirling and clashing with purples, greens, and whites.

"...This one...bunker! Secure...indefinitely! Fallout shelter!"

Your eyes close.

Your eyes open.

"Alcubierre drive... Funding nations... United Kingdom; United States... Russia; France; Germany..."

Your eyes close.

[WARNING: MEMORY CORRUPTION DETECTED. RESTORE ATTEMPTED.]

Your eyes open.

"...Centauri... Failed Alcubierre... Indefinite cryo storage project..."

Your eyes close. Your eyes open. Your eyes close. Your eyes open.

"...Outrage!"
"...Affront to nature!"
"...Disgusting..."
"...Destroy them?"
"No."

Your eyes close. Open. Close. Open.

"...Ceti... Betelgeuse... League forces..."
"...Heavy casualties..."
"...Medivac, now!"
"Put him in cryo!"

[WARNING: MEMORY CORRUPTION DETECTED. ]
[ATTEMPTING RESTORE.]
[WARNING: RESTORE FAILED.]

Your eyes...

OPEN

You are suddenly jolted back into consciousness. Vision swimming, you flail your hand, looking for something to tell you where you are. Before you can react, you feel a deep, searing heat scorching your body for a millisecond.

Muscles aching, you fall forward, a loud clang assaulting your ears as you make contact with the floor.

Vision returning, you get to your hands and knees, ears ringing, and look around. A chamber greets your eyes. It is large yet small at the same time, the spacious room packed with rows upon rows of pods of some kind. It's too dark to discern the finer details of where you are.

Swallowing a lump in your throat, you begin to crawl forward on your hands and knees, joints and muscles screaming in protest. Breathing heavily, you collapse to the metal floor. Ripping off your helmet, you begin to gulp in stale, recycled air.

Wait, helmet?

You look at the unfamiliar helm that had previously adorned your head, all the while breathing as if you were getting paid for it. It is white, you can see that through the gloom. It is sleek and rounded, similar to a semicircle, except with large plates bolted to the side and top, forming a second shell that fully covers the sides, top and back, ruining the sleek and graceful appearance in exchange for protection.

Protection from what?

You don't know. A thin antenna extends from the top of the helmet, emerging from the right of the plated blocks that sever to protect the sides of your head. Perhaps it had a radio inside? The front of the helmet, where you see out of, is made out of what seems to be a thin glass-like substance that seemed to glow slightly, the slight blue light making it impossible to see inside the helmet. You notice that a couple of torches have been integrated into the armour blocks on the sides of the helm. They'd be good in your current situation, if you could get them to work.

Grabbing the helmet, you put it back on, rising unsteadily to your feet. You could look at what you were wearing once you got out of this place, it was obviously abandoned - looking around reveals small amounts of debris and detritus lying on the floor.

You make your way through the unknown environment, stumbling sound in the dark, trying to figure out how to activate your flashlights. Recalling the location of the flashlights on your helmet, you begin to think of possible switch locations. Suddenly, the flashlights switch on with an audible click, bathing the area in front of you in light.

The area was even more abandoned that you thought. The floor and walls were rusted slightly, wires and shards of glass haphazardly strewn across the floor; gurneys and tables upended and flipped here and there with no rhyme nor reason as to their placement. It was if a hurricane had swept through...wherever you are.

That... Was not encouraging. Okay, so; you're the only person in this place; you have no idea where this place is; your torches appear to be activated via thought; and you have no food or water.

What a brilliant situation you've found yourself in.

You continue to trudge through what you guess is an abandoned medical facility - crash carts and gurneys are common obstacles. Coming to what looks like a door, you halt. There's no handle, button, keypad, or anything that would indicate how to open it. It's a sheet of corrugated metal, for all intents and purposes. Great.

Once again, you think of possible places for switches to be hidden around the door, and, rather unexpectedly, the thing begins to retreat upwards into the doorframe with a torturous squeal, rust falling as it ascends.

Okay. It appeared that most things here were thought operated. You could question the why's and the how's later, for now you needed to get out.

You continue to walk onwards, the corridors of the abandoned facility contributing to a slowly increasing sense of claustrophobia and paranoia. Door after door withdraws upwards into the doorframe, your mind growing more unsettled as time goes on.

Where is everyone else? What happened to this place? Why is everything rusted? How long were you in cryo-sleep?

Cryo-sleep? Cryo-sleep. Freezing a person and then thawing them out so as to counteract the ageing process. But... You'd never been in cryo-sleep. That was pure science fiction. Something from movies and novels. You were just a normal person, living a normal life. Surely this was just a lucid dream?

You come to another door, this one much larger than the others. It's a blast door. On your prompting, powerful motors begin to whine from within the walls, and the blast door begins to ascend-

Allowing a powerful beam of sunlight to illuminate the dilapidated room you were in. Blinking, you look out on what you could see of the landscape. Lush, green meadows, bathing in gentle, warm sunlight, as far as you can see. The occasional field of wheat, growing unrestrained. Off in the distance, mountain ranges tower over all. And against the mountains, you can make out shapes, smudges too small to see, such was the distance between you and them.

You step out of the abandoned facility, armoured boot sinking into the ground, crushing grass beneath it. Licking your cracked and dried lips underneath your helmet, you figure you might as well see if you can find someone else who can ball you understand where you are and what has happened. And maybe investigate those smudges of colour against the mountains, while you're at it.

Rolling your shoulders, you begin to walk away from the rusted ruins, hopefully towards other people.
155332222221.title: Precursor

choices: It's too late! One of the anthros has noticed you!
The rifle fires a blue beam, and misses, hitting the mountains in the distance!
1553322222211.content:
(That feeling when you read a chapter after posting it and realise the Autocorrect had changed 'help' to 'ball')

You trudge through the green meadows of the strange land you have found yourself in, lost in a sea of questions and possible answers.

Question one: where are you?
Possible answers: uh... None.

Question two: is this real?
Possible answers: no idea. Uh... Hopefully not?

Question three: what are those smudges of colour against the mountains?
Possible answers: you have no frakking clue.

Well, that was productive, wasn't it? At least the landscape was pretty, with rolling green hills, a bright blue sky, and snow capped mountains in the distance. Mountains with smudges. Unsettling smudges. Mountains shouldn't have smudges.

You continue to walk onward, finding yourself grow slightly bored with the admittedly beautiful scenery. Sure, it was breathtaking, but shouldn't you have come across some woods or something by now? Rather than meadows, meadows, and more meadows?

As time goes on, the smudges become more clear and outlined, eventually allowing you to identify what they are.

To start off, they're huge. They look to be around a mile tall or so. Secondly, they're not smudges. Thirdly, they're utterly gigantic... Furries? Huh?

Whatever lucid dream your brain had cooked up, it was shaping up to be an extremely wierd one.

You can clearly identify them now, even from such a distance; it would probably take you a good half an hour to reach them, but they were just that big.
