There were three of them; a dragoness with blood red scales and comparatively short claws that could still shear pretty much anything in two; a black horse easily identifiable as a mare due to her body shape; and a grey wolfess, identifiable as a female for the same reason as the other two.

Their voices carry on the metaphorical wind, allowing you to eavesdrop a little.

"Anything in this one?"
"Nope. Nothing of value."
"Damn. Should we move on to the next site?"
"Let's."

The titanic trio turn, in your direction. Shit!

Caught like a deer in the headlights for a second, your body briefly siezes up before acting on unfamiliar instincts, your right hand grasping something attached to your hip before extending it at arms length.

It appeared to be a small block of metal, akin to the grip of a pistol, or perhaps the hilt of a sword. What puzzles you about it, however, is the small cloud of crystals floating in midair in front of the cylindral block, tiny bolts of electricity arcing between them. Suddenly, the crystals all move and shift, forming a shape in midair. There is a warm orange glow, and the shape - attached to the block - is revealed to be what seems to be a one handed rifle of some variety.

How the hell was a rifle meant to do anything against those... Those things?! They were all at least a mile tall, minimum! They were already walking in your direction, footfalls shaking the ground slightly.

You're scared, confused, and frightened. Swallowing, you try to assert some control over your terror-stricken body, but...
1553322222211.title: Emergence

15533222222112.content:
Before you can stop yourself, you've already pulled the trigger. A thin cyan beam shoots out of the barrel of the rifle, becoming invisible to your eyes a few feet away. You'd missed all three of the anthros, as impossible as that sounded, instead seeming to have hit the mountain behind them. Clearly, the rifle would 't be good for much if you couldn't aim in your current state, and if it had no visible effects. Taking a deep breath, you force your finger off the trigger, returning your attention to the gigantic furries slowly moving your way, engaged in their own conversation.

Suddenly, the clear sky seems just a bit clearer, the light blue a bit... Sharper. As if sensing this anomaly, the trio of anthros turn around, gazing up at the sky in confusion. The intensity of the sky's blue seems to increase steadily, before the intense blue seems to... Contract, towards a single point, and-

Your entire field of view is filled with a terrible flash of blue for a second that seems to last for an eternity, accompanied by a crash of thunder so loud that even the anthros seem to be uncomfortable. A single azure bolt, flung down from on high, strikes the mountain, travelling through miles and miles of rock with infinite ease. The beam vaporises anything it touches, plunging through the mountain and deep into the earth.

Gravity very quickly starts to catch up with the situation, however, as tonne after to be of stone begins to crumble away and fall into the yawning chasm created by your accidental destruction of a land feature.

The three anthros stand, stunned and slack-jawed, gawping at the scene of destruction. You, however, are not so affected, and are already running as fast as you can. The rifle in your hand dissolves into the crystal cloud once again, surrounding the 'grip' as it somehow floats out of your hand even as you sprint, adding themselves to it and encasing it within themselves. The larger cube speeds along with you, floating down to and attaching to the armour on your hip, where it remains in place.

You sprint through the meadows, back towards the way you came. You didn't know if the anthros were hostile or not, but you didn't want to find out, especially after accidentally punching a hole through a mountain.

What had happened, anyway?! Where did that beam come from?!

High Energy Laser; HEL. First iteration developed in the European Federation in the mid twenty first century during the second Space Race. Iteration Pisces recommended for use of low-value strategic targets and colonies.

European Federation? Second Space Race? Low-value strategic targets?!

Your mind briefly freezes as the information is dumped into it - or possible unlocked from deep within it? Either way, you fall flat on your front, crushing a fair few flowers.

You can hear the anthros off in the distance.

"What..."
"Why, how?"
"Perhaps it - we triggered some kind of security system in the last human base?"

You try to move, but you can't. Your legs simply won't respond to your commands.

"Lexi, I think I see... Tracks? Do you think you can track whatever they belong to? If they're intelligent they may be able to tell us what the hell that was."
"You always seem to refer to the humans' old robots as if they were anthros."
"They might as well be, they're just a bit... Small."
"Ssh! I'm picking up a scent!"

Oh hell no! No no no no no! You begin to drag yourself away, for all the good that it does.

"Okay, I know where they are. Perhaps it's one of the humans' bio-droids? I think they can feel emotion..."
"What kind of emotions are you sensing?"
"Uh... Fear. And confusion. In that order. Then, panic."
"Poor thing must be scared out of their mind..."

The ground begins to quake in an unsteady rhythm as the wolfess leads the dragon and horse towards you. Panic once again sets in and your heart races, your breaths coming short and ragged.

"Here we go... Hm. This doesn't look like a bio-droid."
"Is that armour?"

You can see a massive shadow swallow your surroundings, growing darker as two huge fingers approach you. As if on instinct, a mental switch is flipped, and you are encased within a shimmering blue field, your armour glowing slightly. The two grey furred fingers gently lift you up, and you are deposited into the palm of a white furred hand, belonging to the wolfess.

"Hey there little guy... Don't worry, we won't hurt you..."
"Do you think you could tell us what you are?"

Swallowing, you keep your gaze locked downwards, being deposited in the same position you were in when picked up; that is, laying on your front.

"I'm a human."
15533222222112.title: Desuper Mortis

155332222221121.content:
Everything had happened so quickly since then.

The three anthros, whom you now know are called Lexi - the wolfess - Equina - the horse - and Lotus - the dragoness - had at first expressed disbelief, believing you to be something they called a 'Bio-droid'; something that was apparently a creation of humanity. That had changed when you had started to move about on Lexi's palm. For starters, you had four fingers and a thumb on each hand. Bio-droids had two fingers and one thumb. You also had hair, which bio-droids lacked - you had taken off your helmet in order to scratch. In addition, most bio-droids had facial markings or tattoos of sorts, which you lacked. Your movements were also much more fluid than those of a bio-droid, who were apparently somewhat jerky when it came to walking and other activities.

You still weren't sure exactly what a bio-droid was, although from what you had learned from the three anthros it seemed to be a biological android of some sorts, or something similar to that. You also knew that bio-droids were created by humanity.

Your situation was an odd one, to say the least. Your memory corrupted and damaged, you exited a stasis pod and made your way to the outside world, coming across the anthros after a short trek. After accidentally reactivating an ancient planetary defense grid and vaporising several miles of mountain, you'd been found by the aforementioned three anthros.

You'd been taking time to learn about what exactly happened to the ready of humanity. Apparently, humanity was long gone, having vanished many dozens of millenia ago, if not further back in the time abyss. Gigantic anthro animals had arisen from different worlds across the galaxy and, using technology reverse engineered from that of your species, had managed to traverse the stars, eventually all joining under the same banner. Humankind was revered as a precursor species, and finding human artifacts and technology was a lucrative business.

You'd been on this ship for a few days now. It belonged to the three anthros, who worked together to find lost human bases and whatever was contained within them. They were taking you back to inhabited space, but the journey would take a while, even at FTL speeds. Adapting to your situation had proven to be difficult, however. The nature of your memory corruption meant that any number of words and phrases could trigger a flood of information and previously forgotten memories. Case in point, Equina had mentioned the method of FTL travel, an Alcubierre drive, and you had spent the next few minutes with a thousand-yard stare as your brain infodumped everything it could relating to the Alcubierre drive into your memory.

Handling had proven to be a non-issue. Your armour had the ability to project a powerful forcefield that prevented damage to you, and even without it your body had proven resilient enough to allow for light handling, such as picking up and light stroking.

The anthros seemed to like stroking you. You weren't sure why, but according to them it seemed to help bring you out of your almost-catatonic state when something triggered your memory. Perhaps it was the physical contact?

The three anthros had been gently probing you for information in an attempt to help restore your memory. It had been moderately successful thus far. This probing brought you to your current situation:

"What do you mean, you can't remember your name?"

You shrug, looking up at the forms of the three anthros. Equina seemed to be biting her lip, while Lexi and Lotus displayed dismay and uncertainty, respectively.

"It means I can't remember. Usually, I get one of those memory infodumps, but this time there's nothing. I guess part of the memory corruption from the cryosleep means I can't remember my name."

Equina's eyes slowly widen, the black mare seemingly realising something.

"That means we get to name you!"
Your hand, meanwhile, has quickly found its way to your forehead.
"Oh god, no..."
Equina, however, is not to be discouraged.
"Think about it! We could give you a name that's all mysterious, because of how little we know about humans - even with you here - or maybe one that sounds royal and important, because of how advanced most anthros think your culture must have been!"

Looking down at the plane of a single red scale, then up into Lotus' bemused face, you sigh.

"Fine. If you're so set on coming up with a name for me, then to ahead. Just don't go overboard... Please?"

Equina's muzzle lights up like a Christmas tree.
"Thank you so much! Don't worry, I won't go overboard! Now, where'd I put my notes..."
And with that, Equina trots off, allowing you to see a portion of the steel-grey ceiling several miles overhead.

Looking up into Lexi's muzzle, you attract her attention by clicking your fingers. The senses of anthros were so sensitive that they could hear you talking, even with the size disparity.
"Uh, Lexi, how long until we reach civilised space?"
The wolfess quickly checks a holographic datapad of some kind.
"Just under a week. Sorry, little guy, it's gonna take a while."
"Yeah. I guess it is..."
155332222221121.title: Iter Stellis

1553322222211211.content:
You slowly walk forward, your metal boots leaving imprints on the ash beneath your feet. Halting, you look at your surroundings. Everything was dead. The rocky ground was blackened and charred, and coated with ash; that same ash choked the air and blotted out most of the red sky. The black stumps of what had once been trees could be seen every so often, large piles of ash signifying where the limbs had been powderized. Much of the cracked and dried earth had been turned into glass, such was the heat that had scoured the landscape mere hours ago.

A dead moon hung in the sky, the titanic gashes on its surface visible even from your location. A good portion of the celestial body had been destroyed almost completely, the interstellar debris settling in a loose orbit around the planet. It was hard to believe, given the devastation, but where you stood had once been a jungle. Now all that was left of the mighty trees and innumerable life forms was a stifling cloud of ash.

It had been months since you had last set foot on a fertile world. And yet, you knew that this destruction - this sacrifice of planets, solar systems, and even galaxies - was completely and utterly necessary. Perhaps if there had been more than two sapient races in the entire cosmos, then this war would never have come to pass.

You jolt awake, limbs spasming for a few seconds before you realise where you are. You're on Equina, sleeping in her thick fur. The mare was holding you in her sleep, much like how a child would hold a teddy bear. If that teddy bear was a good thousand times smaller than the child. Despite Equina's best efforts, she had not yet been able to come up with a name that she felt was suitable.

In addition, the ship was almost out of solid fuel, so it had been parked in a mostly empty solar system in order to use solar energy to charge the backup batteries for the FTL drive. This would add a few more days onto the journey back to civilised space, but from what you had heard, the group that employed the three furries you were with had let word slip about having found an actual human. This had resulted in what could best be described as a media firestorm. This, coupled with a video of you that Lexi had taken with your consent, had whipped up the public into a frenzy. At least, that was what you gathered while surfing the Internet analogue the galaxy's society used. You had even prepared several short posts about what you remembered, to be placed on various sites; however, that would not be happening until you reached civilised space and were shown to the public.

Sighing, you think about what to do, listening to the steady rhythm of Equina's breathing...
1553322222211211.title: Continuum

15533222222112112.content:
Deciding that it would be much easier to go back to sleep and be woken up later rather than keep yourself awake until Equina woke up, you lay down and snuggle up to Equina's warm body. You were currently in your undersuit, which was a simple outfit composed of grey fabric designed to prevent chafing while wearing your armour. It was actually rather comfortable, and served to help lock in the heat you received from Equina's body. Shifting onto your front, you lay your head down and feel yourself slowly drift off into sleep.

Hopefully you wouldn't have a dream like the last one.

---


"You know what this means, girl?! You're gonna be a soldier!"
You jump up, wrapping your arms around Seva's thick neck as you do so. The bio-engineered horse nickers loudly, pressing the side of her muzzle into your cheek. A few locks of her dull pink mane fall over your eyes, but you don't mind. Pressing yourself into Seva's grey pelt, you take a moment to reflect on just how lucky you are.

First, there's the farm. Farming itself was rare except in agricultural sectors like yours. Farming had been in the family for generations. Secondly, you had Seva. The caring mare had been genetically engineered to pull farming equipment weighing a few hundred kilograms or so - something easily shown by her huge ten foot body and the rippling muscles underneath her pelt. Those living in hives or hub zones would probably consider her a monster. You had to admit, from a different point of view, Seva probably was a monster. Her massive body, coupled with her ungodly strength, extreme intelligence, and rock hard hooves would give any city dweller approaching her pause, and for good reason. You saw the power of those muscles every day, and were reminded of her size each time you looked at her.

And yet, to you, she was completely gentle. Given the local wildlife, which was hazardous to say the least, Seva had been built to be a protector as much as a beast of burden. You could see the intelligence behind her eyes; behind her actions. She had even saved your life on a few occasions. Those hooves of hers were remarkably effective against any marauding beast seeking to make a meal out of you and your crops.

But now, Seva had a higher purpose in the grand scheme of things. You were due to be drafted - your letter had arrived in the mail, over the phone, over the vid-screen - but you had sent an enquiry to the local defense force, asking what would happen to your beloved Seva. In response, they had sent an inspector round to test her personality and take samples of her blood and skin.

And now, Seva was going to become an anthro. Her form would be twisted and reshaped, her whole body enlargened by an order of magnitude; she would be a living superweapon, one of thousands. And you would be her Handler, fighting the Shadow alongside her mighty form as her footfalls caused the very ground itself to shake.

Science sure was beautiful.

---


"By the galaxy's arms! I really do wonder how you got here. Weren't you drafted?"
You grin. "Yup! Klimen Agricultural Sector D-10, draft 3. To be honest, I'm not quite sure how I ended up here."

Matthias claps you around the back, the clanging of metal on metal resounding throughout the corridors. "None of us are! That's the thing about the Psi-Corps; you never know how you got here, except that you were destined for it." You snort, giving the dark skinned soldier a condescending look. "Destiny, Matthias? Really?"

Matthias simply smiles, showing off a set of white teeth. He looks you in the eyes with his brown pupils, the grin never leaving his face. "Yeah, destiny! Don't tell me you think there's any other way a farm boy like yourself can end up being able to kill things with his mind, on top of having his own personal anthro! Talking about anthros, how's Seva been doing lately?"

Reaching a door, you wait a few seconds to reply as the steely blue bulkhead rises into the ceiling. "She's been doing pretty well. She's even lead a couple of charges against those Shadow bastards herself! She's shrugged off so much ordnance I'm starting to think she's invincible. I'm still backing up her personality and genetic data, though. Not like I'll ever need it, though."

---


"Yesa's nails, I think I've been hit!"
You collapse backwards, your entire body aching.
"Damnit, I've been hit hard! I think they have a Titan Killer somewhere around here!" You hiss into your radio.
Granted, you were fine. Your Impervium armour meant that you were safe and sound, and that the monstrous projectile - one meant to penetrate starships and wound anthros - had ricocheted off in another direction.

The kinetic impact of the projectile in question, however, had ruined your ability to fight. You'd probably suffered several broken ribs, at the very least. Growling, you rip your handgun from its position on your thigh. Designed to launch hundreds of tiny homing rockets, the Marus-Klein was the bane of Shadow snipers in any theatre of war. Pulling the trigger, you sweep the sights of the weapon over the orange cliffs in the distance, and are rewarded with a few tonnes of rock being blown clear off, falling into the dunes below and kicking up huge clouds of sand.

"Don't worry, I'm coming!"
Seva's voice fills your helmet as the ground quakes. You feel yourself being delicately lifted high up into the air, Seva's face and muzzle greeting you as tiny explosions harmlessly pepper her skin. "I'd better get you to the medic then, considering how you can't even move now. Good thing you have that armour."

Seva begins walking back to your lines, and you can hear countless numbers of your own troops and vehicles thundering past to fill the space where she just was.

"How many times have I saved your life now? I need to start a tally."

---


You jolt awake, sweating heavily. This was momentous, you were recovering so many of your memories! And just by sleeping! Looking up, you see Equina peering down at you. "Are you okay? I was trying to wake you up for the past minute." She states in a worried tone. You grin up at her. "I'm brilliant, I... I just remembered so much! God, I think I'm beginning to unscramble my memory!"
15533222222112112.title: Seva

155332222221121121.content:
"Lexi, could you put the camera down here for a second? Thanks. Tell me when I'm in focus."

You slowly walk backwards from the sloping contours of the camera, its monolithic lens whirring as it slowly focused on you. You hear Lexi's voice from overhead. "You're in focus!" Shooting Lexi a grin, you turn back to the camera that currently occupies your field of vision. "Uh, hey. You guys remember how no matter what, I can't remember my name? Well, Equina's been having trouble coming up with a name for me, so I thought I'd ask you guys to come up with some. Maybe if it's good enough I'll use it!"

Looking up at Lexi, you ask "you guys have forums and comment sections, right?" Receiving an affirmation from Lexi, you turn back to the camera. "So, send in some ideas! Equina can only do so much on her own! Also, in other news, I'll be keeping a dream journal from today - I'll also be writing down what I've dreamed so far. Hopefully I'll be able to reconstruct my memory, given enough time."

---


"Seva? Can you hear me, girl?"
Standing beside Seva's mountainous form, you can't help but feel intimidated by what she has become, and what she now represents. Her chest steadily rises and falls, her sleeping form breathing in a slow rhythm. In... out... in... out. ..

Now would be your first experience with Seva as an anthro. Gone was the protective hulk of a genemodded farm animal. In its place was a testament to humanity's ingenuity and strength. And you were to be her handler. You would be with her almost constantly, helping her to adapt to her new form, its size, her new duties, and so forth. In addition, where one of you went, the other would go. Due to this, any regiment could suddenly find itself with support of the heaviest calibre.

Fidgeting, you begin to draw closer to Seva's form. Training had not been what you were expecting. Media, both relatively new and centuries old, depicted boot camps as places where raw recruits were processed and trained into killing machines through physical punishment, regular training, and copious amounts of push-ups. Boot camps were not depicted as places where raw recruits were placed into simulated reality machines with their perception of time altered to such a degree that a month of training could take only a day in real time, while their bodies were slowly modified in real time. This meant that every soldier, no matter their background or previous build, was now impressively muscled, slightly taller than average, and had been trained for several 'years'.

Reaching out, you gently brush Seva's grey fur with the back of your hand. Immediately, she begins to stir, stretching her cracking limbs and groaning from the kind of exhaustion only waking up could make you feel.

Seva turns her gargantuan head, freezing when she catches sight of you. "Master?" Her voice causes the white walls of the sterile chamber to vibrate slightly, so loud and deep it is. "No, not Master, Seva. Not any more." Seva gently plucks you from the ground, your suit's forcefield activating as she does so. Holding you up to her muzzle, Seva stares intently at your comparitively miniscule form.

"But... If you're not my master, then what are you?"

"Three things. Your handler; your teacher; and hopefully, your friend."
155332222221121121.title: Fray

1553322222211211211.content:
Rifle held at the ready, you slowly move through the building. Your motion sensors weren't picking anything up, but that didn't necessarily mean that you were alone. In retrospect, ceramic rounds had indeed been a wise choice.

Looking back on things, the Shadow had been easy compared to the threat the Siphon now posed.

Halting, you observe your surroundings. The tattered carpet and furniture were covered in a thin film of silver dust. Probably a bad sign, but you'd need to check to see if your suspicions were true before acting on them.
You look to the temperature sensor of your HUD. It was dropping, and fast.

You throw yourself to the floor, just in time to avoid a white-hot energy beam passing overhead. The walls warp and melt slightly from the sheer heat, but your suit protects you. Unfortunately, you're now up against an incredibly dangerous foe.

Launching yourself to your feet and turning around as you do so, you get a clear look at your enemy for just under a second. Aided by cybernetics and gene therapy, it feels like hours, allowing you to pick out every single detail. A vaguely wormlike form, composed of writhing silver particles that seemed to emerge from the floor. The end of the shape that was facing you had split open, revealing a firey, molten core that rapidly cooled, its energy directed into the missed beam attack.

You're already firing, and at full auto, no less, even as the Siphon disintegrates, its particulates whizzing in every direction. The temperature continues to drop, frost beginning to form on the warped and melted remains of the room. It reforms into a humanoid shape, the head and arms split open and glowing blue. You fire another burst and the Siphon staggers, steam pouring off its shuddering form.

You fire in full auto again, holding the trigger of your boxy rifle all the way down. Shards are blasted clean off of the Siphon, dissipating into dust before they hit the floor. The Siphon seems to burst into a cloud and, for a second, it seems your work may be done. The cloud quickly surges toward you in the form of an argent stream, knocking you onto your back as your rifle tumbles from your grip. A section of the Siphon - now solidified into a lump covering your torso and pinning you against the floor - rips off, seizing your rifle. The gun dissolves into thousands of minute silver particles, which incorporate themselves into the form of the second Siphon.

The second Siphon swells larger, its mass augmented by the assimilated heavy rifle. It morphs into a long and slender wormlike form, slithering towards you while the first Siphon extends itself and pins your arms and legs, preventing you from struggling further. The second Siphon presses its end against your faceplate, allowing you to see as it splits open, revealing a tiny red core.

As the temperature in the room plummets to subzero levels, the Siphon's core begins to burn brighter and brighter, becoming hard to look at even through your helmet. Though you try to struggle, you are completely immobilized. A single beam of energy lances out from the head of the Siphon, beginning the slow, slow process of drilling through your faceplate. Considering the fact that your armour had originally been designed to assist with both solar core and black hole mining, it was going to take quite a while.

This was, you decide, the worst possible time for comms to be knocked offline. The Siphons had detonated an antimatter bomb sometime during the battle, and almost everything planetside had been knocked offline if not partially melted. Your suit had only been functioning due to multiple backup generators, several of which had either been burnt out or failed to function properly. There was one thing you could try, though.

While Siphons could absorb heat directly from the environment, they could still be damaged by it. As their strategy of immobilizing soldiers and then drilling through their helmets became clear, the Solar League had deemed it necessary to augment the already fearsome abilities of the Kayath power armour even further.

Rapidly blink-clicking through your HUD, you arrive at what you're looking for. Clicking the icon, you look back to the temperature gauge as it instantly spikes, your suit glowing white-hot as the temperature climbs effortlessly into the hundreds of degrees. The Siphons shriek - one of the few times you've heard them make any sound at all - and although they attempt to scatter their individual particles, they quickly melt from the heat your suit is emitting. One of the few weaknesses Siphons had was rapidly changing temperatures.

Disengaging the anti-Siphon Temperature Spiker, you clamber back to your feet, running your hands over shards of the Siphons that had fused to your suit during their death. While the Spiker was extremely effective, it was best not to get too dependent on it, lest the Siphon find a way to counter it.

As indicated by your lack of a weapon, you'd be relying on your energy projectors in any upcoming fights. Boots thumping as you begin to walk through the desolated habitation complex, you once again think on just how much you hate operating without anthro support, and especially without Seva. Operating without anthro support typically meant lots of close range fighting and activation of of the Temperature Spiker. On the other hand, operating with anthro support typically resulted in every Siphon within a mile radius combining into a single, titanic Siphon, which any non-anthro would be hard pressed to damage.

As deadly as the Shadow had been, even they couldn't fuse with one another. The current war was looking to be even longer and more destructive than the last; two Kardashev civilizations butting heads again and again until one finally submitted.

---


"Feels good to be able to relax again. Especially given how long our leave is."

Seva looks down at you, nestled safely in the thick grey fur of her shoulder. "How long is this leave, exactly?" she asks.

"Twenty years!" you say, grinning.

"Are you sure? That seems a bit excessive."

You nod. "The latest major battle is over, and it's going to take a long time before there's another one. Maybe a few decades, if we're lucky - lightspeed can only get you somewhere so fast, after all. They're swapping in most of the ones who were off duty. They're also planning to use more bio-droids and drones in the future to decrease the risk of not having enough soldiers."

Seva hums as she digests the information. "What about anthros?"

"Anthros are going to be deployed where they're most needed. League's planning on... Upgrading the next wave. Making them even bigger and stronger than the last. Apparently, the League is aiming for them to be at least two miles tall."
1553322222211211211.title: Nautilus

15533222222112112111.content:
"Hm. Impressive."

The room slowly fades in around you and Seva, its textures blurry and indistinct before they melt in. Seva, currently eye level to you, brushes a lock of pink hair out of her eyes. The mare swallows thickly.

"Boxing? Are you sure?"
You snort through your nostrils before phasing into the area marked by a red square on the floor. The room seemed almost sterile, all white tiles and no rubbish to be seen anywhere.

"Not boxing. Sparring. And also testing the VR system. Make sure you're getting feedback properly; pain's been reduced but you should still feel force."

You clench your fingers into fists before flexing them, and proceeding to give your torso a pat-down. Seva nervously does the same, glancing at you every few seconds. Rapping at different points on your body with your fists, you take note of the sensation caused by it. So far, the simulation seems accurate to realspace.

"Ready, Seva?"
The mare shuffles her large hooves, her mouth open as if caught in the middle of taking a deep breath.
"I... I guess so. Let's get this over with..."

Heavily padded hand safety gear materializes around both your fists and Seva's. You assume a guarded position; your right fist out in front, your left tucked into your chin, your right foot out in front. Seva responds with a more aggressive position, positioning both of her forearms facing outwards in front of her muzzle, fists clenched. She leaves herself just enough room to see through the gap between her arms.

You begin to slowly circle each other, locked into a staring match. You pause, and Seva does also, her eyes taking in your form, trying to see any muscle movements that would give away your next move. You begin to circle Seva once more, and she begins to circle you in kind.

---


"Get down on the goddamn ground before I shove a bayonet so far up your arse that it'll be sticking through your throat! One of you, restrain this son of a bitch!

"High Command, we've just detained a traitor. Fifth Artillery Regiment. Deliberately attempted to cause a friendly fire incident with an Earthcracker class gun.

"Roger that, High Command. YOU! You're coming with me!"

---

Ducking under Seva's swing, you counter with an uppercut that lands squarely on the underside of her muzzle. Dazed, the mare stumbles backwards as you advance. However, Seva isn't out yet, and you find yourself having to move outside of the range of the punches she throws. Seva once again begins moving forward, forcing you to move backwards to avoid being hit.

---

"Semi-baryonic assault units spotted."
"Roger. Target all enemy units and fire. Full power."

---

Twisting, you use your outer forearm to smash Seva's punch away from your body. Your other hand is already cocked, so to speak, and the punch you throw connects solidly with Seva's torso. Two more punches slam into the mare's torso, before you step inside her failing guard, your elbow smashing into the side of her muzzle as you twist. Seva's arms pinwheel for a brief moment as she falls backwards, landing with a loud thump. As quickly as you can, you're straddling her torso, putting your full weight on her. You press down on her throat with your forearm.

"Yield to me..."

"Yield to me!"

"YIELD!"
15533222222112112111.title: Virtua

155332222222.content:
Hive:

After a dream filled with unidentifiable voices and the buzzing of wings, you wake up to find yourself within what appears to be what appears to an indescribably massive beehive. The inhabitants of this hive quickly make themselves known; titanic anthropomorphic bees, ants, butterflies and more, ranging in size from just a mile to being so huge that they dwarf entire countries. However, even amidst this strange discovery, two things in particular stand out in terms of strangeness:

One, you're the ruler of this hive - and the only human in existence in this new, warped reality.

And two: you share a psychic connection with every member of your hive. Every member.

Let's hope you can find a way to tune out all of the voices in your head while simultaneously relearning all of the skills needed to guide and safeguard the members of your hive!
155332222222.title: Something else

1553322222221.content:
Thud. Thud. Thud.

You groan audibly, clawing at your forehead with your right hand. Your mind feels like it's being assaulted by a thousand tiny needles, each stabbing your brain one by one. Your left eye twitches open, only to close moments later as your brain copes with the new strangw sensations taking hold of it.

Thud. Thud. Thud.

Loud banging assaults your ears again and again. Despite how difficult thinking seemed to be right now, you tried desperately to focus on the sound. As the thuds continued, you eventually desciphered the earth-shattering quakes...to be footsteps.

THUD. THUD. THUD.

Finally, the pain in your brain begins to fade as new neural pathways suddenly opej up, streaming in a wide array of information to your alert consciousness. Focusing on the thoughts now pouring in, leaving you not entirely sure why you're thinking these things, you notice a pattern. Disembodied voices say how worried they are about their "King", how they fear the worst for their "King", how they wish the "King" would wake up. The voices in your head were a very powerful impulse, and, slowly, you tried to open your eyes...

THUD.

Your eyes snap open, your bruised body suddenly alert. You struggle to take in the information in front of you. You appear to be perched upon an absolutely GIGANTIC...thing, that smelled vaguely like honey. And infront of you stood a gigantic black wall of some sort. Drawing your eyes upwards, it seemed that the thing extended for a very, very long time... untill...

"My king! You've awakened!" spoke a deafening, feminine voice. Of course, you could hardly focus on the words as you stared at what appeared to be an anthromorphic bee, standing many miles tall above you. This is...unique...
1553322222221.title: Hivemind

15533222222212.content:
What a strange dream. You felt like some kind of gigantic anthropomorphic insects were trying to convince you that you had to help them.. Crazy stuff, especially since their size were certainly not realistic in any manner.

Either way, given it was but a dream, you manage to woke up. A warm yellow light was greeting you as you try to open your rubs, still trying to unstiff your body from your slumber. After you stretch, you idly place your hands onto your 'bed'... For some reasons, you had the feeling it was actually softer than before, and yellow, and strangely furrier than you thought. Surely it was actually another dream, so you pinch your hand. Hard at that. You couldn't be helped but let a yelp of pain, getting distressed when you notice you weren't in your bedroom anymore.

The surroundings were covered in some kind of honey sockets, if you except that they were huge. A huge opening leading onto an unknown path was found onto one of the walls, but seemingly too far to reach as of yet.
Near the fuzzy bed was standing a large pillar, seemingly yellow and black in color, and from onto which were.. Large and black tree trunks..? Given the fact that remaining immobile wouldn't get you any answers to your problem, you decide to set off onto the large fur toward the pillar. If you could climb it, surely you'd had an easier time knowing what was going on..

As you walked toward the large pillar, it suddenly started to move, turning itself toward you, revealing.. Two gigantic furry mounds that looked like they were the size of mountains. As you manage to peer up, you see a triangular shape, from onto which you could see the tree-trunks things.. And what was just underneath. It looked like some kind of human-bee head hybrid, and it certainly looked like it was actually living, and smart, before she.. you suppose it'd be a female, given the mounds, before she does what you think is an onimously smile. And, before you could've done anything, you suddenly felt like you were lifted up in the air, but rather than to be brutally thrown or moved, you were merely gotten nearer the head thing. Pretty gently at that.

Suddenly you grab your head, and you wince in pain, as something was trying to enter your mind. It sounded like a feminine voice, but so loud you could've sworn it'd deafen you, so you flail, trying to escape that intrusion, before you could hear the voice more distinctly. 'Are you alright, Milady..?'. Milady? What the voice is speaking of? And where does it come from?! Out of fear, you yell, 'L-let me off at o-once you-you... T-thing..!'. Visibly, it had an impact, given the bee-human thing was starting to sob, making you wonder if she was really meaning to harm you, but not to the point of relaxing.

Then, the voice spoke up again, harmful enough to make you hold your head again, but not as painful as the previous time. 'You don't have to be afraid of me, Milady..! I am but your humble servitor'. What's wrong with that voice? She's not some kind of monarch of anything..! Out of anger, and with a stutter from your fear, you answer, 'R-reveal yourself..!'. You could hear some kind of very heavy sigh, before the voice occurs again, 'What are you speaking about, Milady. I've been standing with you since you got injured. You have nothing to fear since you are safe within our kingdom.'. Things were still hazy in your mind, but at least, you started to understand a few things. 'A-are you the one speaking to me? Why i'm here. Where is here. And why did you called me 'Milady'..?'.

The beegirl had been silent for a moment before she speaks up again, 'It's worst than i thought.. They really struck your head hard. it was a good thing that we managed to retrieve you..!'. You tilt your head, lost once more. 'What do you mean by retrieved..? You kidnapped me from my house..!'. The beegirl facepalms and take a sip from one of the nearby sockets, before she, ever so carefully and surprisingly precisely, pours just enough honey to fill your mouth, before she forces the sweet in your mouth ever so gently with a finger. You muffle in rage, 'W-what are you..!', before an excruciating pain rushes through your body. Countless voices echoed in your mind. All different, yet.. Familiar? You could also sense that they were all from insect beings, and all were.. Greeting you as their Queen! And so, before you pass out from the pressure.

When you woke up, something was wrong. All you could see was a thick yellow fuzzy fur, and you.. Had the feeling someone was kissing you, and pretty lovingly at that.. When it stopped, you felt like you lost something, as you notice it was the same beegirl as before you passed out. The beegirl inquires you, 'How was it..?'. You couldn't tell if she was speaking of the 'greeting' or her kiss, so you decide to say, 'Pretty painful to hear all thoses voices. And a surprisingly pleasant kiss.. But then, why are you saying i'm your queen..?'. The beegirl giggles softly at the comments, then she says, 'Because you are, and you always were since you were born. It's just that you forgot it because of amneia.. Right?'. You calmly say, 'I guess so.. But.. J-just out of my mind.. How big you are, actually, and what is your name?'.
The beegirl's expression changes up, like she was shocked, just like what you said was just.. Wrong. But as you continue to look at her, she smiles weakly and says, 'S-sorry. I-i'm not used to have such attention from you. You were certainly a fair and loved queen, but it was toward all our brethren. Not.. T-toward me in particular. As such, i think i should show you something..'.

The beegirl had placed you onto her shoulder and was walking around the hive, after she went up into the pathway from the room you were in. As you look around, you could've seen that it was some kind of underground town, whose size would put continents at shame. And it was full of living anthro insects of all kind, and you noticed a few things about them. They were all around a size in miles, all of them were greeting you in a very friendly manner, and almost all of them were.. Smaller than the beegirl you were standing on, making you wonder who she was exactly. While you were giving some thought, you notice that you were heading some kind of castle, or so you think, given what you could gather from your sight. As your friend steps inside, you felt like a sense of honor, like the place had a special meaning to you, before she takes a turn and brings you into a large bedroom, for their size at least.

You would've thought that the bedroom would actually be more regally furnished, until you notice the wooden desk. Then a rush of memories occured in your mind, reminding of your past life, *here*. You had a flashback of your childhood, playing happily with the other insect kids, while sharing a real friendship despite the size difference, and, as you dug deeper in your mind, you've been reminded of two important things: You are Cythim, the queen of this prosperous hive, and the beegirl, is your sister and her name is Tlacamela.
After that flashback, you had a single tear drop from your visage, before you eagerly hug your sister's neck. She says, 'W-what's up..?'. And, in answer, you say, 'Nothing, lil' sister. Everything's fine.. Now let's get back at work, if you want? But Together, okay?'. The beegirl nods and smiles. Standing at a size of 22 miles, she was among the tallest of the bugs because she was of a royal blood, much like you.
15533222222212.title: A hive's redemption?

1553322222222.content:
There's a reason nobody swims in the sea. Swimming pools? Sure, that water's been purified. But the sea itself? The sea is cold. Unnaturally cold. Almost nothing lives in the sea. We have those barriers that stop people from going any farther than the beaches. But you? Well, you had to go overboard, didn't you? You're lucky they fished you out, given how small you are.

Course, it ain't every sea that's like this. Just one. The one you and your team were studying. Guess you all found out why us anthros are born with an instinctive fear of the ocean. And what happens if you actually touch the ocean.

Good thing that little research outpost can care for you. Especially given all those migraines and the memory loss and the whole shrinking and turning into a different species thing.

The Dirac Sea. Ominous, huh? Guess you must be the only one in history to actually take a plunge in that thing, even if it was accidental. Let's just hope you can adapt to your new life, huh?
1553322222222.title: Frigid Cold

15533222222222.content: You are the owner of the city's most popular strip club. Dozens of patrons visit every night and on your best nights you could expect that number to rise into the hundreds. The club was your pride and joy. You made lots of money. The Girls absolutely adored you and there was plenty to drink! There was just one itty bitty little problem. The girls, your patrons, and apparently everyone else in this world is a giant anthro.
15533222222222.title: Club Anthro

155332222222222.content:
Similar to 'Paradox' and 'God among Titans' storylines.

You're just an average person living their life until one day a weird portal appears near you and sucks you in. Apparently a tribe of giant anthro females used ancient magic to bring you their God into their world. Despite the lack of modern touches like electricity, paved roads, or plumbing you find yourself liking this primitive world.
155332222222222.title: Tribal Deity

1553322222222222.content:
Similar to the "Microcracy" storyline. You are the Dictator of an entire country populated by macro anthros. Think "Tropico, Papers Please or North Korea". There is a cult of personality built around you so your people look up to you like a father or in some cases a god on earth. Your loyal army brings more lands under your rule, your people follow your every command and your personal 'Pleasure Squad' sees to your every need...

Glory to Macronia! All Hail the Supreme Leader!
1553322222222222.title: Hail the Supreme Leader!

choices: Shall We Play A Game ? (Decide on who your Generals are and where to inavde?)
Ruling a Country 101 (Head to your private chambers and get some answers!)
15533222222222221.content:
You slowly wake up with a yawn as you don't remember ever having such a good night's sleep. You slowly sit up and wipe the sleep out of your eyes as you couldn't help but feel...different somehow. As you look down at yourself, you suddenly realize what's different as your clothes and bed are made from the finest silk! Not only that, but the bed looked like it went on for miles as you could just barely make out the end of the bed. You weren't sure if this was some kind of a joke or a dream but you liked where it was going! Still, if this really was dream. Then where were the girls?

"Good morning Sir! How did you sleep?" A hevenly female voice said from behind you as it seemed your dream....slowly turned into a nightmare! Instead of the beautiful bikini model you were expecting, you were greeted by a giant female bunny anthro in a maid's outfit! She gives you a humble curtsy as she carefully picks you up. "Pardon me sir but I'm afraid if we don't hurry, we'll be late for your meeting!" She says as she gently pick you up and places you in her palm as she begins to change your clothes. With surprising speed and accuracy. As soon as one piece of garment is taken away, another takes its place as you're left standing in a sort of royal military outfit. "Now that you're presentable sir, let's take you to the Strategy Room shall we?" She said as she began to exit the room and carry you away.

At first, you were to speechless to say anything as you were carried away by this giant hare. But after seeing how real everything felt....it couldn't have been a dream! As they exited the room. He couldn't believe what he was seeing as his once little apartment was now a huge castle! With more giant anthro guards, maids, and butlers, it was obvious that wherever you were now. Was nothing like the world you left behind! As you passed, some of the guards would give you a salute, while the maids couldn't help but curtsy and giggle as you walked by. You could even hear them whispering about how cute and handsome you were. Although at your size, a whisper was so loud that it was like they were saying it to your face. And hanging high above your head were Royal Flags, each flying the same proud looking symbol. A side shot of a human face, followed by a side shot of an anthro's face. As the two images are back to back along with a crown covering both of the sticthed picture's heads. "Uh....ma'am...just...just where am I?" You ask as it causes a chuckle from your maid.

"Oh sir. Surely you must be joking with me right? And for royalty to call me ma'am...hehehe...it's just never been done before sir." The maid laughed as everything was starting to make sense. The fancy clothes, the maids, the guards, all of this pointed to one thing. You had become royalty over night! Still...just how could that be ? A dozen questions filled your mind as you wanted to ask the Maid a few more question. Sadly, they would have to wait, as the bunny maid opens a door as high ranking military personal rose and stood at attention at your presence. You couldn't help but feel even smaller than you already were as you were placed on a marble table as the maid humbly left you to the meeting at hand.

Male and Female anthros alike were at attention and waiting for your orders as you couldn't help but smile nervously. "Uh...at...at ease everyone! P-Please....take a seat..." You say as they thank you and take their seats. "Sir. We are ready to enact your orders for today! Shall we continue our advancement to the East ? Or shall we send our troops to explore the oceans of the West?" A lion general asked as just one swipe of his hand could wipe out platoon of human soldiers. As you stand on the table, wondering what to say. A holographic map appears underneath you as you can see the position of your castle and your troops as it was time to make a decision.

You could take command and just go along with this. Learning about who serves you as you go. Besides, you're treated like a King by these people. Why question a good thing right?


Then again, if something is too good to be true....it usually is! Maybe it's best to let the Generals make the decisions while you head back into your quarters and figure out what's going on first?
15533222222222221.title: Follow the Leader...OR ELSE !!

15533222222222222.content: You are the only human in a world of macros. It's not so bad since everyone more or less treats you normally. You say more or less because for some reason macros of all ages and both sexes have nothing but intense burning love for you. Macros abosoultely adore everything about you from your appearance, voice, and your tiny size which has been called adorable on more than one occasion. You get everything free since everyone wants to be your best friend and earn your favor but all this love does have a downside. This has lead to many macros of both genders and sexual orientation to make it their life's goal to get into your pants. Most of the macros don't press the issue when you refuse but some do. The ones that do are the main problems. Your small size makes it impossible to stop them if they force themselves on you and even then they don't leave you alone. It's like they want to spend every single moment of their lives in your presence. You can only hope that isn't the case.
15533222222222222.title: Love

155332222222222221.content:
You awoke with a start. You sit up to get your bearings and wince as pain seeped through your body. Your entire body is sore for some reason. As you wipe the sleep from your eyes you notice that you're in a cave of sort. From a short distance away you can see light pouring in from the exit. You crawl towards it and shield your eyes from the light. When your eyes adjust to the light you are greeted by a sight most don't ever see. You find yourself standing in a forest of giant orange fuzzy stalks but that isn't the strangest thing. A pair of orange furred breasts the size of mountains rise up on either side of you. Through the miles long canyon formed by the breasts you can see the head of a humongous sized blonde haired fox woman sleeping peacefully. You turn around and see that the 'cave' was simply her hand lying upon her chest.

You sit down and try to process what's going on. Why are you on a giant fox woman? Why does she look so pleased? Why are you naked? Why is your body so sore and why is all this pain coming from your groin area... Ok. You think you might have pieced it together... Just then you hear a loud female sigh. It didn't come from the fox woman. You have to get to a better vantage point and the only bit of high ground around is...

You stand atop the massive breast taking in the sight before you. It must have been over an hour's worth of climbing. Her fur made it difficult to see anything so you had to climb atop her skyscraper sized nipple. The climb did give you time to collect your thoughts on the night before. You had gotten off work after getting ANOTHER raise from your boss. One of your co-workers offered to take you to the bar. His treat. As soon as you entered the building everyone wanted to sit near you and buy you a drink. You weren't even in there for ten minutes before you were thoroughly intoxicated. This fox woman you were standing atop of must have been someone you picked up in your drunken stupor.

You gaze over the fox woman's body and can't help but feel a bit proud of herself. The vixen's body is very curvaceous and puffed out in all the right places. You place her age somewhere in her 30s. You then hear the sigh from earlier again and turn to it's source. On the left side of the bed right next to the fox is a mouse girl. You recognize her as the on of the bartenders and judging from the content look on her face she must have drank a bit of you... You can only hope that on the right side isn't another girl. You turn around and are shocked to see there isn't a girl but a guy. Upon closer inspection you see it's you co-worker and 'best friend' Todd. The black furred wolf is sleeping peacefully his member still semi erect. You get the feeling that he used it a lot last night and not on these girls...
155332222222222221.title: Awkward Situation

155332222222222222.content:
You are the the king of a medieval realm where giant anthros are your advisors, knights, scholars, and subjects. You yourself ate immortal having been ruling since you could remember.

There are however groups of dark figures wanting to overthrow you, stomp you into oblivion, and take control. You can command your knights to deal with this threat in any way you choose, rather it be merciful or with an iron fist.

-Your knight consist primary of canies and felines with skills in both sword and hand to hand combat.
-Your advisors are mostly birds who think situations over carefully to carry out extreme tactics. They however can be cocky with thier status.
-Your scholars are a small group of lions and lioness who hold ancient wisdom and even knowledge of magic spells.

You also have aid from those not in your kingdom.
-The swamp tribes consist of frogs, toad's, and alligator/crocodile.
-The bear work lumbering and despite thier weight are effective fighters.
-The rabbits work as farmers but will fight for thier king.

Then you have the usurfurs anthros who wish to take the throne for themselves. Thier members include.
-Jis, the leader, a blue jay who was one of your advisors, but you banished him when you heard of his plans to overthrow you. He possesses a stone that can shrink things often shrinking his enemies and squishing them beneath his talons.
-Bern, a gorilla with massive strength. He joined the userfurs simply because he felt you belonged beneath his feet.
-Sinclair, A tigress who simply desires to be queen and has hypnotic powers.
Turl, a frog who is slightly insane and enjoys integrating shrunken enemies with his webbed feet.
155332222222222222.title: King of the Bigs

1553322222222222222.content: So there already been a lot of ideas of different scenarios like different time periods or anthro family with you part of them. But how about one where instead of the anthro already knows you and already know of the sheer size differences between you and them, they don't know of you or your small size? What i mean is that you got transported to their world somehow and need to get one of these living titans' attention. Now to be fair, you are indestructible, meaning that no matter what happens to you, you can't be hurt or kill. Think it's a good idea?
1553322222222222222.title: Unaware adventure time?

15533222222222222221.content:
One day your life changed so fast that in a blink of an eye as you were sitting on your bed to now ending up lost in a pitch dark place. You continued to voyage through the darkness trying to find a source of light. "Gosh where am I," you said to yourself as you continue walking until you started to hear a couple of noises and with that, you ran towards that direction but to due to your clumsiness you tripped and fell through a hole that leads to a very bright room. You began falling through the bright room as you soon realize where you at and what has happened. I didn't take you long to find out that you're the size of a speck of dust and are trapped in a world full of anthropomorphic animals.

You land with a thud onto a very soft fabric glad that you didn't die from that fall but that was only one problem as now you are lost in a world of colossal anthropomorphic animals. While you are busying panicking and wondering what you are going to do, you are unaware of a massive shadow towering of you. As you looked up you notice a very colossal and very muscular anthropomorphic Gorilla wearing a shirt that looks like it can break at any moment and a pair of pants that seem to be tight on him. "Oh god no" you shouted knowing what is going to happen as they turn around showing their very enormous yet fat bubble butt so you quickly began to run. Sadly due to your very miniature size, the colossal beast managed to sit on you unknowingly.

"I'm at Cafe de la Sol right now having a cup of coffee while waiting for him" responded the beast that sat on you and due to that, you realized that the person just so happens to be a male.
15533222222222222221.title: Unaware adventure time

155332222222222222212.content:
You tumble through a portal of some sort. And land with a thud amidst fabric. You can’t see anything as it’s pitch black, so you flounder around trying to make your way to the floor. The smell is of sweat and and stale air.

Finally the room is flooded with light and you look up in terror. A truly massive door is opening before you and the creature opening it is a godly anthropomorphic tiger. You gasp in awe. Then in terror you begin to turn and run as the tiger squats and starts to rummage around near you.

Looking around as you run you realize you have emerged in the sports equipment closet of an anthro frat house. You are surrounded by cleats, bats, balls and uniforms of massive sizes.

The tiger is grumbling and rummaging around but eventually you hear him say, ah there you are” you think he is reaching for you but soon realize he is just grabbing the pair of soccer socks you are atop.

He picks it up with you and tosses you into a duffle bag.
155332222222222222212.title: Unaware Frat Anthros

info.brief_description: A gentle giant anthro story, for those who like them absurdly huge.
info.description:
This story will contain huge, huge anthros. A mile tall is the minimum height allowed, and they can be any size larger. This story is also a gentle story, so things like stomping, vore, violence, or swearing should be kept to an absolute minimum, zero if possible. However, for the first time, I will allow sex in this interactive, as long as nobody overdoes it or puts it in every single situation. No gay stuff, please.

This is also a kind of "universe changing" story, although the only universe change will be at the very beginning. The main character will wake up one day to find himself or herself in a world that has at least one mega-sized anthro, and the anthro or anthros will have some sort of connection to the main character.

Other things:
-Do not end the story
-Do not create short "list" chapters. A list chapter is allowed if there is a good amount of plot before it
-Be bold; do not be afraid to create an entire universal situation in the beginning at one chapter; just simply say "continue this storyline" or "Other" in the choices. If you don't know what this means, just look at what I do
-I will reward gift points to good additions. The amount depends on how good they are.
-Have fun!
